excerpts: so I went with their most popular item, the korean steak sandwich.
korean steak.author: Alice W.
korean steak.review:
Hm...I was rather disappointed by the place. It's been sitting in my queue forever and I finally got a chance to try it out. The place is an ordinary looking convenience store, but with a deli counter. I wanted the katsu sandwich, but they were out of it so I went with their most popular item, the korean steak sandwich. I wanted it spicy and with kimchi. 

Lo the behold, $11.84 later (and that's just for the sandwich, no chips or drinks), I got my sandwich. The kimchi came in a small condiment sized container instead of on the actual sandwich. The verdict? Well, there was plenty of meat, a bit of shredded iceberg, some cheddar and indistinguishable sauce (suppose to be chili garlic sauce and garlic aioli). There were also some pickled stuff in there, but it was hard to make it out.

My overall impression was that it was good, but not $11.84 good. I mean, if someone threw it in my direction, I wouldn't run the other way, but what they charge, especially considering it's the Mission, is pretty ridiculous. I don't mind paying $20 for a fois gras sandwich from Naked Lunch, but I just don't see the value of this place. Maybe they used great meat for the sandwich, but it certainly doesn't show. The meat was heavily marinated so I just tasted the sweetness of the meat and nothing else.

excerpts: and I have admit they sure do live up to the hype of having thee best "Korean Steak sandwich".
korean steak.author: Desiree B.
korean steak.review:
I've been to Rhea's 3 times now and I have admit they sure do live up to the hype of having thee best "Korean Steak sandwich". 

The bread is perfectly toasted...crunchy on the outside, soft in the inside. 
Bulgolgi is sweet and tender just as it should be. 
I normally get my sandwich at a medium spicy level, which is pretty spicy.
The add-ons (lettuce, jalepenos, pickled onions, regular onions, aioli, & I think sirracha) all compliment the sandwich very well. 

The gentleman at the counter was very friendly during my last visit which was on Sunday (7/29). Thanks for the great service! 

Overall, a great place to have lunch on a sunny day in the mission district.

excerpts: The Korean Steak sandwich is the BEST sandwich on earth!
An amazing combination of distinct flavors all coexisting together and making for a delightful experience.
korean steak.author: sshawzam s.
korean steak.review:
The Korean Steak sandwich is the BEST sandwich on earth! An amazing combination of distinct flavors all coexisting together and making for a delightful experience. The meat is super tender and the bread--sweet French roll--is perfect. 

In the words of a famous former governor: I'll be back!!!

excerpts: I ordered the Korean steak sandwiches all around for the office I work at and we all loved it.
korean steak.author: Cel Y.
korean steak.review:
Yum!! This place is amazing. I ordered the Korean steak sandwiches all around for the office I work at and we all loved it. 

I will order from here again and try something else next time.

excerpts: Oh well, we got the Korean Steak Sandwich.
OMGAH.
It was to die for!
With kimchi and a good deal of flavor, the sandwich hit the spot.

We paired it with some cheap champagne (the lady working at the cash register told us which one was the best flavor for the cheapest price) and we waltzed on over to Dolores Park, eating and basking in the sun.
korean steak.author: Bryan H.
korean steak.review:
Ambiance:  More than anything else, this is your typical California liquor store/deli market -- except for a few features.  One, there is an actual bar along the perimeter for sitting and eating.  I found this to be a very nice feature for those who were hoping to eat their sandwich right away while it was still hot.  Second, the place was pretty dang clean...  which, you know, is always nice.  No bathroom on site though; they have some sort of agreement with an establishment across the street, because they told us to go use their bathroom.  Ask them!

Service:  VERY nice people here.  Note:  If you're hoping for a quick in and out order and pickup, think again.  We came here on a Saturday and the wait for sandwiches was 45 minutes.  Being that the sandwich was the sole and singular purpose of our visit, we waited.  It was worth it.

Food:  We came for the Katsu Sandwich, but it has REGRETTABLY been discontinued. ARGH.  Oh well, we got the Korean Steak Sandwich. OMGAH.  It was to die for!  With kimchi and a good deal of flavor, the sandwich hit the spot.  We paired it with some cheap champagne (the lady working at the cash register told us which one was the best flavor for the cheapest price) and we waltzed on over to Dolores Park, eating and basking in the sun.  Twas bliss.

I marked down one star for the wait, because they changed their menu to get rid of the Katsu, and because of the lack of bathroom on site (none of which can be helped, but yea).  All in all, the service was good and the location was clean and pleasant. I'll be coming here for my badass-sandwich-fix again VERY soon.

4 out of 5!

excerpts: I had both the Korean steak and Chicken Katsu here
(split with someone else, not all by myself!).
They were both really yummy.
They were really big though
so if I were just getting something for me, I could probably stretch out a sandwich into two meals.
They are also kinda messy to eat.
So definitely something to eat sitting down at home or somewhere where you can easily clean up or don't mind being a mess afterwards.
korean steak.author: Jean K.
korean steak.review:
Aaah... a hipster sandwich shop inside a corner store.  I'm surprised this trend isn't making headlines in the NYT.  Surely this is right up there with food trucks.  Luckily, where food trucks can be hit or miss, these sandwich shops are more of a sure thing.  I had both the Korean steak and Chicken Katsu here (split with someone else, not all by myself!).  They were both really yummy.  They were really big though so if I were just getting something for me, I could probably stretch out a sandwich into two meals.  They are also kinda messy to eat.  So definitely something to eat sitting down at home or somewhere where you can easily clean up or don't mind being a mess afterwards.  I do not recommend these sandwiches for hiking or a in-flight meal.

It's not clear the procedure when you get here so let me explain.  Pick up slips of paper to the immediate left of the door at the register.  Write down what you want, pay, then drop it off in the sandwich area.  It takes about 10 minutes to get your food.

excerpts: Case in point: two weeks ago, I ordered the Korean Steak Sandwich.
Yes, it was delicious, and yes, I'll admit, it is my responsibility to have read the menu completely, but I was surprised to find out that it came with CHEESE on it.
Cheese is one of those things that I expect the shop to say, "Would you like cheese with that?" or  "What KIND of cheese would you like on that?"
But, I didn't say anything about cheese, they sure as heck didn't ASK me anything about cheese, and lo and behold, my Korean Steak Sandwich arrives with American Cheese on it.
But, I didn't say anything about cheese, they sure as heck didn't ASK me anything about cheese, and lo and behold, my Korean Steak Sandwich arrives with American Cheese on it.
(Just in case you think I'm being a douche-bag here, I submit that it is pretty reasonable to assume that a Korean-style steak sandwich would NOT have cheese on it.
They don't really do cheese in Korea.
And, it's not called the Korean Cheese Steak sandwich, it's called Korean Steak sandwich.)
And, it's not called the Korean Cheese Steak sandwich, it's called Korean Steak sandwich.)
korean steak.author: FoodDudeS F.
korean steak.review:
Love their sandwiches, love their creativity, but .....  4 stars not 5 because somewhere along the line the customer service aspect is slipping.

In their effort to be all modern and 21st Century and computerized, they seem to have lost a little bit of the human touch.  This place is always crowded, always busy, so it makes sense to order via phone or internet, but be forewarned: you better know EXACTLY what you want, because the folks who answer the phone are not going to take the time to hold your hand and guide you.  

Case in point: two weeks ago, I ordered the Korean Steak Sandwich.  Yes, it was delicious, and yes, I'll admit, it is my responsibility to have read the menu completely, but I was surprised to find out that it came with CHEESE on it.  Cheese is one of those things that I expect the shop to say, "Would you like cheese with that?" or  "What KIND of cheese would you like on that?"  But, I didn't say anything about cheese, they sure as heck didn't ASK me anything about cheese, and lo and behold, my Korean Steak Sandwich arrives with American Cheese on it.  (Just in case you think I'm being a douche-bag here, I submit that it is pretty reasonable to assume that a Korean-style steak sandwich would NOT have cheese on it.  They don't really do cheese in Korea.  And, it's not called the Korean Cheese Steak sandwich, it's called Korean Steak sandwich.)

Okay, whatever, my bad, fine.  But then, today, I phone in an order for the Valencia, their totally awesome turkey-based sandwich.  Do I have their menu memorized?  No, I do not.  Does the guy answering the phone ask me if I want it Hot or Cold?  No, he does not.  Do I know that I'm supposed to specify that I want it Hot?  No, I do not.  So, what do I get?  A cold sandwich when I could've had a hot one.  Is there a big difference between hot, delicious MELTY cheese on your sandwich, and warm, delicious TOASTY bread versus cold slabs of solid cheese on room temperature bread?  COME ON!!  You know there's a big difference.  One is good, one is frickin' GREAT.  

So, again, sure, I'll take responsibility for making assumptions, but i think, at 8, 9, and 10 bucks a sandwich it's NOT unreasonable to expect that the person taking my order might use the following phrases:  "Would you like that HOT or COLD?"  "What kind of cheese would you like with that?"  I don't think that's asking too much, do you?  

Lessons learned:  1. assume cheese on every sandwich and specify which kind you want, otherwise expect boring American, even on a sandwich that doesn't need cheese at all (the Korean)  2. If you want it Hot, you better ask for it Hot, because the people answering the phone are apparently too busy to take the time to ask you.

Come on, Rhea's!  Don't just be really GOOD, but frickin' EXCELLENT.  Hold your customer service to the same high standard as your sandwiches and ingredients.    Thanks!!!

The korean steak sandwich here renewed my appreciation for being a carnivore. yes, mmm... juicy, delicious, flavorful meat.. I usually don't eat that much red meat, but for Rhea's korean steak sandwich, its a different story and i'll be more than happy to make that exception any day. 

a quick story: the other day I went for the sandwich but they'd ran out of acme rolls and couldn't make the steak sandwiches, only the "drier" normal ones on regular bread -sad and disappointed like a 5 year old, I mulled over the menu as I attempted to find another acceptable substitute for what I came in with my heart (or should I say stomach?) set on. but THEN! there was hope.. they'd got more soft rolls in..! not acme, but still, GOOD ENOUGH. and off he goes with making my sandwich! rode home in a hurry with it, dropped all my things down, and unwrapped the goodness that was the korean steak sandwich from Rhea's.

excerpts: The hefty Korean steak sandwich ($7.95) is a lovingly layered masterpiece starting at the bottom with a lovely, lightly toasted, chewy organic Acme sweet roll (like ciabatta), followed by garlic aioli, a layer of hot sauce (you can specify how spicy you'd like your sandwich), thick slices of cheddar cheese, a bold, juicy, beefy layer of thin marinated ribeye, pickled, grilled and fresh onions, crunchy vinegary pickled jalapenos and shredded iceberg lettuce.
It's a flavor and texture explosion of the best kind.
I noticed after I ordered my sandwich that they have Korean steak tacos, 2 for $6.
Yum.
You can also get other sandwiches on Acme bread (good bread makes a difference).

korean steak.author: Lolia S.
korean steak.review:
Rhea's looks unassuming enough but inside this Korean owned convenience store, you'll find the best Korean sandwiches in town.  

The hefty Korean steak sandwich ($7.95) is a lovingly layered masterpiece starting at the bottom with a lovely, lightly toasted, chewy organic Acme sweet roll (like ciabatta), followed by garlic aioli, a layer of hot sauce (you can specify how spicy you'd like your sandwich), thick slices of cheddar cheese, a bold, juicy, beefy layer of thin marinated ribeye, pickled, grilled and fresh onions, crunchy vinegary pickled jalapenos and shredded iceberg lettuce. It's a flavor and texture explosion of the best kind.  Minor areas for improvement: the cheese was soft but not melted, the beef wasn't warm and I wonder how it would taste with some kim chi.

I noticed after I ordered my sandwich that they have Korean steak tacos, 2 for $6.  Yum.  You can also get other sandwiches on Acme bread (good bread makes a difference).  Standard deli sandwiches with Boar's Head deli meat are $5.

The inside is your typical convenience store only cleaner and nicer.  They have a counter if you want to eat your sandwich there.  They carry what 7-Eleven does (milk, cheese, ice cream, cereal, cookies, candy, juice, wine) but they also have gourmet cheeses, Cowgirl Creamery crackers and jars of homemade kim chi (made by the Korean guy's mom).

Bookmark this place.  You won't regret it.

excerpts: I tried both the korean steak sandwich and the katsu sandwich, and to my surprise preferred the katsu.

korean steak.author: Lisa K.
korean steak.review:
Excellent sandwiches! I tried both the korean steak sandwich and the katsu sandwich, and to my surprise preferred the katsu. Both had a nice spicy kick to them without having other flavors overwhelmed. I thought the katsu came together better with a great crunch from the pork and the slaw. It was also better constructed and held together well. I don't like red onions so we got them on the side of the steak sandwich, and I have to admit it was better with onions (which were pickled, so I do prefer those to raw red onions). I'd also requested it without the cheese, because that just seemed like too much, but I have to say that I do now have a lot of faith in their sandwich ideals, so in the future I'd probably go with every topping they recommend.

Next time I would ask for them to go a bit lighter on the aioli - it's good, but a little goes a long way. I'd look forward to having the katsu again or trying their other sandwiches!

We came here on Sunday around noon and ordered two sandwiches, the Korean Steak and The Freak.  The cashier told us it was about a 15min wait.  (It was shorter, which was nice!)  We took the sandwiches home to eat.  Here's what I thought:

The Korean Steak (medium spicy)- Flavors were really good.  Totally didn't expect cheddar to work with Korean marinated beef, but it really does! Also nice they really don't skimp on the beef.  I'd order it again.

The Freak-Pastrami and kimchi seemed like a pretty strange combo but I thought it worked together fine.  The pastrami was pretty good and plentiful.  There wasn't that much kimchi and the kimchi was more sour than spicy but it seemed to work well in the sandwich.  It seemed a little sweeter than I liked.  I actually couldn't figure out why...maybe the bread?  Some sauce? Not bad, and pretty interesting but I might try something else next time.

I like the flavors so I'd come back, but I think next time I might eat there or close by since the sandwiches were a little soggy because I brought them home.

excerpts: The Korean steak is also a winner - tender, flavorful bulgolgi piled high with kimchi and cheddar and also comes in an Acme roll.
korean steak.author: Betty W.
korean steak.review:
YUM. A small convenience store paired with an unassuming deli on the side that serves up huge sandwiches piled high with deliciousness. Also available is their homemade kimchi that comes in mason jars. 

The Katsu (pork or chicken both available) sandwich is a crunchy, meaty, beauty of a mess layered in between beds of fresh, colorful slaw and enveloped in a deliciously chewy crackly soft Acme roll. The Korean steak is also a winner - tender, flavorful bulgolgi piled high with kimchi and cheddar and also comes in an Acme roll. You can choose your level of spice - and spicy definitely has a delicious kick to it.

Definitely call your order in ahead of time (30-40 minutes on a weekend, when you're definitely not going to be the only one with the brilliant idea to nurse your hangover at Rhea's). 

Also, ~$8-9 for a sandwich? JESUS. Luckily though, it's kinda worth it.

excerpts: I had the Valencia, a taste of the Korean steak (quality steak, perfect spiciness, and amazing fresh slaw) and my new friend at the counter (it's cozy in there) was raving about his veggie chicken sammie.
korean steak.author: Joy P.
korean steak.review:
Like some of the other reviewers, I saw Rhea's on that PBS show, Check Please, Bay Area. All of the reviewers on the show loved it, but I was still somewhat skeptical. A liquor store deli? Really? How good can a sandwich really be? 

I finally tried this place out last weekend. Simply put, I had one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life. Oh the bread, and the garlic aioli, and the quality of ingredients. Sooo good!!!! I had the Valencia, a taste of the Korean steak (quality steak, perfect spiciness, and amazing fresh slaw) and my new friend at the counter (it's cozy in there) was raving about his veggie chicken sammie. The combos sound a little odd, but they just work, so go for one of their creations. 

Yes, it is in a liquor store, but it's very clean, and run by a super friendly staff. Eat at the counter (awesome people watching), sit on the benches outside, or grab it to go and head over to Dolores park (more awesome people watching). Try this place out, you won't regret it!!

He asked me about my dietary restrictions and hobbies, ultimately deciding my best option would be to go with the Korean steak. I trusted him, and I'm sure glad I did. Bless the gentleman with the beard!

excerpts:
If you go here, get the Korean Steak Sandwich (or don't, they have a bunch of other great sandwiches). 
I'll be going back here to try some of the other sandwiches listed, but I was pretty impressed with the Korean Steak they had. 

I'll be going back here to try some of the other sandwiches listed, but I was pretty impressed with the Korean Steak they had.
korean steak.author: Nick E.
korean steak.review:
If you go here, get the Korean Steak Sandwich (or don't, they have a bunch of other great sandwiches). I'll be going back here to try some of the other sandwiches listed, but I was pretty impressed with the Korean Steak they had. 

It was a lovely sandwich and I let it sit in the bag for a bit before eating it. Let those juices soak up into the bread and you're in for a treat :)

Pricing was nice, and they have a great selection of kettle chips along with standard tall boys/sodas. Nice little bench outside to sit and eat/mingle when the day is rain free :)

Great little spot on the corner, but I forget the hours sometimes and end up craving a sandwich at 6pm only to forget they close the sandwich shop at 5 M-Th :(

excerpts: Finally I managed to be there on-time once to get their famous Korean Steak sandwich.
Every single previous try, I dealt with a sold out sign on that item.
It was really tasty with a nice kick of spice, I would say great quality per price.
It is a supermarket, so you should not expect an ambiance or service there, but a great stop for a snack if you in the Valencia area in SF.

excerpts: Order the Korean steak (spicy).

korean steak.review:
The price is right. The food is tight. [...crap I'm about to say blah, blah, take a massive bite] anyway-

Look:
Order the Katsu. Order the Valencia Street. Order the Korean steak (spicy). YUM.

As if Rhea's didn't have tons of reviews already....but DAAAAAAAAAAYUUUUUM the Korean Steak Sandwich deserves all the acclaimed praise!  It's delicious. Let me repeat that again with a little more emphasis, IT IS DELICIOUS. The beef is nicely flavored with honey, soy sauce and other spices. excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich here is surreal and this place has quickly become my favorite sandwich shop in the Mission.
korean steak.author: Corey J.
korean steak.review: Went here for a late lunch and was surprised to find a little deli counter inside an otherwise unremarkable convenience store. The Korean steak sandwich here is surreal and this place has quickly become my favorite sandwich shop in the Mission.

excerpts: While the Korean steak sandwich was delicious (good Korean saucey meat, crispy roll, spicy sauce, pickled peppers, etc.), I'm not sure if it was worth the hype, the 25 minute wait, or the $9 price tag.
korean steak.author: Alicia C.
korean steak.review:
I don't get it.

The honey and I had been looking forward to trying Rhea's deli after seeing it featured on Check Please! Bay Area, but we were ultimately disappointed.  Maybe we expected too much after the oohs and ahhs, almost 5-star Yelp rating, and after seeing the long line there the weekend after the Check Please episode aired.  

While the Korean steak sandwich was delicious (good Korean saucey meat, crispy roll, spicy sauce, pickled peppers, etc.), I'm not sure if it was worth the hype, the 25 minute wait, or the $9 price tag.  With drink, we spent $12!

I'd be okay with the price point and the wait if this was a sit-down establishment, but it's anything but.  Tasty sandwich, but overhyped--I feel like Yelpers love this one because of its earnest, hipster, hole-in-the-wall-ness.

excerpts: Had their Korean Steak sandwich for lunch Thursday
and wow, I really liked it!
korean steak.author: Roy N.
korean steak.review:
Had their Korean Steak sandwich for lunch Thursday and wow, I really liked it!  This is another true foodie find that I never would have discovered on my own and once again another way in which Yelp has enriched my life.  

The guy at the counter was super cool and actually came outside to double-check with me regarding how I wanted the kim chi on the sandwich.  He genuinely cared and that really meant a lot to me.  I loved how they had an order form which helped make the order process a lot easier...I ordered mine with provolone.  Not big on aioli (hate mayo) so I ordered it without, but I definitely went with the chili garlic sauce which for me really added to the experience.

Certainly one of the most unusual and most memorable sandwiches I've had in a long time and I loved how all the ingredients came together.  Munching on this sandwich in my car on a rainy day made me really happy...it fogged my windows!  Now that's a great sandwich.

Looking forward to trying some of their other sandwiches as well, but I have a feeling that the next time I'm back there I'll most likely be ordering the same thing since I enjoyed it so much.  Sandwich heaven!

excerpts: Get the Korean steak sandwich.
Just do it.
Disregard whatever anyone tells you, order it, keep an open mind and take it straight to the dome.
Personally I found it awesome and tasty to the point where I was eating every scrap that fell out of it and
every sauce soaked chunk of bread I missed.
At $9 it's maybe a buck or two over what might normally suffice for a great sandwich
korean steak.author: Steven R.
korean steak.review:
I'm gonna guess you're probably like me.

You've been here before, usually after 11pm, and just to snatch up a few 6-packs or tallboys before heading to a house party in the neighborhood.  While you were paying, you noticed there was a deli counter to the right. 

"Oh."  You said to yourself, thinking little of it because it seems every other crusty Mission liquor store has some kind of odd deli counter, functional or not.

Then one day you decide that maybe you should actually try the deli because hey you've only ever bought beer here, you're tired of burritos and Ali Baba's sounds less than enticing.  Well, I've caught a live one here.

Get the Korean steak sandwich.  Just do it.  Disregard whatever anyone tells you, order it, keep an open mind and take it straight to the dome.  Personally I found it awesome and tasty to the point where I was eating every scrap that fell out of it and every sauce soaked chunk of bread I missed.  At $9 it's maybe a buck or two over what might normally suffice for a great sandwich but damn this thing is tasty.

I have the Diamond Heights (brisket) sandwich sitting on my counter right now and will eat it in about 50 minutes when my hunger strikes again.

excerpts: I've only tried the Korean steak sandwich,sans cheese and it is extremely yum...just the right amount of spicyness to make it exciting and wonderfully overstuffed.
Eat it as soon as you can.
I made the mistake of carrying it around for an hour and the bottom bread was soggy from all the delicious juice...
acme roll no less.
It would be hard to go into Rhea's and not order this again!
korean steak.author: Bleep S.
korean steak.review: I've only tried the Korean steak sandwich,sans cheese and it is extremely yum...just the right amount of spicyness to make it exciting and wonderfully overstuffed.Eat it as soon as you can.I made the mistake of carrying it around for an hour and the bottom bread was soggy from all the delicious juice...acme roll no less. It would be hard to go into Rhea's and not order this again!

excerpts: Well, the korean steak is, I've had that both times.
korean steak.author: Lord R.
korean steak.review:
*My review is about the overall service*
The sandwiches speak for themselves. They are very good. Well, the korean steak is, I've had that both times.

The first time I ordered a sandwich for delivery and got the wrong one, they didn't make a really strong effort to correct it, but they then sent out the right one, but in the turnaround I had to wait about 30 extra minutes. "Boo Hoo", I know, but turns out i was starving!

The second time, i figure I live fairly close, I 'll call ahead and pick the food up, makes it easier on them, easier on me .. not at all. After waiting around for 20 minutes! It was clear they had lost my order. I was asked "did you get your sandwich?" I replied "I just like hanging out in a liquor store in the middle of my lunch hour- no I didn't get anything." This was overheard by the manger/owner/overseer, whatever the guy is, who didn't do anything to correct it, or offer a "sorry about that" at least.

So, good sandwiches, hopefully they can work on their customer service a little

excerpts: i usually go for the valencia or korean steak.
if they just improved their customer service, 5stars easily.
korean steak.author: Gionni B.
korean steak.review:
im seeing a consensus reading the other reviews, but had to add my two cents cus this has happened entirely too many times lately.

sandwiches are AMAZING. i usually go for the valencia or korean steak. if they just improved their customer service, 5stars easily. i prefer rhea's sammiches over ike's.

big BUT: i usually call in my sammich order cus i dont want to wait 30min you sometimes have to wait when ordering there. 6months ago there was no issue doing this. everything would go according to plan. call the order in, go pick it up, enjoy sammich. 

over the past 6 months, ill call my order in. person taking the order will say 25min. that is fine. that gives me time to use the bathroom, put on some clothes, finish my bowl :), and have a leisurely 6block skate down valencia to rhea's. most likely, the weather is perfect. there is a smile on my face. i have learned to give them at least 10min more than what they estimate so that i am not standing around waiting. BUT WHY DO YOU TAKE PHONE ORDERS IF YOU DO NOT HONOR THEM?? i ordered my sammich on the phone over half an hour ago. you are really not BEGINNING to make it til now? its not like its even that busy in there. maybe 10 people milling around. NONE of which had ordered their sammiches in advance on the phone. i circumvented the wait for a reason. so why BS me on the phone? 

a few times, the girl in glasses/tattoos behind the register even had the AUDACITY to complain about customers who were impatiently waiting for their sammiches. she could be heard mumbling about the aioli and how long it takes to make a sammich. lets see here: there are at least 3 people pumping out sammiches behind that counter. lets say it takes a few minutes to make each one. there should not be a backup or people waiting around; ESPECIALLY NOT IF THEY PHONED THEIR ORDER IN 30MIN AGO.

sorry to rant so hard. i truly enjoy their sammiches. but the customer service here has just been terrible lately. bottomline: DONT TAKE PHONE ORDERS IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO HONOR THEM. simple business ethics 101

excerpts: With all the reviews about the Korean Steak Sandwich, I had to give it a try and it was pretty damn good.
Such an unassuming place to make great sandwiches
but that's what makes this place good.
It takes a little while to get your sandwich made so prepare for that.
The sandwich is smaller than what I thought it was going to be but what it lacked in overall size it made up in taste as it was just the right amount of spice with great meat.
Will definitely stop by again and recommend to my friends.
korean steak.author: Blake B.
korean steak.review: With all the reviews about the Korean Steak Sandwich, I had to give it a try and it was pretty damn good.  Such an unassuming place to make great sandwiches but that's what makes this place good.  It takes a little while to get your sandwich made so prepare for that.  The sandwich is smaller than what I thought it was going to be but what it lacked in overall size it made up in taste as it was just the right amount of spice with great meat. excerpts: I tried the first thing listed on the menu - Korean Steak Sandwich - and it did not disappoint.
AT
ALL.
It was spicy, the meat was well-marinated, and the portion size extremely generous.
I recommend taking a companion to Dolores park and splitting the sandwich with someone.
korean steak.author: May I.
korean steak.review:
When the line at Ike's gets too ridiculously long (and it always does), never fear -- there's a small liquor store/deli that is near Dolores Park that will satisfy all your munchies! And the place is so nondescript - your heart will smile from finding a real hidden gem.

I tried the first thing listed on the menu - Korean Steak Sandwich - and it did not disappoint. AT ALL.  It was spicy, the meat was well-marinated, and the portion size extremely generous. I recommend taking a companion to Dolores park and splitting the sandwich with someone. As ambitious as I was, I couldn't finish it on my own.

I don't know if our timing was right but we didn't call ahead nor did we wait longer than 10 minutes for our sandwiches on a sunny Saturday around 1pm. The easy and convenient experience was just the icing on the cake.

Can't wait to adventure back and try something new!  (and eat this again...)

excerpts: Fabulous  Korean Steak Sandwich.
Very friendly and helpful staff.
Large variety of beverages.
Even if there are only two people waiting for a sandwich it seems to take forever to get your order.
Takes a long time to make a sandwich
At one time there was a bench out in front where you could eat your sandwich and watch the characters of Valencia street pass by.
The bench has disappeared and so has the fun of people watching while eating your sandwich.

excerpts: The Korean Steak sandwich is a fine sandwich, but is not worth $13.09 (including tax).
I used to be a regular, but I'm not going back.
The regular price increases finally convinced me to go elsewhere.
korean steak.author: Jared B.
korean steak.review: The Korean Steak sandwich is a fine sandwich, but is not worth $13.09 (including tax). I used to be a regular, but I'm not going back. The regular price increases finally convinced me to go elsewhere.

excerpts: , it is amazing, as well as (obvi) the Korean steak sandwich.
korean steak.author: John D.
korean steak.review:
Based on sandwiches alone these guys get 5 stars for sure, hands down, they are my favorite sandwich shop in all of SF.  I love their Valencia St cold, it is amazing, as well as (obvi) the Korean steak sandwich.  

I love these guys' sandwiches so much, I wanted to have them served at my wedding-- well, not at the actual wedding but at the picnic lunch the next day.  Unfortunately, over the course of about 3 months, I stopped in to the deli in person 3 different times to ask about whether or not they could accommodate an order of about 50 sandwiches on a sunday morning at about 11am.  Each time I was told I needed to talk to a manager (who wasn't there), and I gave them my info, but never received a call.  I emailed them my request as well, but never heard back, no response whatsoever.  I understand they are super busy (duh, their sandwiches are killer), but it would have helped with my planning if I knew ahead of time they would not have worked out.

Keep up the killer work on the sandwiches, guys, but you should step it up on the customer service.

excerpts: As noted by a ton of other Yelpers, the Korean Steak Sandwich is also worth the trip, but can be a little bit of a mess at the end.
korean steak.author: Madhu P.
korean steak.review:
Rhea's Deli (pronounced like Ray's Deli) is a pretty unassuming corner market but don't be fooled, those hipsters behind the deli counter know how to make a serious sando that would give Ike Shehadeh a run for this money.

My personal favorite is the Pork Katsu Sandwich. The lightly fried and breaded pork is nicely complemented with crunchy coleslaw and a spicy, tangy dressing. As noted by a ton of other Yelpers, the Korean Steak Sandwich is also worth the trip, but can be a little bit of a mess at the end. My girlfriend really likes their vegetarian sandwiches, but they've also got a fake bbq sandwich that looks pretty legit.

On weekdays the wait tends to be around 10-15min, but if you're headed there on the weekend I would recommend calling in your order.

excerpts: but I still remember how satisfied and happy I felt while I was savoring Rhea's Korean Steak Sandwich under SF's abnormally sunny and blue Friday skies.
korean steak.author: Mindy C.
korean steak.review:
It's been one week and I've had many meals in between, but I still remember how satisfied and happy I felt while I was savoring Rhea's Korean Steak Sandwich under SF's abnormally sunny and blue Friday skies. Perched on one of the benches right outside the unassuming liquor storefront of Rhea's, I had a hard time deciding if I should quickly devour the awesome sandwich or slowly dissect the sandwich to understand why this sandwich is so AWESOME.

The meat is not only authentically flavorful but TENDER. It's not tough or chewy so you wont get the awkward trailing mouth full of meat as you pull away from a bite.

The house pickled red onions are a wonderful addition to the sandwich. I personally like vinegared anything (love sunonomo!) but have never had vinegared ONIONS! It works magic here.

The organic ACME roll is crispy and light. It provides a great base for the flavors in between to shine. 

The people who works here are also very friendly and it seems like they truly enjoy producing delicious sandwiches. I love how they also have a great selection of drinks. They have a huge selection of ITO EN teas!

Remember to call ahead to place you order and get in the queue! I can't wait to come back to try the other sandwiches.

excerpts: That korean steak sandwich is delicious.
There was a bit of wait but nothing too bad.
I will definitely be here again.
korean steak.author: Christine H.
korean steak.review: I have to agree with everyone. That korean steak sandwich is delicious. There was a bit of wait but nothing too bad. I will definitely be here again.

excerpts: unimpressed with the korean steak sandwich.
korean steak.author: Jeffry C.
korean steak.review:
unimpressed with the korean steak sandwich.  at almost $11 i don't feel like i'm getting my money's worth

people are nice though! A for service

excerpts: The sandwich (Korean steak) was great.
Beautifully fresh roll.
Delicious, tender meat.
Nicely sauced.
korean steak.author: David G.
korean steak.review:
I heard about this place recently and gave it a try for Thursday lunch. I showed up about 11:25 (the deli opens at 11:30), put in my order, and waited. And waited. And waited.

I got my sandwich at 11:45. 15 minutes for a sandwich. There was one guy in front of me when I came in.

The sandwich (Korean steak) was great. Beautifully fresh roll. Delicious, tender meat. Nicely sauced.Just the right amount of spiciness. 

Good eats, just be prepared to wait.

excerpts: The Korean steak Sandwich is delicious, only don't get it twisted, it doesn't cost no $8.45 as listed on Yelp and other places online.
They charge $11 dollars for it now.
Yeah, there are no discounts left on Valencia street my friends.
korean steak.author: Alex M.
korean steak.review: The Korean steak Sandwich is delicious, only don't get it twisted, it doesn't cost no $8.45 as listed on Yelp and other places online.  They charge $11 dollars for it now.  Yeah, there are no discounts left on Valencia street my friends.

excerpts: Just finished a monster Korean steak sandwich, good and spicy!
The cheddar cheese seemed like an odd idea, but I ended up liking it.
korean steak.author: Eric S.
korean steak.review:
Just finished a monster Korean steak sandwich, good and spicy! The cheddar cheese seemed like an odd idea, but I ended up liking it. My wife's vegetarian barbecue "chicken" sandwich was great too - sweet, tangy, and tasted a lot like chicken...

Service is quick and pleasant, and they make and sell their own Kimchi. (I can't vouch for its authenticity, but it's delicious, and beats trekking down to Kukje in Daly City.)

excerpts: I'm also not sure what all the fuss is about for the Korean Steak Sandwich.
The bread was good, but the rest was just OK.
There was also way too much lettuce.
I ordered the "mild" -- I'd call it a medium anywhere else.
korean steak.author: Paul L.
korean steak.review:
I'm also not sure what all the fuss is about for the Korean Steak Sandwich. The bread was good, but the rest was just OK. There was also way too much lettuce. I ordered the "mild" -- I'd call it a medium anywhere else. I'm guessing that the "hot" would blow your head off.

I might try other sandwiches of theirs at some point, but I'm not rushing back.

excerpts: Rhea's Korean steak sandwich is as good as it gets.
I was skeptical at first, but once you take your first bite you'll see that the meat, chili spread and kimchee really do go together on a roll.
korean steak.author: Carol S.
korean steak.review:
Rhea's Korean steak sandwich is as good as it gets.  I was skeptical at first, but once you take your first bite you'll see that the meat, chili spread and kimchee really do go together on a roll.  It's not cheap but you can share it.

I just wish there are more spots to eat in the market, it's always packed when I go.

excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich is everything I could wish for in a sandwich...
Flavorful marinated steak, spicy sauce, grilled onions and pickles.
ACME bread tops it off.
Perfectly balanced and assembled!
The spicy sweet aioli will have you wanting more!
korean steak.author: Christine P.
korean steak.review: The Korean steak sandwich is everything I could wish for in a sandwich... Flavorful marinated steak, spicy sauce, grilled onions and pickles. ACME bread tops it off. Perfectly balanced and assembled! The spicy sweet aioli will have you wanting more!

excerpts: Its a toss-up for me ... between the Korean Steak Sandwich or Katsu Sandwich (pork, chicken).
korean steak.author: J B.
korean steak.review:
With so many great sandwich places, why would you go here?  That's what I thought the first five times my wife asked me to check it out.

But after the first time, I'm liking it a lot.  The sandwiches are tasty and creative.  Kinda like Ike's but with a Kung Fu Panda flair.

Its a toss-up for me ... between the Korean Steak Sandwich or Katsu Sandwich (pork, chicken).  Both thoroughly satisfying.

The guys at counter are relaxed and friendly.  Great value for food.  No ambiance, but half way through a sandwich ... you are already in a mild food coma. :)

excerpts: Of course I ordered the Korean Steak BBQ Sandwich [~$8], medium spicy!
korean steak.author: Rahil P.
korean steak.review:
The place is basically a convenience store with a food stand inside of it.

The first time I got there, the food portion was closed! It closes every other Monday for cleaning.

I came back the next day. Of course I ordered the Korean Steak BBQ Sandwich [~$8], medium spicy! I did my research.

[sweet?] Marinated Korean BBQ, cheddar cheese, grilled onion, raw onion, lettuce, some spicy sauce mixture (crushed red peppers), sandwiched between a french roll (ran out of sweet rolls). I'm loving the fusion here. The mix of sweet and spicy ingredients was confusing to me, it threw me off. I still devoured it, but I wish it were one way or the other. I'm not sure which ingredient was sweet, but maybe ordering it either mild or spicy would help.

excerpts: When we went, there was quite a line but their Korean Steak Sandwich was completely worth $10 and the 20 minute wait.
korean steak.author: Athena T.
korean steak.review: Great little place! Who would have ever guessed a little liquor store could boast a deli that makes such outstanding sandwiches?! When we went, there was quite a line but their Korean Steak Sandwich was completely worth $10 and the 20 minute wait.

excerpts: Very tasty korean steak sandwich
; it was huge (I only ate half the sandwich and was full), spicy (my lips were tingling!), and delicious.
I'm excited to go back and try their other sandwiches.
I recommend calling your order ahead, so you just run in and quickly pick it up.
korean steak.author: Erin H.
korean steak.review: Very tasty korean steak sandwich; it was huge (I only ate half the sandwich and was full), spicy (my lips were tingling!), and delicious. I'm excited to go back and try their other sandwiches. I recommend calling your order ahead, so you just run in and quickly pick it up.

excerpts: I got the Korean steak sandwich
cuz that's what's hot in the streets.
Not only hot in the streets, but it got me hot in the pants.
HOT damn my loins yearn for this sandwich.
It brought me on a trip.
Had the asian-esqe flavor I've only experienced at King Foot Subs, combined with awesome Dutch Crunch bread.
Those two addends equate to a flavor smash I have yet to experience from any other sandwich.
korean steak.author: Alvin P.
korean steak.review:
Another dynamite sandwich spot located inside a market/store. I was gonna just do the regular routine and hit up Roxie's as I do every week. My homie suggested it to me to try, so thought we'd give it a go. 

I got the Korean steak sandwich cuz that's what's hot in the streets. Not only hot in the streets, but it got me hot in the pants. HOT damn my loins yearn for this sandwich. It brought me on a trip. Had the asian-esqe flavor I've only experienced at King Foot Subs, combined with awesome Dutch Crunch bread. Those two addends equate to a flavor smash I have yet to experience from any other sandwich. I pretty much destroyed that sandwich. 

The gf got the Judah. Anytime you throw pesto and chicken together, you're gonna get some heat. The combination of the two was in the words of my homie Tony the Tiger, "GRRRREEEEEATTT." 

I can't wait to come back and try the katsu sandwich. I see a hawaiian sandwich explosion in my near future. =)

excerpts: Also had a few bites of the other signature, the Korean Steak Sandwich (i.e. bulgogi I believe), which was much better.
A good amount of juicy, tender, well flavored, thinly sliced beef,  with bread that holds up fairly well to the juices.
korean steak.author: T C.
korean steak.review:
(more of a 3.5)

When a friend told me they had katsu sandwiches here, I immediately put a visit to Rhea's at the top of my to do list.  I love me some katsu (preferably pork, but chicken will do in a pinch).

Staff were really laid back and friendly;  their sandwich creations sounded so good I was drooling.

The Pork katsu sando was, unfortunately, disappointing.  Combining katsu with slaw and other stuff was interesting (in a good way) the first few bites, but then the lack of meat kicked in.  Look closer at the pictures - cutlets a little under a quarter inch of meat in thickness?   Even L&L isn't that stingy.  IMO one of the critical aspects of a good sandwich is ratios.  Bread was a bit on the chewy side for me, but I guess it could be personal preference - not knocking anything off for that, though that plus the slightly chewy nature of a pork cutlet, and your jaw gets a slight workout.

Also had a few bites of the other signature, the Korean Steak Sandwich (i.e. bulgogi I believe), which was much better.  A good amount of juicy, tender, well flavored, thinly sliced beef,  with bread that holds up fairly well to the juices.  The bread:meat:filling ratio here was more on the spot, with a good flavor profile too.

Size-wise, they're not humongous, but for the price they could be a tad bigger (or include some candy or something like other places charging the same).

Would I go out of my way for a sandwich here?  No, but I would stop by if in the area and feeling like a sandwich.

excerpts: - best sandwich hands down is the korean steak sandwich.
korean steak.author: Jerry W.
korean steak.review:
- best sandwich hands down is the korean steak sandwich.  

- recommend phoning in the order ahead of time

- limited seating at the counter.

excerpts: Korean Steak Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
korean steak.author: Nobu K.
korean steak.review:
The reason why I came here because this line:
"Rhea's Deli is truly a hidden gem. Hidden inside of a liquor store," by Rita C. She got ROTD 2 days ago.

"Hidden gem inside of a liquor store in Mission? Shit, Man, i gotto go there!"
Something like that.
I thought that Valencia Street and Mission street are same thing like Clement and Irving. It was, before. But, it's not the same anymore.
QUE PASO?

So, about the Rhea's.
The place is FXXXin'GOOD!!!
1. Korean Steak Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
2. Chicken Katsu Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
3. Polk Katsu Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
4. Kim Chee is FXXXin'GOOD.

The Kim Chee is something special. 
But when I heard the price, I thought " What a rip-off 6 bucks for a 16oz? " But I had to try it because who's gonna buy Kim Chee in the Mission district? It didn't make a sense to me that selling Kim Chee in Mission. 
So i had to get it.
A guy in the store said, " You'll get 2 dollars back when you get the bottle back."
I was like, "Uh-Huh."
The Kim Chee is vacuumed pack.

This is a warning for a person who is thinking getting the Kim Chee from Rhea's.
Watch out when you are opening the top of the bottle.
Make sure you are at right front of a kitchen sink because the Kim Chee will explode!!!
It is compressed, pressed, squeesed into a 16oz bottle, so, you will see the Kim Chee explode like the Kim Chee rising twice high of the bottle.
At the moment of the Kim Chee rising, it reminded me of the movie "Alien" when the baby Alien came threw out of the guy's lower belly.
FXXXin'GOD, that scared me to hell.
Not Alien.
The Kim Chee!
I thought the Kim Chee is alive.

But the "live" Kim Chee was excellent.
I loved the deep sensible hot chili flavor with such a fresh crunchy Nappa-cabbage. It's not the same like that King's label you see at Safeway.
Btw, I have met an old Korean man before telling me that good Kim Chee don't smell bad as you think. He was right. The Rhea's Kim Chee doesn't smell that badly.

Talkin' about Kim Chee is endless.

I didn't see any Korean guys but so what?
Guys here are really nice.
The Best Deli in the city!!!

I'll be back here very soon to return the bottle to get another one.

excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich is just about the perfect combination of flavors I want in a sandwich.
korean steak.author: Sam K.
korean steak.review:
F'ing awesome!

The Korean steak sandwich is just about the perfect combination of flavors I want in a sandwich.

It does take about 15 minutes to get your sandwich depending on how many people are there, but hey, it's worth it.

excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich is ridiculously good.
korean steak.author: Roger E.
korean steak.review: Expect to wait a long time for a mid-twenties under-achiever to make your sandwich, but you'll be glad you did. The Korean steak sandwich is ridiculously good.

excerpts: Thanks to Lolia S. we just had to try the Korean steak sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=eTojdsxA3xRMOAAWg_kk2g) from Rhea's.
My BMF went inside to order our sandwich.
He was inside the store
so long I'd thought he cheated on me and devoured the entire sandwich himself.
korean steak.author: Sara A.
korean steak.review:
Thanks to Lolia S. we just had to try the Korean steak sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=eTojdsxA3xRMOAAWg_kk2g) from Rhea's. My BMF went inside to order our sandwich. He was inside the store so long I'd thought he cheated on me and devoured the entire sandwich himself. I wouldn't have blamed him though.

After just one bite I determined this was one of the best hot sandwiches I'd ever had. Excellent bread, tender beef, crunchy vegetables and a nice spicy sauce. It was well worth the wait. Next time I'm getting my own!

excerpts: Go for the Korean steak or the Mission.
korean steak.author: Marc M.
korean steak.review: One of my favorite sandwich spots in the city. Definitely worth checking out (but try to avoid peak lunch hours as it can get a little crazy). Go for the Korean steak or the Mission.

excerpts: After hearing that this place serves Korean steak sandwiches I had to come try.
There are more and more Korean fusion items I have seen popping up here in the city.

(i.e. Korean tacos at Namu which are bomb by the way)

The steak in the sandwich had an excellent marinade and they spice it up pretty well enough to clear up your sinus.
Mix the steak with your usual lettuce, onions, tomatoes in between a roll and the sandwich just becomes a sandwich.
With so many "sandwich shops inside mini market" places to choose from, it is hard to give them more than 4 stars.
korean steak.author: Danny P.
korean steak.review:
I want to give this place 3.5 stars but I'll round up to 4.  After hearing that this place serves Korean steak sandwiches I had to come try.  There are more and more Korean fusion items I have seen popping up here in the city.  (i.e. Korean tacos at Namu which are bomb by the way)

The steak in the sandwich had an excellent marinade and they spice it up pretty well enough to clear up your sinus.  Mix the steak with your usual lettuce, onions, tomatoes in between a roll and the sandwich just becomes a sandwich.  With so many "sandwich shops inside mini market" places to choose from, it is hard to give them more than 4 stars.

excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich is oh so delicious!
I orginally came here with the intention of ordering some tacos, but I just couldn't pass on the sandwich.
I'll return for the steak sandwich and to try the tacos.
korean steak.author: Cynthia H.
korean steak.review:
The Korean steak sandwich is oh so delicious!  I orginally came here with the intention of ordering some tacos, but I just couldn't pass on the sandwich.  Saving the tacos for a future visit.

I had to painfully wait 15 mins before devouring my food - my coworkers and I had to take the food back to the office.  Everything about the sandwich was good - perfect bread, lots of meat, and cheese!  I also had a taste of the katsu sandwich - no bueno.  The katsu was very thin and kinda hard.  I wouldn't order this.

You can also buy kim chee here.  I paid about $6 for a small can.  It had too much ginger for my taste, so I wouldn't buy it again.

I'll return for the steak sandwich and to try the tacos.

excerpts: The Korean Steak Sandwich just melts in your mouth (five stars).
I like to compare the veggie bbq chicken sandwich to eating a sponge; it was that bad (two stars).
I will still give them four stars for pleasant customer service and will return for the Korean Steak Sandwich.
I will still give them four stars for pleasant customer service and will return for the Korean Steak Sandwich.
korean steak.author: Coyote B.
korean steak.review:
The sandwich lines are not as long as another popular sandwich shop at 16th and Sanchez, but these sandwiches are comparable.

The Korean Steak Sandwich just melts in your mouth (five stars).  I like to compare the veggie bbq chicken sandwich to eating a sponge; it was that bad (two stars).  I will still give them four stars for pleasant customer service and will return for the Korean Steak Sandwich.

excerpts: Their Korean Steak sandwich is amazing... when they have stock.
We try to order take-out from here but they're always out of something...
meat...
korean steak.author: Brandon O.
korean steak.review:
Their Korean Steak sandwich is amazing... when they have stock. We try to order take-out from here but they're always out of something... meat... lettuce... bread...

Seriously? a deli that ran out of bread to make sandwiches? Comon now. Pull your sh*t together.

We order for delivery so I have no idea regarding the actual store itself or what it looks like.

excerpts: Ordered the Korean steak sandwich thinking, how hot could this be . . .
I eat kimchee all the time.
korean steak.author: Sabrina G.
korean steak.review:
Heard about this place from my friend's food blog, www.urbanstomach.com.  Ordered the Korean steak sandwich thinking, how hot could this be . . . I eat kimchee all the time.  Ah hem, it was a fire cracker in my mouth when you include the jalapenos and sriracha!  

It's true -- this place looks like a typical liquor store from the outside.  So its strange to see their collection of Cowgirl Creamery cheese collection and imported chocolate bars.  I was the only one in line and it took a good 15 minutes for my sandwiches to get made -- worth every bite!

I want to thank the deli guys for being accommodating.  I stopped them mid-way because my son is allergic to eggs and dairy so he can't have the cheese and aioli -- no problem, they threw out the bread and started again.

I've made a funny video about Rhea's at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gNB4UDGTGRo.  You'll get to see my son's reaction face!

We ordered a Chicken Katsu sandwich too -- husband says equally delish!

excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich is positively orgasmic.
Love at first bite.
Possibly the best sandwich I've ever had.
The End.
korean steak.author: Ron C.
korean steak.review:
I have a new favorite Sandwich shop on the Mission.  Sorry, "The Sandwich Place"...I've found Another.  Rhea's fulfills my sandwich needs beyond what you ever could.  

The Korean steak sandwich is positively orgasmic.  Love at first bite.  Possibly the best sandwich I've ever had.  The End.

excerpts: Korean Steak Sandwich: Awwwweeesome.
I really like the Korean steak sandwich after all the reviews telling me to try it.
I got the pork katsu to go
I really like the Korean steak sandwich after all the reviews telling me to try it.

korean steak.review:
Korean Steak Sandwich: Awwwweeesome.

Pork Katsu Sandwich: Great.


This is a great place to try out different sandwiches. I really like the Korean steak sandwich after all the reviews telling me to try it. I got the pork katsu to go and it was cold, so I have to try it again when its warmer and more crunchy. 


Will definitely come back to trry the menu!

it was tasty but got very soggy.
decent kick.

korean steak.review: Nice place. Basic. Got the Korean Steak Sandwich. it was tasty but got very soggy. decent kick.

excerpts: Some kind of orthodontic appliance for maxillary expansion comparable to that of a car jack can only help you, not hurt you, when attempting to unhinge the jaw and anchor thy ivory rows around Rhea's juicy, drippy Korean Steak (bulgogi) or bone dry double-stack Chicken Katsu Sandwiches.
korean steak.author: Irene S.
korean steak.review:
Some kind of orthodontic appliance for maxillary expansion comparable to that of a car jack can only help you, not hurt you, when attempting to unhinge the jaw and anchor thy ivory rows around Rhea's juicy, drippy Korean Steak (bulgogi) or bone dry double-stack Chicken Katsu Sandwiches. 

But can one really hurl slanders when the good man James happens to be uber generous with piling on all the fixins, costarring tasty aiolis and pickled veggies, for less than $8 each?  Damn son.

Yes, in some cases, but mildly so.  While near impossible, particularly when they all come dressed in oops-left-it-in-the-toaster-too-long Acme ciabatta rolls, I brace my gums and the roof of my mouth and stare into the monstrosity to face the challenge of taking a perfectly cross-sectional bite head on. 

Honestly, good stuff and good people behind the counters; sometimes the stars just aren't aligned. Next time.

excerpts: Top sandwiches for me in this order are the Korean Steak, Gargamel & the Dolores.
The marinate on the steak (korean) and chicken (gargamel) are great.
I could take the meats out and eat them with rice...because that's what I want to do with all good meats...
I'm filipino.
korean steak.author: Ramon L.
korean steak.review: I just started cheating on Deli Board with Rhea's....ummm, these guys are good.  Still love Deli Board but Rhea's has some amazing sando's that have local and asian influences that are a nice change from your typical deli sandwiches.  Top sandwiches for me in this order are the Korean Steak, Gargamel & the Dolores.  The marinate on the steak (korean) and chicken (gargamel) are great.  I could take the meats out and eat them with rice...because that's what I want to do with all good meats...I'm filipino.

korean steak.author: Yan E.
korean steak.review:
I came here to try their Korean steak sandwich and realized that I've been here once before to get a drink with A. My thoughts then: "Hmm. Typical corner store. Huh, people seem to be lining up for their sandwiches. :::peers at menu::: Who pays $10 for a sandwich?! No thank you."

Ah yelp, how you change my tune. I came here Saturday around 7:30pm and they were out of Korean steak sandwiches. Sad face. A's nice and ordered a sandwich anyway. On the recommendation of the guy behind the counter (hi, nice guy!), A got the roast beef sandwich. To be honest, I thought it was just another sandwich. A says you can't appreciate a really good sandwich unless you've had really bad ones; I've been spoiled by SF. A loved it. Every bite was punctuated by a moan of appreciation. The mustard, the beef, the bread, oh! It's one of the best sandwiches he's ever had. 

We came back the next afternoon so I could try the Korean steak sandwich. I'm single-minded when it comes to food: I want, I get. Apparently I got the last one of the day, score!  The steak is slightly sweet (like Korean BBQ I'm used to) and yummy; medium spiciness was perfect. Worth the $8? Yes. Would I get it every week? Not really. I talked briefly with another customer. She gets their pork katsu sandwich 2-3x/week!  

There's counter seating: 3 tall stools and 2 short stools.  Maybe it's because of A and he's got the gift of gab, but the counter people are really nice. I haven't figured out who to order from, the person by the cash register or the sandwich makers, and I did both. You may need to wait to place your order and wait for your sandwiches, but it's worth it. Cash only.

In SHORT, $10 sandwiches that may trigger an O-moment, hidden in a liquor store. 3.5 stars rounded up.

excerpts: The Korean steak is also great and very popular.
My only drawback to this place is that they can be slow to make sandwiches, are not open long hours, and can be hectic / long line in there.
I prefer to call ahead so you dont have to wait there.
Overall delicious sammies.
Free delivery too!
korean steak.author: John F.
korean steak.review: This is my favorite and go-to deli in the city. The sandwiches are all very creative combinations, fresh ingredients, and made with care. They use Boars Head cold cuts which is a huge plus for me. The Van Ness and Valencia St are my favorites. The Korean steak is also great and very popular. My only drawback to this place is that they can be slow to make sandwiches, are not open long hours, and can be hectic / long line in there. I prefer to call ahead so you dont have to wait there. Overall delicious sammies. Free delivery too!

excerpts: The Korean steak is definitely the highlight.
House pickled onions, yummy jalapenos, just the right balance between spicy and cheesy and salty and sweet.
Katsu pork isn't too shabby either.
Have yet to try the tacos, but they're def.
party-- get a bottle of wine to go with your steak sandwich and enjoy it on your couch like the true slob you (and I) are.
korean steak.author: Kristin P.
korean steak.review:
For when you don't want to wait a million hours for an epic sandwich (not-so-veiled reference to a certain popular SF sandwich shop)-- go to Rheas.  Their sandwiches are really top notch. The Korean steak is definitely the highlight.  House pickled onions, yummy jalapenos, just the right balance between spicy and cheesy and salty and sweet.  Katsu pork isn't too shabby either.  Have yet to try the tacos, but they're def. on my radar.

The guys who work here are SO nice.  So nice in fact, that my dog basically dislocates my shoulder whenever we walk by because she wants to go in and get petted.  Lucky for her, we're here often.  We've gotten into the habit of calling ahead to order a sandwich, although the wait is never more than 5-7 minutes.  Their beer selection is excellent-- decent wine choices too for bringing something to a dinner party.  Or screw the dinner party-- get a bottle of wine to go with your steak sandwich and enjoy it on your couch like the true slob you (and I) are.

excerpts: I wasn't sure if I could classify Rhea's in the same category, but after I tried their Korean Steak sandwich, I know that they are NOT like everyone else, and they've got a real good thing going.
I'm sure those ingredients would go well on a build-your-own sandwich, but really, this Korean steak sandwich is where its at.
Marinated beef, shredded lettuce, pickled veggies and some spicy, possibly Kimchee inspired spread, and cheddar cheese all wrapped up in a roll.
That's goodness you shouldn't mess with.
Thumbs up for Rhea's and their yummy creation.
I'm sure those ingredients would go well on a build-your-own sandwich, but really, this Korean steak sandwich is where its at.

korean steak.author: Christina N.
korean steak.review:
Seems that the trend these days is to slap some type of Korean meat into a taco, burrito, sandwich, etc. and instant fame is awarded. I wasn't sure if I could classify Rhea's in the same category, but after I tried their Korean Steak sandwich, I know that they are NOT like everyone else, and they've got a real good thing going.

They've got a great menu, boasting Boar's Head deli meats (yum, but why do they have to be so expensive??) and Tartine bread. I'm sure those ingredients would go well on a build-your-own sandwich, but really, this Korean steak sandwich is where its at. Marinated beef, shredded lettuce, pickled veggies and some spicy, possibly Kimchee inspired spread, and cheddar cheese all wrapped up in a roll. That's goodness you shouldn't mess with. Thumbs up for Rhea's and their yummy creation.

This sandwich was amazing
I got it 'very spicy' but didn't really notice much heat after the first bite; just a lot of deliciousness and a satisfied feeling in my belly about 2 minutes later once it was finished.
Took about 15 mins for them to make it
but it was worth the wait.
Get it.

korean steak.review: Korean steak (bulgogi) sandwich was on point, but it took a long ass time to produce (30 minutes).

excerpts: their menu could do with a bunch more veggie options but credit where credit is due: the pork katsu and korean steak sandwiches being where it is due!
korean steak.author: Alee K.
korean steak.review:
The Ike's killer? Maybe.

It speaks to the dearth of good sandwich shops in this city that making a halfway decent one makes people FLOCK. That said Rhea's sandwiches are excellent. It does take a while to get your sandwich and (speaking for my family) their menu could do with a bunch more veggie options but credit where credit is due: the pork katsu and korean steak sandwiches being where it is due!

The dudes there are super-nice. I have nothing else to say...that's it...uh...GRR!!! Why were you guys closed for cleaning on Monday?!?! Surely that wasn't necessary. :/

Minor criticisms aside, kudos to Rhea's for offering an option. Maybe one day we'll have...3 good sandwich shops in the Mission?

excerpts: Had the korean steak sando. too legit to quit.
might be a weekly stop for a while.
korean steak.author: Raekwon D.
korean steak.review: Had the korean steak sando. too legit to quit. might be a weekly stop for a while.

excerpts: I've only had one sandwich here so far, the Korean Steak, but I can say it's my favorite sammie in the city.
Damn is it good!
I walked in and the guy asked if I was hungry.
Hells yah!
I briefly perused the menu, and he suggested getting the korean steak, which he had just finished making for himself, and said it was the best one.
I went with all of his suggestions for the sammie, and it was divine.
All of the ingredients work very well together.
I could only eat half
so I saved the rest for the next day.

korean steak.review:
I've only had one sandwich here so far, the Korean Steak, but I can say it's my favorite sammie in the city. Damn is it good! I walked in and the guy asked if I was hungry. Hells yah! I briefly perused the menu, and he suggested getting the korean steak, which he had just finished making for himself, and said it was the best one. I went with all of his suggestions for the sammie, and it was divine. All of the ingredients work very well together. I could only eat half so I saved the rest for the next day. I could barely wait til lunch time to tear into the second half.

My boy just got the katsu (he's not a cow lovah), and he agrees that Rhea makes the best sammies in SF!.

excerpts: Got the Korean steak sandwich.
Pretty good.
I like the concept but they could work on the customer service.
Stood in front of the deli counter for a while and the sandwich guy just ignored me.
Finally went up to the cashier and asked where I ordered and he took my order
(then I saw the sandwich guy ask the guy behind me if he needed to order so it wasn't like the cashier always takes orders).
Thirty-five minutes later, yes *35* minutes later, I got my sandwich.
If it's going to take that long, you would think they'd give a heads up.
At least I'd have been able to bring my copy of War and Peace and finished it by the time I got my lukewarm sandwich.
korean steak.author: kiwi l.
korean steak.review:
Got the Korean steak sandwich.  Pretty good.  I like the concept but they could work on the customer service.  Stood in front of the deli counter for a while and the sandwich guy just ignored me.  Finally went up to the cashier and asked where I ordered and he took my order (then I saw the sandwich guy ask the guy behind me if he needed to order so it wasn't like the cashier always takes orders).  Thirty-five minutes later, yes *35* minutes later, I got my sandwich.  If it's going to take that long, you would think they'd give a heads up.  At least I'd have been able to bring my copy of War and Peace and finished it by the time I got my lukewarm sandwich.  Sammy was tasty, but  too sweet. 

Also docked a star since I was sitting outside, they saw me waiting for over half an hour, they knew I was waiting since I asked about it 10 minutes before, and they didn't even call my name!  It was only when the guy behind me got called that I asked about my sandwich and then they say, "Oh, you're sandwich is ready, it's up at the counter"  WTF?!  Yeah, I'll probably stick to Ike's 'cause at least they have a SYSTEM.   
Suggestions: put a sign up next to the cashier saying "Order sandwiches here" and make sure the cashier says how long the wait is.  If the cashier has to stock inventory in the cold cases, don't let him do it when there are customers in the store since people were waiting around wondering why they have to wait 5 minutes to buy a pack of cigarettes when there were so many people waiting and no one behind the register.  That way introverted sandwich guy can focus on making the sandwiches and put out more than 1 every 15 minutes.  And you may want more than 1 person making sandwiches during lunch hour.  I'm sure my sandwich would've tasted better if I didn't have the bitter taste of bad service in my mouth.

excerpts: I had the korean steak sammy and it was about the best sandwich I have had in SF.
I am dying to try the pork Katsu sammy (maybe tomorrow even).
The owner was there talking to someone about how he pounds the cutlets every night
and it makes his arms sore (he said about 10 qty of them takes him about a 1/2 hour) .
All the workers were super friendly, and concerned about everyone's order.
The place seems nice and clean (especially for the mission).
If this weren't so far away from my neighborhood I could see being a bi-(or tri) weekly regular.
korean steak.author: Amy W.
korean steak.review: The reviews didn't lie. I had the korean steak sammy and it was about the best sandwich I have had in SF. I am dying to try the pork Katsu sammy (maybe tomorrow even).  The owner was there talking to someone about how he pounds the cutlets every night and it makes his arms sore (he said about 10 qty of them takes him about a 1/2 hour) . All the workers were super friendly, and concerned about everyone's order.  The place seems nice and clean (especially for the mission).  If this weren't so far away from my neighborhood I could see being a bi-(or tri) weekly regular.

excerpts: I was really upset the first time I had the Korean steak sandwich.
korean steak.author: Christie C.
korean steak.review:
I was really upset the first time I had the Korean steak sandwich. I couldn't believe my mother made me bulgogi all these years and never thought to produce it in sandwich form herself. 

The bread's perfectly crunchy AND soft, the onions add just the right amount of oomph to the perfectly marinated meat, and the sauce is the kind that burns in your tummy for a while afterwards, but in a good way. But to echo other reviewers, get the mild. I'm pretty snobby/arrogant about my spicy tolerance, but I definitely had to pause halfway through my "medium" spicy sandwich. The sandwich has plenty of flavor, regardless of spicy level. 

My only wish is that they'd stay open later on weekdays, so I can treat myself to an amazing sandwich after work...

excerpts: Definitely be back again to try their famous Korean Steak Sandwich,
korean steak.author: Mauling W.
korean steak.review:
Did you say you want to take me out for dinner, honey? Yes! Great! Where are we going? Limon? Maverick? Beretta? Nope... Rhea's Deli!
What? Ok. So I Yelped this place and to my surprise, all stars!! Okay lets go now for some sandwiches. No one would guess they had a little deli counter in the back inside a corner liquor market. I ordered the Valencia w/ turkey and havarti. My hubbie had the Cunningham w/ salami and cheddar. Mine was perfect. His on the otherhand was too oily due to the fact the sandwich was toasted and the cheddar melted. Otherwise, both was nicely done especially the red onions and the garlic spread. Definitely be back again to try their famous Korean Steak Sandwich,

Next time I'll just use the the free delivery - with $10 minimum, it'll just mean that i have to get BOTH a korean steak sandwich and
chicken katsu sandwich.(or maybe throw some beer, chips, candy, etc in there

Liberal use of spicy spreads gave the eats a glow that enhanced the other flavors.
The second night - they were out of the Korean Steak which was a real bummer.
That is the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.

That is the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.
korean steak.author: Star G.
korean steak.review:
MMMMMMMmmmmmm! Thank you fellow Yelpers for turning us on to this hole in the wall deli inside a liquor store. The dude making the sandwiches took his time and carefully made us two of the best we have ever had. No joking. It was that good! I had the Korean Steak Sandwich and Wifey had the Portabella Mushroom Sandwich. Liberal use of spicy spreads gave the eats a glow that enhanced the other flavors. ...The bread was fresh!

We ate at the the place two nights in a row while visiting the city. The second night - they were out of the Korean Steak which was a real bummer. That is the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.

excerpts: The Korean Steak sandwich is super good!
Maybe it was the fact that I was crazy starving and could barely wait to eat this when I got home
, this is well worth the $8.50.
I got the mild version and it totally was mild.
korean steak.author: cyndi L.
korean steak.review:
The Korean Steak sandwich is super good! Maybe it was the fact that I was crazy starving and could barely wait to eat this when I got home, this is well worth the $8.50. I got the mild version and it totally was mild. I hate when it's too spicy and I'm not in the mood to have my mouth on fire. 

When you get there, go to the deli counter and grab a little piece of paper that will let you mark up what you want on your sandwich. After that give it to the cashier and then they'll hand it to the sandwich counter.

Went around 1:30 on a Friday and the wait wasn't bad, about 10-15 minutes. Not a problem I wandered over to Paxton Gate to browse.

Bare bones little liquor shop. Other than the deli there's nothing to make you go there unless you need to load up on libations.

excerpts: I got the Korean Steak sandwich as it was perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious.
I originally requested it to be medium spicy but the guy taking my order asked if it was my first time (it was)
and said I should try mild first.
korean steak.author: Anna Y.
korean steak.review:
I got the Korean Steak sandwich as it was perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious. I originally requested it to be medium spicy but the guy taking my order asked if it was my first time (it was) and said I should try mild first. I still think I would have been able to handle the medium, but I was thankful he was being so conscientious. 

The wait was a bit long and they did warn me beforehand (10-15 minutes) on a rainy Saturday afternoon. The guy at the counter also took pity on me and let me use my last remaining $1 to buy an Aero chocolate bar (usually $2).

excerpts: Korean steak, pork katsu, pastrami...
it's all great!
korean steak.author: Peg W.
korean steak.review: Hmm, good. Great sandwiches and service. Korean steak, pork katsu, pastrami...it's all great!

excerpts: i've always wanted to try the korean steak sandwich but it took me forever to stop in.
korean steak.author: Regina C.
korean steak.review:
this place has been on my "bookmarks" for a LONG time. i've always wanted to try the korean steak sandwich but it took me forever to stop in.

 you know how there's the whole korean taco kick going on? every time i eat a korean taco i think to myself "this is great, but i wish i had some rice instead of this corn tortilla." uhhh well that tells me i'd rather be eating at a traditional korean bbq spot rather than having it all mexican fusioned. i thought a korean sandwich might have me feeling the same thing. but when i bit into the sandwich my mind went insane for a little bit! the sweet of the korean beef mixed with the spicy of the aioli and jalapenos, the salty of the sharp cheddar and the fantastic acme bread was amazing! i would take korean beef in a Rhea's sandwich over korean beef with rice any day! SO good. get your hands on one! in fact, get your hands on two and save one for me. we'll go kick it in the park and eat these amazing sandwiches in silence. talking can wait for after the sandwiches. haha!!

excerpts: i had the korean steak sandwich.
spicy, yummy, tender, tasty.
we also ordered the vegetarian sandwich and the person loved it even though she wasn't vegetarian.
turkey sandwich also got the thumbs up.
is there any sandwich here that isnt liked?
