im going to find out.

how come no one told me about the katsu sandwich dammit?  gonna have to go back and get one, and a 40 for my homies.

excerpts: Korean Steak, Valencia Street, Noe Street, Judah Street, and 18th Street sandwiches are some of my top choices.
korean steak.author: Marieke V.
korean steak.review: Love this sandwich spot. Probably my favorite sandwich place of my life. The bread is delicious, the ingredients are high quality and fresh. I try to get a Rhea's sandwich at least once a week if not more! So gooooood. I have tried quite a few of their sandwiches and like to try something new here and there. Korean Steak, Valencia Street, Noe Street, Judah Street, and 18th Street sandwiches are some of my top choices.

excerpts: Get the Korean steak sandwich and pack your bags for heaven.
korean steak.author: Jeremy R.
korean steak.review: One of the best sandwiches in SF I have had. Get the Korean steak sandwich and pack your bags for heaven.

excerpts: So underwhelmed by the Korean steak sandwich.
Bread was for sure day old.
Steak was not tender nor well marinated.
Everyone on the jock tip has seriously never had a delicious sandwich with high quality meat and bread.
Over priced for poor quality.
If you like big portions this is your joint.
korean steak.author: L. I. Z.
korean steak.review: So underwhelmed by the Korean steak sandwich. Bread was for sure day old. Steak was not tender nor well marinated. Everyone on the jock tip has seriously never had a delicious sandwich with high quality meat and bread.   Over priced for poor quality. If you like big portions this is your joint.

excerpts: I ordered the Korean Steak Sandwich....it was massive.
Definitely could feed two easily.
The bread was alright, not the best I've had...but the melded flavors of salty, spicy, and sweet was heaven.
The meat was marinated well with lots of flavor and not too salty.
The extras that came with it like the pickled onions and grilled onions definitely went well with everything.
You get to choose the cheese, but it's hard to blend cheese with asian flavors...
but who doesn't like cheese...
so just go for it.
These Deli definitely serves unconventional sandwiches and allows the ingredients to shine without any frill.
Simply food done well makes for a happy belly.
korean steak.author: Melanie S.
korean steak.review: This deli/liquor store epitomizes the Mission District of San Francisco....kinda hipster, pretty small, kinda random, but serves great flavors.  I loved it!  I ordered the Korean Steak Sandwich....it was massive.  Definitely could feed two easily.  The bread was alright, not the best I've had...but the melded flavors of salty, spicy, and sweet was heaven.  The meat was marinated well with lots of flavor and not too salty.  The extras that came with it like the pickled onions and grilled onions definitely went well with everything.  You get to choose the cheese, but it's hard to blend cheese with asian flavors...but who doesn't like cheese...so just go for it.  These Deli definitely serves unconventional sandwiches and allows the ingredients to shine without any frill.  Simply food done well makes for a happy belly.

I tried the Spicy Korean Steak Sandwich and it has changed my life, never again will I go to Dolores without a cider and a sandwich from here.

excerpts: Everyone loves the Korean steak and the Katsu sandwiches, so I want to put a good word in for the 17th Ave.

Also, I find it so odd there are some negative reviews about service.

Everyone who works here is ridiculously nice.
In conclusion, you should eat here.
It's delicious.

SO GOOD!!!  Also, I find it so odd there are some negative reviews about service.  Sure, there can be a long wait (the demand is probably higher than they expected, but I heard they were putting in a second counter to help with that).  Everyone who works here is ridiculously nice. In conclusion, you should eat here.  It's delicious.

excerpts: The Korean Steak Sandwich is a god sent.

There is no need to ask to "hold this" or "add that", we ordered the "hot" version and it was just that.
There were a couple of fatty parts I had to spit out otherwise
, I would have given this place a 5.
They sell good chocolate, Perrier, and beer,
I don't need much else.

I had enough for both lunch and dinner.  I think next time I'll try the katsu sandwich.  Sandwich & drink came out $10.50. My Coworkers picked up a few jars of the home made kim chi on the way out.  The wait time was approximately 20 min which seemed a little on the long side, but well worth the wait.  I advise calling in your order ahead of time. Friendly service.

excerpts: The smell was intoxicating and was only topped when I took a bite out of the massive Korean Steak Sandwich.
There was no need for nicotine or another addictive substance; the wonderful blend of sauce, peppers, and meat did all that and more on
korean steak.author: Matt W.
korean steak.review:
The only regret I have about letting my co-worker get me addicted to these sandwiches is that I don't have any money at the moment to buy more.

I rarely eat lunch these days, but after seeing my co-worker eat these sandwiches, I gave him $10 and had him pick up his favorite sandwich for me to try.  From the minute he walked back in the door, I was hooked.  The smell was intoxicating and was only topped when I took a bite out of the massive Korean Steak Sandwich.  There was no need for nicotine or another addictive substance; the wonderful blend of sauce, peppers, and meat did all that and more on it's own.

I've read through some of the lesser reviews which dock a star off here for Rhea's not originally being a deli, or for having "too big a sandwich" (which I have never heard of), and all I have to say is this:  Who cares?  When the food is this good, five stars is the bare minimum Rhea's deserves.  Bravo James!  Bravo!

excerpts: The Korean steak is as good as they say.

The stools in the back provide a surprisingly nice place to sit, and it's actually a reasonably priced convenience store to boot.
You can save time by calling your order in ahead.
And don't wait til too late in the afternoon because they do sometimes run out of stuff.

excerpts: Get the Korean Steak sandwich!
There's a great deli at 19th & Guerrero that makes a mean tri-tip, but the Korean Steak sandwich at Rhea's is a better sammich.
There's a great deli at 19th & Guerrero that makes a mean tri-tip, but the Korean Steak sandwich at Rhea's is a better sammich.
korean steak.author: Sean B.
korean steak.review:
Get the Korean Steak sandwich! There's a great deli at 19th & Guerrero that makes a mean tri-tip, but the Korean Steak sandwich at Rhea's is a better sammich. Sweet and tangy bulgogi (from mom's recipe) with house-pickled onions, homemade aoili, and a lovely mess of sandwich staples makes for a truly awesome meal.

Other highlights are the great microbrew selection in 12 and 22 oz bottles (and even 21st Amendment brews in cans), a breadth of cheap and tasty wines, and fresh local cheeses without the line or pretense at Bi-Rite.

excerpts: This place had great sandwiches: Korean steak sandwich is worth the wait.
korean steak.author: PukaShell s.
korean steak.review: I was yelping for a grilled cheese and I stumbled upon Rhea's.  Yeah!  This place had great sandwiches: Korean steak sandwich is worth the wait.

excerpts: Will be back for the Korean steak sandwich.
And the pork katsu.
And the chicken katsu.
And the korean steak taco.
And the hot link.
And the Cunningham.
In the future, I'll call ahead and pick it up on my walk from the bus.
And the korean steak taco.
And the hot link.
And the Cunningham.
In the future, I'll call ahead and pick it up on my walk from the bus.
korean steak.author: Alex K.
korean steak.review:
I think I stumbled into this liquor store once while hammered because I needed some salt+vinegar chips action.  Little did I know the sandwich perfection that lay dormant inside.

Like the much-lamented Mission Burger, Rhea's transcends its humble surroundings with a decadent meat + cheese fugue.  In your mouth.  Yeah.

Got a Mission St (basically a reuben: pastrami, cheese, slaw, pickled jalapenos, mustard + garlic aioli held together by two fantastic slices of Tartine country loaf).  Was perfectly balanced, with each ingredient able to be distinguished without overwhelming the whole.  Salty, fatty, sweet, sour, spicy.  Just when you think the sandwich is lacking texture, you get a crunch of tartine crust, and all is right in the world.

It's also HUGE.  I ate the second half not because I was still hungry, but because I didn't want the mouth happiness to end.

Miles better than that famously precarious dirty sandwich shop that shall remain unnamed.

Will be back for the Korean steak sandwich.  And the pork katsu.  And the chicken katsu.  And the korean steak taco.  And the hot link.  And the Cunningham.  In the future, I'll call ahead and pick it up on my walk from the bus.

excerpts: The Korean Steak Sandwich at Rhea's Deli is on par with the best in the city, but ask for the mild version if you can't handle the heat cause its a spicey sando.
korean steak.author: Brian S.
korean steak.review: The Korean Steak Sandwich at Rhea's Deli is on par with the best in the city, but ask for the mild version if you can't handle the heat cause its a spicey sando.

good for grabbing and go

I bought one today to take home

The Acme roll was of course amazing.
My mouth still burns a little half an hour after the sandwich.
I'm very happy there's now a good sandwich place close by
so I don't have to trek to Ike's!

The Acme roll was of course amazing. My mouth still burns a little half an hour after the sandwich. I'm very happy there's now a good sandwich place close by so I don't have to trek to Ike's!

excerpts: The korean steak, the pork katsu, the lexington st ham sandwich.
You can't go wrong.
I highly recommend getting a sandwich at Rheas.
The staff is very friendly as they have always been and the prices are more then fair.
I may not be able to purchase my beloved lotto scratchers there anymore, but the sandwiches are so good that I don't mind so much.
korean steak.author: k d.
korean steak.review:
Generally, I avoid buying anything edible beyond a candy bar or pint of ice cream from a corner store. This is because food made at most corner stores in my experience looks disgusting. 
Rheas is an exception. 
I've been going there since I moved to the city five years ago. The staff has always been super friendly and when I learned they were putting in a sandwich shop earlier this year I was excited (although sad that they no longer had lotto scratchers because I swear it was the luckiest place to buy them, I won more then I lost, it was freaky. They stopped carrying scratchers to save help save money for the deli I'm guessing). Anyway. The sandwiches. They are some of the best sandwiches I have eaten in San Francisco. The korean steak, the pork katsu, the lexington st ham sandwich. You can't go wrong. I highly recommend getting a sandwich at Rheas. The staff is very friendly as they have always been and the prices are more then fair. I may not be able to purchase my beloved lotto scratchers there anymore, but the sandwiches are so good that I don't mind so much.

excerpts: For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken.
I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time.
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's.
It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.
vegetarian steak sandwich.author: Monica H.
vegetarian steak sandwich.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich from Rhea's Deli!

I wanted something without meat, so the Church sandwich with veggie-chicken stood out to me. It also had swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli... all served on an Acme roll. DELICIOUS. 

For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken. I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time. 
 
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's. It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.

excerpts: The vegetarian steak sandwich is amazing.
It's hearty, full of flavor, and very filling.
One of my favorites from Rhea's.
My meat-eating friends live it too!
vegetarian steak sandwich.author: Kristina K.
vegetarian steak sandwich.review: The vegetarian steak sandwich is amazing. It's hearty, full of flavor, and very filling. One of my favorites from Rhea's. My meat-eating friends live it too!

excerpts: Had the vegetarian steak sandwich.
It was one of the best sandwiches of my life.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.
vegetarian steak sandwich.author: William H.
vegetarian steak sandwich.review: Had the vegetarian steak sandwich. It was one of the best sandwiches of my life. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

excerpts: They also have a Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, but they were out when we went.
vegetarian steak sandwich.author: SalsaBoy S.
vegetarian steak sandwich.review:
Fuck.  These sandwiches are amazing.

We shared the Vegetarian BBQ (vegetarian) Chicken and the Church.  The Vegetarian BBQ is one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten anywhere.  Stu-fucking-pendous.  They ask if one wants her sandwich mild, medium, or hot.  We ordered it "hot" and it had a lovely kick.  It simply doesn't get better than the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken sandwich.  Blows the fuck out of Ike's, with better bread and better ingredients.

The Church is vegetarian chicken, Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperocini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli on an Acme roll.  It was great, but of the two, the Vegetarian BBQ dwarfs the Church.  In the ordinary world of sandwiches, the Church is incredible, balanced, and perfect, but compared to the Usain Bolt of vegetarian sandwiches (Veg BBQ), it could never come in first.

They also have a Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, but they were out when we went.  They used to have a Miss Piggy -- which is also vegetarian, in spite of the name -- but I didn't see it when I went in.

The hours are tough if one doesn't live close or work in the neighborhood.  Open until 5p during the week, 6p on weekends.  I'd definitely return and even go the fuck out of my way for it.  These sandwiches are in the league all of their own.  Phenomenal.

Highly, highly recommended.

excerpts: After reading the sign advertising the vegetarian steak sandwich for the umpteenth time, I stopped in on a hungry walk home one Friday evening to see what the fuss was about.
Well, I still don't know what the fuss is about, 'cause after perusing the menu, I decided to get the veggie bbq "chicken" sandwich instead --
and oh my goodness.
I daydream about this sandwich.
Astonishingly delicious marinated "chicken," lots of veggies, some kind of spicy aioli...
I don't even care, I just know it tastes amazing.
One of these days I will have to try the veggie steak sandwich, but I am not sure how it could beat this one.
vegetarian steak sandwich.author: Stacia T.
vegetarian steak sandwich.review:
I pass this place almost every day on my walk to work and on my way home again. After reading the sign advertising the vegetarian steak sandwich for the umpteenth time, I stopped in on a hungry walk home one Friday evening to see what the fuss was about. Well, I still don't know what the fuss is about, 'cause after perusing the menu, I decided to get the veggie bbq "chicken" sandwich instead -- and oh my goodness. I daydream about this sandwich. Astonishingly delicious marinated "chicken," lots of veggies, some kind of spicy aioli... I don't even care, I just know it tastes amazing. One of these days I will have to try the veggie steak sandwich, but I am not sure how it could beat this one.

I don't get off work until 5:30 and I really wish Rhea's was open 'til 6 on weekdays. I've bought a sandwich for lunch a couple of times, but they're kind of messy and I'm usually in a rush. 

The service is usually pretty efficient. I've never had to wait too long, but that could be lucky timing. Ordering in advance by phone seems to be the way to go if you don't want to wait.

One time I left work late and came in right after 6 on a Friday, when they were just closing up the deli. The guy working the counter saw my disappointment and was really sweet -- agreed to make me a sandwich even though he was about to leave. I spent a few minutes chatting with the cashier, and I walked out with my sandwich feeling great, mouth watering. Made my whole evening.

excerpts: I have tried the wonder women, the panda, Valencia st, and noe st.
Great place to go when I don't know what to get for lunch.
valencia st.author: Karen A.
valencia st.review: Sandwiches are delicious!! Well the few I have ordered haven't disappointed me! I have tried the wonder women, the panda, Valencia st, and noe st. Great place to go when I don't know what to get for lunch.

excerpts: This is the one time I would prefer someone replacing a business on valencia st with more condos.
valencia st.author: Jesse M.
valencia st.review: About 15 minutes ago I stopped in Rhea's for a sandwich and had a horrific experience.  I walked up to the counter to fill out the sandwich order form and there was a homeless person wandering in and out of the store yelling some gibberish while being ignored by the staff.  As I'm filling out the form, the homeless man decides to throw some sort of dirty wrapper/paper on me.  I yell at him and he decides to square up and start yelling back.  The staff is practically ignoring him when he spits all over my face.  One of the employees finally escorted him out while laughing and implied it was my fault.  I look around to the rest of the staff and especially the lady who I've seen there every single time I've ordered a sandwich and waited for some sort of acknowledgement, but they continued on as if nothing happened.  I stormed out looking to call the police on the man, but he was gone and the employees couldn't care less.  I wasn't looking for a free sandwich, but just some acknowledgement and empathy over what happened.  I'm done with this place.  This is the one time I would prefer someone replacing a business on valencia st with more condos.

excerpts: I love their Valencia St cold
valencia st.author: John D.
valencia st.review:
Based on sandwiches alone these guys get 5 stars for sure, hands down, they are my favorite sandwich shop in all of SF.  I love their Valencia St cold, it is amazing, as well as (obvi) the Korean steak sandwich.  

I love these guys' sandwiches so much, I wanted to have them served at my wedding-- well, not at the actual wedding but at the picnic lunch the next day.  Unfortunately, over the course of about 3 months, I stopped in to the deli in person 3 different times to ask about whether or not they could accommodate an order of about 50 sandwiches on a sunday morning at about 11am.  Each time I was told I needed to talk to a manager (who wasn't there), and I gave them my info, but never received a call.  I emailed them my request as well, but never heard back, no response whatsoever.  I understand they are super busy (duh, their sandwiches are killer), but it would have helped with my planning if I knew ahead of time they would not have worked out.

Keep up the killer work on the sandwiches, guys, but you should step it up on the customer service.

excerpts: The Van Ness and Valencia St are my favorites.
valencia st.author: John F.
valencia st.review: This is my favorite and go-to deli in the city. The sandwiches are all very creative combinations, fresh ingredients, and made with care. They use Boars Head cold cuts which is a huge plus for me. The Van Ness and Valencia St are my favorites. The Korean steak is also great and very popular. My only drawback to this place is that they can be slow to make sandwiches, are not open long hours, and can be hectic / long line in there. I prefer to call ahead so you dont have to wait there. Overall delicious sammies. Free delivery too!

excerpts: For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken.
I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time.
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's.
It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Monica H.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich from Rhea's Deli!

I wanted something without meat, so the Church sandwich with veggie-chicken stood out to me. It also had swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli... all served on an Acme roll. DELICIOUS. 

For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken. I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time. 
 
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's. It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.

excerpts: Vegetarian bbq chicken sandwich was perfect, great price.
For me and my boyfriend plus two sodas it was just under $20.
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Nelanne C.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review: Vegetarian bbq chicken sandwich was perfect, great price. For me and my boyfriend plus two sodas it was just under $20. He got the Korean steak sandwich and loved it also. Very generous size for the price, I couldn't finish.

excerpts: My roommate is a vegetarian and she absolutely loves the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken Sandwich - best fake meat around, she says!
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Lauren B.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
Hands down, BEST sandwich in the city.  From the Korean Steak Sandwich (which is a MUST have) to the Wonder Woman, every sandwich is delicious and filled with a wonderful combination of flavor, spice, meats and cheese.

After having five different sandwiches, on my sixth visit I decided it was time to try the Korean Steak Sandwich.  I nearly broke my jaw in excitement in taking the first bite (the sandwich height is approximately 6 inches) and was greeted with a steak filled explosion of flavor and spice - YUM!

My roommate is a vegetarian and she absolutely loves the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken Sandwich - best fake meat around, she says!

Whatever you decide, and believe me it's a difficult choice...you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: It simply doesn't get better than the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken sandwich.
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: SalsaBoy S.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
Fuck.  These sandwiches are amazing.

We shared the Vegetarian BBQ (vegetarian) Chicken and the Church.  The Vegetarian BBQ is one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten anywhere.  Stu-fucking-pendous.  They ask if one wants her sandwich mild, medium, or hot.  We ordered it "hot" and it had a lovely kick.  It simply doesn't get better than the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken sandwich.  Blows the fuck out of Ike's, with better bread and better ingredients.

The Church is vegetarian chicken, Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperocini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli on an Acme roll.  It was great, but of the two, the Vegetarian BBQ dwarfs the Church.  In the ordinary world of sandwiches, the Church is incredible, balanced, and perfect, but compared to the Usain Bolt of vegetarian sandwiches (Veg BBQ), it could never come in first.

They also have a Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, but they were out when we went.  They used to have a Miss Piggy -- which is also vegetarian, in spite of the name -- but I didn't see it when I went in.

The hours are tough if one doesn't live close or work in the neighborhood.  Open until 5p during the week, 6p on weekends.  I'd definitely return and even go the fuck out of my way for it.  These sandwiches are in the league all of their own.  Phenomenal.

Highly, highly recommended.

excerpts: Had the Vegetarian BBQ chicken based on yelp reviews and yup
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Divya R.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
Had the Vegetarian BBQ chicken based on yelp reviews and yup it really was yummy. 

I especially liked the hot sauce in the sandwich with just a hint of sweetness. I ordered 20 minutes beforehand so the order was waiting for me when I got there. It would have been a bit of a wait otherwise because there was already a small line forming after me. I paid using cash so that made the transaction a little quicker. So order beforehand would be my suggestion

This sandwich would make my list of best vegetarian sandwiches in SF. Consider taking the food to nearby Doloroes park for a fun day picnic. Oh and take along lots of napkins the food does tend to get drippy :)

excerpts: Since their Veggie Steak was really good, they have another vegetarian sammie, the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken which comes with some a chicken drumstick, red/white cabbage with carrots, pickled red onions (yum!), jalapenos, chili garlic sauce and roasted red pepper aioli for $8.19
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Andrew L.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
I've been here a total of three times now and feel very comfortable giving this place 4 stars. You are not going to get a "high end, luxurious" sandwich such as Darwin's... more of the blue collar type with a shimmy twist. Here's what I've sample so far

The Harrison - $7.45 -  Hot Pastrami with cheddar cheese, red onions, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini with spicy mustard and chipotle aioli. I believe the meat is Boar's head which is always a good thing. Not excessively lined with fat yet not too lean where it's completely dry. All the veggies were fresh and there was only a hint of the mustard. Very mild spice from the chipotle. Their acme organic rolls is also very tasty.

Marinated Veggie Steak - $7.45 - This was a true surprise. I'm usually not a big fan of meat substitutes but this is the real deal. The flavor and texture is almost like a Korean marinated meatball. I could eat this and not feel like a wimp! I can't remember the veggies, but I believe it has lettuce, tomatoes and pickles with possible a garlic aioli. 

Korean Steak Sandwich - $8.99 - One of the more popular sandwiches so I had to try it, plus who doesn't like ribeye slices in a sandwich? The meat has been marinated in a soy sauce garlic, ginger, honey and other spices. I didn't takes a lot of ginger which is a plus for me, and it did just have a hint of the honey. The veggies included is lettuce and a very nice pickled red onion with jalapenos and fresh red onions. The sammie is sauced up with their garlic aioli on the organic acme roll. I can see why this is popular, it's quite good especially if you like spicy steak sandwiches.

I'll be back here at least a couple more times. Since their Veggie Steak was really good, they have another vegetarian sammie, the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken which comes with some a chicken drumstick, red/white cabbage with carrots, pickled red onions (yum!), jalapenos, chili garlic sauce and roasted red pepper aioli for $8.19

excerpts: Vegetarian BBQ Chicken featuring Layonna's famous vegetarian drum sticks.
All you need to know.
Carnivore sammiches rule as well.
The God Father.
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Mark S. I.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
+4 stars for *really tasty* sammiches. Like no kidding. Vegetarian BBQ Chicken featuring Layonna's famous vegetarian drum sticks. All you need to know. Carnivore sammiches rule as well. The God Father. Right on, in many ways.

+4 stars for really great service. Folks were helpful, polite, and eager to make really awesome sammiches. For. The. Win.

All that's subjective any way. What you need to know: HOME MADE KIMCHEE, BI7%#ES!

excerpts: I planned to come here for the first time today to try the Vegetarian Bbq Chicken Sandwich.
However, as today went on I kept on getting tempted by other food options swimming through my head.
At one point, I started talking myself  into going to Ike's or Taqueria Cancun instead.
Coming to my senses, I stuck with my original decision and was blown away.
At first, I was concerned it would just be a sandwich with fake meat slathered in barbeque sauce but after the first bite, I realized I was just being prejudiced.
In fact, looking back I am glad I had  such low expectations because the experience took me to a whole different level.
I have never gone to the same restaurant two days in a row
but I'll promise you this
, I'll be having another Vegetarian Bbq Chicken Sandwich tomorrow.
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: avi a.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review: I planned to come here for the first time today to try the Vegetarian Bbq Chicken Sandwich.  However, as today went on I kept on getting tempted by other food options swimming through my head. At one point, I started talking myself  into going to Ike's or Taqueria Cancun instead.  Coming to my senses, I stuck with my original decision and was blown away.  At first, I was concerned it would just be a sandwich with fake meat slathered in barbeque sauce but after the first bite, I realized I was just being prejudiced.  In fact, looking back I am glad I had  such low expectations because the experience took me to a whole different level.  I have never gone to the same restaurant two days in a row but I'll promise you this, I'll be having another Vegetarian Bbq Chicken Sandwich tomorrow.

excerpts: I got the vegetarian BBQ chicken which you can get mild, medium or spicy.
It was DELICIOUS and the perfect size to split with someone as long as you get
some chippys or potato salad to go with it.
The cabbage adds a wonderful earthy taste and I always love a little crunch factor.
MMMMMM.
Everyone who works here is super nice too.
The store has an impressive collection of old timey candy bars (woot) and an abundance of beer and Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream flavors.
What else do you need?
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Emily S.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review:
The quality of these sandwiches and the time that goes into them was a very pleasant surprise. I got the vegetarian BBQ chicken which you can get mild, medium or spicy. It was DELICIOUS and the perfect size to split with someone as long as you get some chippys or potato salad to go with it. The cabbage adds a wonderful earthy taste and I always love a little crunch factor. MMMMMM. Everyone who works here is super nice too. 
The store has an impressive collection of old timey candy bars (woot) and an abundance of beer and Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream flavors. What else do you need?

excerpts: This is my neighborhood corner store, so one could say I'm a bit biased due to the proximity to my house and availability of items pretty much whenever I need them--but, this is definitely a place I would go out of my way to come to for their amazing VEGETARIAN BBQ CHICKEN SANDWICH!
It is so so so good!
Fresh slaw, delicious sauce, pretty real chicken (which I don't usually like, but this stuff is CRAMAZING--yes, I did just make up a word)!
It's just that good!
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Shira O.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review: This is my neighborhood corner store, so one could say I'm a bit biased due to the proximity to my house and availability of items pretty much whenever I need them--but, this is definitely a place I would go out of my way to come to for their amazing VEGETARIAN BBQ CHICKEN SANDWICH! It is so so so good! Fresh slaw, delicious sauce, pretty real chicken (which I don't usually like, but this stuff is CRAMAZING--yes, I did just make up a word)! It's just that good!

excerpts: I ordered the vegetarian BBQ chicken sandwich with cabbage slaw, housemade pickled onions and tons of spicy stuff on this delicious organic Semifreddi's ciabatta and got it right quick.
The hipster dudes who made it were really nice and friendly, and the store itself had awesome European chocolate goodies you don't normally see at places like that.
I hurried home and ate the shit out of it.
I'll probably come back this weekend.
Plus, I heard through the grapevine that they DELIVER too!
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Laura M.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review: As soon as I read in one Yelp review "This place is seriously what Yelp was made for", I knew I had to go. I walked here on the way home from work off a gut feeling that I knew it'd be worth it even though it was effing cold. I'd been in the liquor store before but never noticed the sandwich counter, don't know why. I ordered the vegetarian BBQ chicken sandwich with cabbage slaw, housemade pickled onions and tons of spicy stuff on this delicious organic Semifreddi's ciabatta and got it right quick. The hipster dudes who made it were really nice and friendly, and the store itself had awesome European chocolate goodies you don't normally see at places like that. I hurried home and ate the shit out of it. I'll probably come back this weekend. Plus, I heard through the grapevine that they DELIVER too!

excerpts: Highly recommend the vegetarian BBQ chicken.
I usually have to get mine mild, because the spicy sauce is super spicy, but I can be kind of a wimp about spicy, so take this advice with a grain of salt.
Best place after Bi-Rite to grab picnic supplies for Dolores Park.
vegetarian bbq chicken.author: Gloria A.
vegetarian bbq chicken.review: I looks (looked, actually, since they got new signage) like any average sketchy corner store in the Mission.  But step inside and they have some of the greatest sandwiches in the Mission, or even the city.  Highly recommend the vegetarian BBQ chicken.  I usually have to get mine mild, because the spicy sauce is super spicy, but I can be kind of a wimp about spicy, so take this advice with a grain of salt.  Best place after Bi-Rite to grab picnic supplies for Dolores Park.

excerpts: I ordered the Bryant St on Dutch brunch and it was amazing!!
Highly recommend this place as an alternative to Ike's.
It may look like a random hole in the wall, but their sandwiches are awesome.
I'll definitely be back to try some of the other things off the menu!
bryant st.author: Emily K.
bryant st.review:
My friend and I stumbled upon Rhea's in the Mission District and it was such a pleasant surprise!! It's like Ike's minus the crazy lines. The ordering process was kinda confusing- you have to fill out a form!

I ordered the Bryant St on Dutch brunch and it was amazing!! Highly recommend this place as an alternative to Ike's. :) It may look like a random hole in the wall, but their sandwiches are awesome. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other things off the menu!

excerpts: My friend and I shared the Bryant St on a sourdough roll which was a delightful combination of turkey and pastrami, subtly spicy with jalepenos, and rich with cheddar cheese.
It was a bit pricey, but filled up my friend and I, so I think it was worth the $9.95.
The girl at the counter was so friendly and helpful, from explaining to us about the sandwiches we were considering to suggesting beer and chip accompaniments.
I will be back for sure, as they were out of Dutch Crunch when we popped in and I would like to try it.
bryant st.author: Crystal C.
bryant st.review:
Such good sandwiches! Came to Rhea's in April (I remember the day specifically) and they were packed and the counter guy was so rude and basically told my friends and I that we should leave since the wait was so long, I never thought I would be back. Then, while walking to Dolores for a nice day at the park, decided to stop in and grab some brews and sandwiches.

My friend and I shared the Bryant St on a sourdough roll which was a delightful combination of turkey and pastrami, subtly spicy with jalepenos, and rich with cheddar cheese. It was a bit pricey, but filled up my friend and I, so I think it was worth the $9.95. The girl at the counter was so friendly and helpful, from explaining to us about the sandwiches we were considering to suggesting beer and chip accompaniments. I will be back for sure, as they were out of Dutch Crunch when we popped in and I would like to try it.

excerpts: I had the Korean Steak and the Buster Posey and both were by far the best sandwiches I've ever had, hands down.
Perfect ratio of ingredients, super juicy meats and an insane amount of flavor.
buster posey.author: Matthew D.
buster posey.review: These guys know how to make sandwiches. I had the Korean Steak and the Buster Posey and both were by far the best sandwiches I've ever had, hands down. Perfect ratio of ingredients, super juicy meats and an insane amount of flavor.

excerpts: I like the Buster Posey ( pastrami (locally made) wrapped in pastrami, melted pepper jack, creamy slaw, roasted pepper & garlic aioli, kc style bbq sauce served on toasted french roll) because it's made with heaping cuts of pastrami and the aioli and bbq sauce pair perfectly with it.
buster posey.author: Saminda W.
buster posey.review:
Rhea's is up there, definitely in the top 20 joints in the city for sammies.  It's a cross between Lou's in the Richmond and (the original) Ike's in the Castro: inventive and unique sandwich creations done up by some choice bread (never sleep on the bread, yo).

The Korean Steak (marinated rib eye steak, cheddar cheese, red onions, house pickled red onions & jalapenos, lettuce, chili sauce, garlic aioli, served on acme organic sweet roll) is the must-try and it's legit spicy and super-flavorful.  The bulgogi is a bit sweet and goes great with the chili sauce.  I like the Buster Posey ( pastrami (locally made) wrapped in pastrami, melted pepper jack, creamy slaw, roasted pepper & garlic aioli, kc style bbq sauce served on toasted french roll) because it's made with heaping cuts of pastrami and the aioli and bbq sauce pair perfectly with it.

excerpts: I went with the Buster Posey since they were out of the Korean BBQ.
buster posey.author: Neal C.
buster posey.review:
Like their counterparts Ike's, Lou's, and other sauce-y sandwich joints in the area, Rhea's has some delicious offerings. I went with the Buster Posey since they were out of the Korean BBQ. 

Plenty of pastrami, a great garlicky aioli, and pepper jack which added a bit of spice. Two things holding it back from being 5 stars for me are the very high prices for a medium sized sandwich ($10-12) and the long wait (15-30 minutes).

The location being in close proximity to Mission Dolores park makes it a great spot to grab and go sit at the iconic park overlooking the city.

excerpts: I ordered  a Buster Posey.
buster posey.author: Nick H.
buster posey.review:
"I'm on my way to Dolores Park.  Where should I grab lunch?"

"Ike's is good. They have like 100 different sandwiches."

"yeah. Nah. Been there. I'll figure something out."

Enter Rheas. Am I in a liquor store? or a sandwich shop? Both!? excellent...

I ordered  a Buster Posey.  My friend ordered a Korean Steak.  We split a 6 pack. We looked at each other halfway through with the nod of agreement that we had made a wise decision.  Rheas, I love you.

excerpts: The Buster Posey made me completely reconsider having sworn off pastrami and the Korean steak is unreal good too.
buster posey.author: Will R.
buster posey.review:
The perfect San Francisco day consists of a Dolores sandwich from Rhea's consumed at nearby Dolores park. Not just because it's a quintessentially San Franciscan thing to do, but because it's one of the best sandwiches you will eat and the park provides the perfect place to reflect on exactly how awesome it is. It's kind of an edgy take on the traditional Thanksgiving leftovers sandwich, with spicy turkey, cranberry sauce, and jalapenos, and they get it totally right.

It's pretty difficult to go wrong with any of the sandwich options at Rhea's. The Buster Posey made me completely reconsider having sworn off pastrami and the Korean steak is unreal good too.

Pro tip: call ahead 20 mins to order and avoid the in-person wait around lunchtime.

excerpts: Buster Posey sandwich: pastrami w/ pepper jack.
Loved the ACME roll & thicker cut of lean pastrami.
buster posey.author: Fancypants X.
buster posey.review:
In the 90's, a group of people hanging out in front of a liquor store usually meant trouble; cops flashed their lights, megaphone voices ordered the crowd to disperse. 

Now, a group of people hanging out in front of a liquor store means there's only six seats at the counter inside and facebook/instagram status updates have lured everyone & they mama to try some hyped-up deli sandwich.

Buster Posey sandwich: pastrami w/ pepper jack. Loved the ACME roll & thicker cut of lean pastrami. Would definitely order this again, but without the cheese because it didn't add any extra deliciousness for all the extra calories. 

Korean steak sandwich: piquant soy sauce/garlic marinade on the bulgogi. I had to stop after two bites because there was so much fat. We ordered it "medium" spicy & it had a delicious amount of heat. 

Their sandwich accoutrements are amazing, with a variety of spicy and garlicky spreads, there's a lot of goodness going on between those two buns!

excerpts: The Buster Posey is so meaty and delicious!
I would call ahead because they always have a long line out the door!
They also have healthy options :)
buster posey.author: Siobhan R.
buster posey.review: This local sandwhich spot is on point! The Buster Posey is so meaty and delicious! I would call ahead because they always have a long line out the door! They also have healthy options :)

excerpts: I used to pass by here after work years ago and grab the Korean Steak Sandwich for lunch.
It was $8 back then.
I left the Bay Area for a few years and came back to discover that the Korean sandwich is $13.
Bummer
The Korean steak was hot, not too salty, and had enough ginger and soy.
Garlic aioli was creamy and actually had garlic flavor.
Acidity from the pickled onions helped cut through the richness of everything.
There was enough cheddar and it melted just enough to act as sandwich glue.
The entire sandwich was juicy, yet, had great structural integrity and didn't fall apart in my hand.
Nothing in this sandwich was an afterthought.
The Korean steak was hot, not too salty, and had enough ginger and soy.
Garlic aioli was creamy and actually had garlic flavor.
Acidity from the pickled onions helped cut through the richness of everything.
There was enough cheddar and it melted just enough to act as sandwich glue.
The entire sandwich was juicy, yet, had great structural integrity and didn't fall apart in my hand.
Nothing in this sandwich was an afterthought.
steak.author: John B.
steak.review:
Pass by Rhea's if you want to see what good sandwich is supposed to look like! 

What Changed: The price soared in the past few years! But I guess that's just SOP. I used to pass by here after work years ago and grab the Korean Steak Sandwich for lunch. It was $8 back then. I left the Bay Area for a few years and came back to discover that the Korean sandwich is $13. Bummer but I'll still pay that price. 

What Didn't: This unassuming liquor store still makes some of the best sandwiches around! I was initially a bit worried that my high rating was somehow due to nostalgia, however, my recent return to Rhea's reminded me of why they deserve five stars. The ACME sweet roll was perfect for this application. I feel that bread is too often under appreciated in a sandwich and merely thought of as a vehicle to hold the fillings together. But here, that sweet roll had a nice crust, chewy texture, a kinda open crumb so there were enough air pockets that the aioli/hot sauce can fill with flavor, and the bread alone had good flavor as well. You know when you have a subpar sandwich that uses inferior bread? You reach the last bite where it's just the bread left and you're kinda like "no thanks I'm good." Yeah. That doesn't happen at Rhea's. The Korean steak was hot, not too salty, and had enough ginger and soy. Garlic aioli was creamy and actually had garlic flavor. Acidity from the pickled onions helped cut through the richness of everything. There was enough cheddar and it melted just enough to act as sandwich glue. The entire sandwich was juicy, yet, had great structural integrity and didn't fall apart in my hand. Nothing in this sandwich was an afterthought. Nothing! 

Extra Info: 
-Their hot sauce is not actually that spicy. And that's fine. I'd like to enjoy all the other flavors in my sandwich rather than feel too much of a kick in this situation. Order the spicy if you want to actually feel any heat. If not, go with mild or medium. Doesn't matter which. They are practically the same. 
-Barely any seating inside. Instead, purchase some chips and a drink and walk over to Dolores Park to eat with a fantastic view of the city!

excerpts: For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken.
I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time.
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's.
It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.
steak.author: Monica H.
steak.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich from Rhea's Deli!

I wanted something without meat, so the Church sandwich with veggie-chicken stood out to me. It also had swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli... all served on an Acme roll. DELICIOUS. 

For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken. I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time. 
 
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's. It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.

excerpts: The Korean steak sandwich is my all-time favorite
steak.author: Jeff P.
steak.review:
Love Rhea's Deli for their amazingly delicious sandwiches.  I have never been disappointed and have always enjoyed every single bite!    The Korean steak sandwich is my all-time favorite and I tend to order it 90% of the time but every other sandwich I have tried is superb!

I always call ahead because they can get super busy--it a good 10-15 minute drive for me across town into the beautiful Mission district 
and parking is of course consistency a challenge but it is worth it!

I Love Rhea's!

Indeed a super pleasant and delicious surprise every time!!!

excerpts: With that, I ordered their well known Korean steak sandwich for $12-ish.
steak.author: Mandi W.
steak.review:
I don't like sandwiches. There I said it.

With that, I ordered their well known Korean steak sandwich for $12-ish. 

It was so good I was really frustrated I had to share it with my boyfriend. Like, I considered taking it back. My sister also got a sandwich... When she set hers down I also considered taking hers for myself as well.

Get your own sandwich. You're welcome.

excerpts: I got the Korean Steak, mild.
The meat was tender and flavorful.
The mild was the perfect level of spicy for me.
One of the best sandwiches I've eaten EVER, and it was super filling.
If you're a smaller eater like me, you can even split the sandwich and be full.
steak.author: Danielle T.
steak.review:
I don't like sandwiches AT ALL, but I LOVED the sandwich I got at Rhea's. I got the Korean Steak, mild. The meat was tender and flavorful. The mild was the perfect level of spicy for me. One of the best sandwiches I've eaten EVER, and it was super filling. If you're a smaller eater like me, you can even split the sandwich and be full. Rhea's may be changing my mind about sandwiches! 

Rhea's also has a large variety of drinks and chips to accompany your sandwich. We tried out the Kettle brand Korean BBQ chips. It didn't taste much like Korean BBQ; it just tasted like regular barbecue chips. 

Take your sandwich to Mission Delores Park located only a couple blocks away, and it's a perfect picnic lunch!

excerpts: So far, I've tried the korean steak, the panda and the miss piggy.
My favorite is the miss piggy because it comes with pesto sauce, mozerella, and it has really good flavoring.
I ordered it based on yelp reviews and they didn't have it on the menu, but they knew what it was when I asked.
I didn't know this was a vegetarian sandwich
and I really should've double checked.
Next time I'll be ordering this, but with dutch crunch & salami or some type of meat!
BUT the sandwich itself was really good even without the meat, so
I'd say try the miss piggy with meat & dutch crunch, if you love pesto like I do!
I'm definitely coming back to re-do my order next time.
steak.author: Melanie T.
steak.review:
Their prices have raised a bit and it's pretty similar to Ike's sandwiches now. When you enter, they have little forms on the table for you to fill out for your sandwich. 

So far, I've tried the korean steak, the panda and the miss piggy. We wanted to order the chicken katsu today, but the worker said they don't serve it at this location anymore.

My favorite is the miss piggy because it comes with pesto sauce, mozerella, and it has really good flavoring. I ordered it based on yelp reviews and they didn't have it on the menu, but they knew what it was when I asked. I didn't know this was a vegetarian sandwich and I really should've double checked. Next time I'll be ordering this, but with dutch crunch & salami or some type of meat! BUT the sandwich itself was really good even without the meat, so I'm going to say it's still a win, lol.

The Panda was my boyfriends favorite, and it was pretty packed as well. The flavoring was really intense because there was a lot going on. It comes with pastrami, salami, pepperjack, pepperocini, roasted pepper aioli, & etc! You can see why it was so intense, lol!

We ordered two korean steaks the last time we were here and it was pretty bomb. It was filled with bulgogi meat, but the sauce had an interesting spice to it that I didn't really enjoy too much. But that's just my personal preference -- my boyfriend on the other hand, liked it.

I'd say try the miss piggy with meat & dutch crunch, if you love pesto like I do! I'm definitely coming back to re-do my order next time.

excerpts: I've had the Korean Steak, Barney Rubble, Chicken BBQ, and the Noe St sandwiches.
steak.author: Art O.
steak.review:
I've had a few sandwiches from this place now and they've all been solid.

I've had the Korean Steak, Barney Rubble, Chicken BBQ, and the Noe St sandwiches.

They're not exactly a bargain but they're made with care and one sandwich is usually way more than enough for a lunch.

The best bet is to call in your order and pick it up since it the line can get long sometimes.

excerpts: I think my favorites are Korean Steak (their signature sandwich),
The Panda, The Freak #55, and @studio_dad.
They are all so flavorful, and they use plenty of meat (unlike Ike's, these days...).
I prefer to order the spicy version of any sandwiches with spice ranges, although that's pretty spicy and maybe too spicy for some folks...
steak.author: Tay H.
steak.review:
You cannot go wrong with a sandwich from Rhea's - I've yet to have a bad one.  And, they make the PERFECT Dolores Park meal :)

I think my favorites are Korean Steak (their signature sandwich), The Panda, The Freak #55, and @studio_dad.  They are all so flavorful, and they use plenty of meat (unlike Ike's, these days...).  I prefer to order the spicy version of any sandwiches with spice ranges, although that's pretty spicy and maybe too spicy for some folks...  Prices are about right for the quality of the ingredients and the size of the sandwiches - they range from about $10-$12, in most cases.  

Service is pretty quick and the market has plenty of accompaniments for your sandwich - all the typical bodega items, I'd say.  Just make sure to go on the earlier side (they open at 11am) before they run out of Dutch Crunch.

P.S. The Acme Organic Sweet Roll and the Dutch Crunch are the best bread options.  I really didn't like the Toasted French Roll...kind of doughy and bland.

excerpts: The vegetarian steak sandwich is amazing.
It's hearty, full of flavor, and very filling.
One of my favorites from Rhea's.
My meat-eating friends live it too!
steak.author: Kristina K.
steak.review: The vegetarian steak sandwich is amazing. It's hearty, full of flavor, and very filling. One of my favorites from Rhea's. My meat-eating friends live it too!

excerpts: I had the Korean Steak and the Buster Posey and both were by far the best sandwiches I've ever had, hands down.
Perfect ratio of ingredients, super juicy meats and an insane amount of flavor.
steak.author: Matthew D.
steak.review: These guys know how to make sandwiches. I had the Korean Steak and the Buster Posey and both were by far the best sandwiches I've ever had, hands down. Perfect ratio of ingredients, super juicy meats and an insane amount of flavor.

excerpts: * Korean Steak - 3.5 stars
The flavors on this sandwich definitely pop.
And if you ask for spicy, you get the real deal!
They put in jalapeño slices which were actually too much for me.
steak.author: Ziyan C.
steak.review:
Glad to find another sandwich option near Valencia! It was a sad moment for me when Mission Picnic was closed one random Saturday, so I went to Yelp and just picked the closest option for "sandwiches" in the Mission.

I'd passed by this place so many times (and I think even shopped here once) and had no idea it was a deli in addition to a corner store.

I liked both sandwiches but didn't love them. However, the quality was good enough that I'm interested to go back and find better sandwiches and be able to bump up Rhea's overall rating.

THE SERVICE: They will answer the phone, and they will give accurate estimates on the wait. I really appreciate that!

THE WAIT: I called ahead around 1:30pm on a Saturday and it was about a 30 minute wait for the sandwiches.

THE COST: About $30 total for 2 sandwiches.

See my photos for additional info!

* Korean Steak - 3.5 stars
The flavors on this sandwich definitely pop. And if you ask for spicy, you get the real deal! They put in jalapeño slices which were actually too much for me. However, I found the quality of the meat slices to be low - they weren't quite lean, the texture came out a bit rubbery as it was rather fatty (and not in the good way that some meats can be). 

* The Valencia - 4 stars
Much more classic than the Korean, a little bland if you do a side-by-side comparison, but still very well done. I loved the avocado, and the bread was just perfect. A safe yet delicious go-to.

excerpts: The Korean Steak sandwich a genuine banger.
Highly recommended, and get it spicy.
The steak tastes like actual steak, instead of the sheets of general meat you get at some places.
Go here, get this sandwich, make it spicy, eat it in Dolores Park.
Guaranteed great day.
steak.author: Charlie R.
steak.review: The Korean Steak sandwich a genuine banger. Highly recommended, and get it spicy. The steak tastes like actual steak, instead of the sheets of general meat you get at some places. Go here, get this sandwich, make it spicy, eat it in Dolores Park. Guaranteed great day. Can't wait to try the Katsu sandwich next time.

excerpts: Had the vegetarian steak sandwich.
It was one of the best sandwiches of my life.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.
steak.author: William H.
steak.review: Had the vegetarian steak sandwich. It was one of the best sandwiches of my life. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

excerpts: After scanning the menu a few times, I debated between the Korean Steak or the 18th Street, which was personally recommended to me.
steak.author: Alexander E.
steak.review:
I love a great sandwich. I mean who doesn't? As per the recommendation of some co-workers, a co-worker and I decided to give Rhea's a try on this sunny Monday afternoon in San Francisco. Unfortunately Rhea's does not have a website, which means no current menu, but luckily their Yelp page has their sandwich menu. After scanning the menu a few times, I debated between the Korean Steak or the 18th Street, which was personally recommended to me. 

We were advised that Rhea's isn't a sit and eat kind of deli, so we called ahead for pickup. Once we arrived, both sandwiches were ready to go and although there was a small counter to eat, it's not the best place to enjoy your lunch hour. Besides the deli counter, it's your typical liquor corner store and not much else. My 18th Street sandwich ran me $9.

With it being such a nice day out, we took our sandwiches to nearby Dolores Park. As soon as you unwrap the butcher paper, the first thing you'll notice is the portion size. It's not terribly small but I had a feeling it wouldn't be filling either. I will say the sandwich packed plenty of flavor in between the Acme roll. The flavorful sandwich consisted of buffalo chicken, muenster cheese, bacon, baby arugula, red onion, which I opted out of, tomatoes, pickles and a chipotle aioli. 

Even with the abundance of flavors, nothing was overpowering and I enjoyed the sandwich without my usual splash of hot sauce.The recommendation on the sandwich was great and Rhea's is a great spot for a light and fluffy sandwich. However, I was disappointed in the overall size of the sandwich especially given that its coming from a corner store. I don't mind the $10 price point but I expected a bit more for my money. I do however agree with the consensus in that Rhea's makes one mean sandwich, just be sure to pickup some chips on the side. 

Pros:
+ Corner store with a full sandwich/deli counter
+ Large sandwich menu
+ Made to order sandwiches
+ Quick and tasty
+ Affordable prices
+ General corner store with full booze lineup and snacks

Cons:
- No website with full menu
- Small portion size

excerpts: I also tried their famous korean steak from a friend, and it was delicious.
The sandwiches are a little spicy, just the right amount.
The deli also has some pretty great snacks and drinks.
We got some delicious dark chocolate, some fancy crisps, and a bunch of other things.
This place is so recommended, and I will make sure to pick up a sandwich from there every time I go to Dolores park, which happens to be every time I am in the city.
steak.author: Riham B.
steak.review:
So here is how I got to hear of this place: We wanted to chill at Dolores Park and eat delicious sandwiches. So we called a few days before and ordered around 30 sandwiches (probably). Rhea's couldn't accommodate us. We were all disappointment since the menu had built up so much excitement about these glorious sandwiches. We then called them from Dolores park and ordered 5 sandwiches at a time, and lo and behold, we were able to get our hands on these sandwiches.

I was not disappointed. I ordered the 18th st sandwich, and it was so so good. I also tried their famous korean steak from a friend, and it was delicious. The sandwiches are a little spicy, just the right amount. 
The deli also has some pretty great snacks and drinks. We got some delicious dark chocolate, some fancy crisps, and a bunch of other things. This place is so recommended, and I will make sure to pick up a sandwich from there every time I go to Dolores park, which happens to be every time I am in the city.

excerpts: Korean Steak Sandwich-
MUST GET!!!!
So Damn GoOOOOoOODDDDD!!!!
steak.author: Stephanie L.
steak.review:
Korean Steak Sandwich- MUST GET!!!! So Damn GoOOOOoOODDDDD!!!! Just a medley of flavors and textures in each bite.

Chicken Katsu Sandwich- pass. The katsu was very crispy, but the chicken was dry. Plus the bread was hard. Overall, a tough sandwich. My jaw was tired from chewing afterwards.

excerpts: The meat was nicely marinated and had a philly cheese steak-type consistency which I enjoyed.
Delicious!
Overall, it was a solid sandwich that can easily be split with 2 people.
steak.author: Elizabeth A.
steak.review:
It was a little confusing how to order at first. They have papers by the cashier where you fill out your request. Then, you get in line and pay for your sandwich with your paper order. So, pick out your drinks and snacks before you get in line to pay for your sandwich. The cashier then hands your order to the deli section where the magic happens!

I ordered the Korean BBQ sandwich (~$11 before tax). There were only 3 people ahead of me, but they said the wait would be 20 minutes. 20 minutes?! Whoa, they must really put some lovin' into their sandwiches! When I heard my name finally called, I grabbed my FAT sandwich and made my way to Dolores Park. Upon unraveling the sandwich, I was delighted to see that there was SO. MUCH. MEAT!! I requested it spicy and it really packed a punch. The meat was nicely marinated and had a philly cheese steak-type consistency which I enjoyed. Delicious! Overall, it was a solid sandwich that can easily be split with 2 people.

excerpts: The Korean Steak (marinated rib eye steak, cheddar cheese, red onions, house pickled red onions & jalapenos, lettuce, chili sauce, garlic aioli, served on acme organic sweet roll) is the must-try
and it's legit spicy and super-flavorful.
The bulgogi is a bit sweet and goes great with the chili sauce.
steak.author: Saminda W.
steak.review:
Rhea's is up there, definitely in the top 20 joints in the city for sammies.  It's a cross between Lou's in the Richmond and (the original) Ike's in the Castro: inventive and unique sandwich creations done up by some choice bread (never sleep on the bread, yo).

The Korean Steak (marinated rib eye steak, cheddar cheese, red onions, house pickled red onions & jalapenos, lettuce, chili sauce, garlic aioli, served on acme organic sweet roll) is the must-try and it's legit spicy and super-flavorful.  The bulgogi is a bit sweet and goes great with the chili sauce.  I like the Buster Posey ( pastrami (locally made) wrapped in pastrami, melted pepper jack, creamy slaw, roasted pepper & garlic aioli, kc style bbq sauce served on toasted french roll) because it's made with heaping cuts of pastrami and the aioli and bbq sauce pair perfectly with it.

excerpts: Have come back for the Korean steak as well as the chicken katsu sandwiches.
While both are delicious as heck, the Korean steak one trumps them all for me.
While both are delicious as heck, the Korean steak one trumps them all for me.

Tasty sweet steak.. mmmm

Top notch sandwiches!

steak.review:
Have come back for the Korean steak as well as the chicken katsu sandwiches. 
While both are delicious as heck, the Korean steak one trumps them all for me. Tasty sweet steak.. mmmm

Top notch sandwiches!

excerpts: I'd been craving Korean food so when I saw the Korean steak sandwich I had to get it...
steak.author: Christina S.
steak.review:
Was across the street getting boba and stopped in here to get a sandwich to go to take to work. I'd been craving Korean food so when I saw the Korean steak sandwich I had to get it...

I LOVE sandwiches and I can hands down say this is the best sandwich I have ever had in my life. Yes, better than Ikes!! AND it satisfied my craving for some Korean food flavors. 

The bread was perfect, the meat was perfect, the spice level and sauce was absolutely amazing and the pickled red onions and jalepenos were still crunchy. Definitely a WOW factor

I would've given them 5 stars had the sandwich not been so small for $13.09

steak.review:
Grab an order sheet by the cashier, fill it out, take it to the register and pay. Then just wait for your name to be called and your sandwich is ready. There seemed to be confusion among customers with what to do/how to order so I think some signage with instruction would be nice. I saw a yelp photo from a few years back that showed instructions for ordering were posted at the deli but nothing was posted when I paid a visit this past weekend. 

Order the korean steak sandwich! There's lots of steak and it's very flavorful, and you can order it as spicy as you'd like. And the Acme bread is incredible! There are tons of other sandwich options so there's definitely something for everybody.

steak.author: Olivia T.
steak.review:
Their sandwiches are amazing. I really enjoyed the Korean Steak sandwich. The shop also sells chips and drinks. Its the perfect place to pick up everything you need for a nice picnic at Dolores Park (its like a 5 minute walk from here). 

The Korean Steak comes on a sour dough like bread but its not as hard or sour. I got it without cheese because I saw someone else's review that suggested it would taste better without it. The sauce that comes with the sandwich makes it moist and it comes with a spicy kick. You can get it mild, medium or hot. The meat was marinated and thinly sliced so the sandwich held together very well. The vegetables are fresh and complements the other flavors of the sandwich.

It can be a little wait before you receive your sandwich though. I came here on a Saturday around noon and we waited around 20 minutes. I didn't know there was a lot of people ahead of me because majority of the customers walk around outside while waiting.

steak.author: Maya B.
steak.review:
Split the Korean steak sandwich with a friend today. Not the first time we've been there and certainly won't be the last time. The Korean steak sandwich is of course, Rhea's signature sandwich and for good reason. We got ours in less than five minutes (Wednesday, cloudy, lunchtime; your mileage may vary on a warm weekend when everyone and everyone wants a sammie to take to Dolores).

It's immensely flavorful, unique, and the flavors are well-balanced. You'll get notes of umami, sweet, salty, sour, spicy and creamy with each bite. The bread they use is excellent and the portions are hearty (again, we split a whole sandwich yet both of us were satisfied). We ordered it medium spicy and it was the perfect rendition of medium. The heat kicked in slowly but was never overwhelming. 

I've been a Rhea's customer for almost 17 years (as long as I've lived in the Mission) and I remember when it really was just a corner store (albeit a well-run one even back in the day). For several year now, it's been a corner store *plus* a fantastic sandwich deli. 

The Korean steak sandwich is a go-to for good reason, but the entire sandwich menu is creative and worth checking out. Never had a bad sammie but when I explore other options, I always want to reserve the option of swapping half of whatever I'm trying out for half of the Korean steak and thus I always eat there with at least one other person.

James Choi is the fourth owner of Rhea's according to the Check Please episode that highlighted them (and I happened to walk by, back when they filmed that episode years ago; so fun to watch both the filming of it and the actual episode). His parents ran it before he took over and reinvented it a bit, for the better. Super nice, very genuine guy and so are the people that work there (link below is to a profile of "Corner Store George"):

http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/cityexposed/article/Corner-store-is-his-vocation-2309673.php

A neighborhood gem that's also a worthy destination even for people who don't live nearby.

The place was swamped with customers waiting in line to order sandwiches, and much to our chagrin, they were sold out of the Korean Steak Sandwich.
But instead of leaving in a huff - a specialty of mine - we saw there were quite a few sandwiches that sounded tempting.

steak.author: Ed U.
steak.review:
The primary reason Jamie W. and I headed over to Rhea's after hanging out on a lazy Sunday afternoon at Dolores Park was to try the Korean Steak Sandwich. I was on the Chefs' Feed app and read Foreign Cinema chef Gayle Pirie's rave about it, so I thought it was worth us heading over there to try it. The place was swamped with customers waiting in line to order sandwiches, and much to our chagrin, they were sold out of the Korean Steak Sandwich. But instead of leaving in a huff - a specialty of mine - we saw there were quite a few sandwiches that sounded tempting. The challenge was reviewing the menu taped on 8 x 11 sheets in front of the sandwich makers because there was a queue of  hungry people in the way.

I believe it was the first day for the young guy taking the orders at the cash register, and he was overwhelmed by the chaos. However, he kept a sunny disposition which I genuinely appreciated since a few of the customers were on the high maintenance side. Jamie ended up ordering the $7.95 Harrison Street, a hot pastrami and cheddar cheese sandwich with red onion, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini, spicy brown mustard and chipotle aioli all stuffed into an Acme organic roll (see photo). Hearty stuff and quite delicious. Mine was simpler and quite good, too...the $7.95 Boar's Head Roast Beef with spicy mustard, lettuce, tomato and mayo, all in a fresh Dutch crunch roll (see photo). We managed to snag two stools at the small counter in front and let others envy us for our gigantic sandwiches.

FOOD - 4 stars...huge, fresh sandwiches are enough to satisfy anyone in need
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...just a mini-mart with a sandwich counter
SERVICE - 4 stars...the new guy did good
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely need to come back for that Korean Steak Sandwich now that it's on our radar

excerpts: He got the Korean steak sandwich and loved it also.

i end up having " The Freak 55" with pastrami and kimchi was amazing as well...
