excerpts: Got the Korean steak sandwich.
Pretty good.
I like the concept but they could work on the customer service.
Stood in front of the deli counter for a while and the sandwich guy just ignored me.
Finally went up to the cashier and asked where I ordered and he took my order
(then I saw the sandwich guy ask the guy behind me if he needed to order so it wasn't like the cashier always takes orders).
Thirty-five minutes later, yes *35* minutes later, I got my sandwich.
If it's going to take that long, you would think they'd give a heads up.
At least I'd have been able to bring my copy of War and Peace and finished it by the time I got my lukewarm sandwich.
steak.author: kiwi l.
steak.review:
Got the Korean steak sandwich.  Pretty good.  I like the concept but they could work on the customer service.  Stood in front of the deli counter for a while and the sandwich guy just ignored me.  Finally went up to the cashier and asked where I ordered and he took my order (then I saw the sandwich guy ask the guy behind me if he needed to order so it wasn't like the cashier always takes orders).  Thirty-five minutes later, yes *35* minutes later, I got my sandwich.  If it's going to take that long, you would think they'd give a heads up.  At least I'd have been able to bring my copy of War and Peace and finished it by the time I got my lukewarm sandwich.  Sammy was tasty, but  too sweet. 

Also docked a star since I was sitting outside, they saw me waiting for over half an hour, they knew I was waiting since I asked about it 10 minutes before, and they didn't even call my name!  It was only when the guy behind me got called that I asked about my sandwich and then they say, "Oh, you're sandwich is ready, it's up at the counter"  WTF?!  Yeah, I'll probably stick to Ike's 'cause at least they have a SYSTEM.   
Suggestions: put a sign up next to the cashier saying "Order sandwiches here" and make sure the cashier says how long the wait is.  If the cashier has to stock inventory in the cold cases, don't let him do it when there are customers in the store since people were waiting around wondering why they have to wait 5 minutes to buy a pack of cigarettes when there were so many people waiting and no one behind the register.  That way introverted sandwich guy can focus on making the sandwiches and put out more than 1 every 15 minutes.  And you may want more than 1 person making sandwiches during lunch hour.  I'm sure my sandwich would've tasted better if I didn't have the bitter taste of bad service in my mouth.

excerpts: I had the korean steak sammy and it was about the best sandwich I have had in SF.
I am dying to try the pork Katsu sammy (maybe tomorrow even).
The owner was there talking to someone about how he pounds the cutlets every night
and it makes his arms sore (he said about 10 qty of them takes him about a 1/2 hour) .
All the workers were super friendly, and concerned about everyone's order.
The place seems nice and clean (especially for the mission).
If this weren't so far away from my neighborhood I could see being a bi-(or tri) weekly regular.
steak.author: Amy W.
steak.review: The reviews didn't lie. I had the korean steak sammy and it was about the best sandwich I have had in SF. I am dying to try the pork Katsu sammy (maybe tomorrow even).  The owner was there talking to someone about how he pounds the cutlets every night and it makes his arms sore (he said about 10 qty of them takes him about a 1/2 hour) . All the workers were super friendly, and concerned about everyone's order.  The place seems nice and clean (especially for the mission).  If this weren't so far away from my neighborhood I could see being a bi-(or tri) weekly regular.

excerpts: I was really upset the first time I had the Korean steak sandwich.
steak.author: Christie C.
steak.review:
I was really upset the first time I had the Korean steak sandwich. I couldn't believe my mother made me bulgogi all these years and never thought to produce it in sandwich form herself. 

The bread's perfectly crunchy AND soft, the onions add just the right amount of oomph to the perfectly marinated meat, and the sauce is the kind that burns in your tummy for a while afterwards, but in a good way. But to echo other reviewers, get the mild. I'm pretty snobby/arrogant about my spicy tolerance, but I definitely had to pause halfway through my "medium" spicy sandwich. The sandwich has plenty of flavor, regardless of spicy level. 

My only wish is that they'd stay open later on weekdays, so I can treat myself to an amazing sandwich after work...

excerpts: He made me an amazing steak sandwich, and when I was done, I went to ride home--but my bike had a flat.
Always the worst!
I went inside to ask about a nearby bike shop, but Beard Dude just happened to have a pump on hand.
Lucked out this time!
Rhea's rules!
Thanks beard guy.
steak.author: x x.
steak.review: It's true, the guy with the beard is simply the best.   He made me an amazing steak sandwich, and when I was done, I went to ride home--but my bike had a flat.  Always the worst!  I went inside to ask about a nearby bike shop, but Beard Dude just happened to have a pump on hand.  Lucked out this time! Rhea's rules!  Thanks beard guy.

excerpts: Definitely be back again to try their famous Korean Steak Sandwich,
steak.author: Mauling W.
steak.review:
Did you say you want to take me out for dinner, honey? Yes! Great! Where are we going? Limon? Maverick? Beretta? Nope... Rhea's Deli!
What? Ok. So I Yelped this place and to my surprise, all stars!! Okay lets go now for some sandwiches. No one would guess they had a little deli counter in the back inside a corner liquor market. I ordered the Valencia w/ turkey and havarti. My hubbie had the Cunningham w/ salami and cheddar. Mine was perfect. His on the otherhand was too oily due to the fact the sandwich was toasted and the cheddar melted. Otherwise, both was nicely done especially the red onions and the garlic spread. Definitely be back again to try their famous Korean Steak Sandwich,

excerpts: So i got a $61 korean steak sandwich here last saturday - $8 for the sandwich and $53 for the expired meter ticket (thank you DPT!)
Next time I'll just use the the free delivery - with $10 minimum, it'll just mean that i have to get BOTH a korean steak sandwich and
chicken katsu sandwich.(or maybe throw some beer, chips, candy, etc in there
Next time I'll just use the the free delivery - with $10 minimum, it'll just mean that i have to get BOTH a korean steak sandwich and
chicken katsu sandwich.(or maybe throw some beer, chips, candy, etc in there
steak.author: Jules L.
steak.review:
So i got a $61 korean steak sandwich here last saturday - $8 for the sandwich and $53 for the expired meter ticket (thank you DPT!)

My bad, i didn't think it would take longer than 20 mins to get my sandwich, delicious as it was.  But my bout of begging the meter maid not to give me a ticket didn't sour me on Rhea's deli.  Next time I'll just use the the free delivery - with $10 minimum, it'll just mean that i have to get BOTH a korean steak sandwich and chicken katsu sandwich.(or maybe throw some beer, chips, candy, etc in there

excerpts: I had the Korean Steak Sandwich and Wifey had the Portabella Mushroom Sandwich.
Liberal use of spicy spreads gave the eats a glow that enhanced the other flavors.
The second night - they were out of the Korean Steak which was a real bummer.
That is the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.
The second night - they were out of the Korean Steak which was a real bummer.
That is the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.
steak.author: Star G.
steak.review:
MMMMMMMmmmmmm! Thank you fellow Yelpers for turning us on to this hole in the wall deli inside a liquor store. The dude making the sandwiches took his time and carefully made us two of the best we have ever had. No joking. It was that good! I had the Korean Steak Sandwich and Wifey had the Portabella Mushroom Sandwich. Liberal use of spicy spreads gave the eats a glow that enhanced the other flavors. ...The bread was fresh!

We ate at the the place two nights in a row while visiting the city. The second night - they were out of the Korean Steak which was a real bummer. That is the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.

excerpts: The Korean Steak sandwich is super good!
Maybe it was the fact that I was crazy starving and could barely wait to eat this when I got home
, this is well worth the $8.50.
I got the mild version and it totally was mild.
steak.author: cyndi L.
steak.review:
The Korean Steak sandwich is super good! Maybe it was the fact that I was crazy starving and could barely wait to eat this when I got home, this is well worth the $8.50. I got the mild version and it totally was mild. I hate when it's too spicy and I'm not in the mood to have my mouth on fire. 

When you get there, go to the deli counter and grab a little piece of paper that will let you mark up what you want on your sandwich. After that give it to the cashier and then they'll hand it to the sandwich counter.

Went around 1:30 on a Friday and the wait wasn't bad, about 10-15 minutes. Not a problem I wandered over to Paxton Gate to browse.

Bare bones little liquor shop. Other than the deli there's nothing to make you go there unless you need to load up on libations.

excerpts: I got the Korean Steak sandwich as it was perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious.
I originally requested it to be medium spicy but the guy taking my order asked if it was my first time (it was)
and said I should try mild first.
steak.author: Anna Y.
steak.review:
I got the Korean Steak sandwich as it was perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious. I originally requested it to be medium spicy but the guy taking my order asked if it was my first time (it was) and said I should try mild first. I still think I would have been able to handle the medium, but I was thankful he was being so conscientious. 

The wait was a bit long and they did warn me beforehand (10-15 minutes) on a rainy Saturday afternoon. The guy at the counter also took pity on me and let me use my last remaining $1 to buy an Aero chocolate bar (usually $2).

excerpts: Korean steak, pork katsu, pastrami...
it's all great!
steak.author: Peg W.
steak.review: Hmm, good. Great sandwiches and service. Korean steak, pork katsu, pastrami...it's all great!

excerpts: The vege-steak sandwich is UNHOLY in its deliciousness.
I mean this.
It is the best sandwich I've ever had, and I want them to never, ever, ever stop making it.
Do you hear me, Rhea's?
steak.author: heather c.
steak.review: The vege-steak sandwich is UNHOLY in its deliciousness. I mean this. It is the best sandwich I've ever had, and I want them to never, ever, ever stop making it. Do you hear me, Rhea's?

excerpts: After reading the sign advertising the vegetarian steak sandwich for the umpteenth time, I stopped in on a hungry walk home one Friday evening to see what the fuss was about.
Well, I still don't know what the fuss is about, 'cause after perusing the menu, I decided to get the veggie bbq "chicken" sandwich instead --
and oh my goodness.
I daydream about this sandwich.
Astonishingly delicious marinated "chicken," lots of veggies, some kind of spicy aioli...
I don't even care, I just know it tastes amazing.
One of these days I will have to try the veggie steak sandwich, but I am not sure how it could beat this one.
steak.author: Stacia T.
steak.review:
I pass this place almost every day on my walk to work and on my way home again. After reading the sign advertising the vegetarian steak sandwich for the umpteenth time, I stopped in on a hungry walk home one Friday evening to see what the fuss was about. Well, I still don't know what the fuss is about, 'cause after perusing the menu, I decided to get the veggie bbq "chicken" sandwich instead -- and oh my goodness. I daydream about this sandwich. Astonishingly delicious marinated "chicken," lots of veggies, some kind of spicy aioli... I don't even care, I just know it tastes amazing. One of these days I will have to try the veggie steak sandwich, but I am not sure how it could beat this one.

I don't get off work until 5:30 and I really wish Rhea's was open 'til 6 on weekdays. I've bought a sandwich for lunch a couple of times, but they're kind of messy and I'm usually in a rush. 

The service is usually pretty efficient. I've never had to wait too long, but that could be lucky timing. Ordering in advance by phone seems to be the way to go if you don't want to wait.

One time I left work late and came in right after 6 on a Friday, when they were just closing up the deli. The guy working the counter saw my disappointment and was really sweet -- agreed to make me a sandwich even though he was about to leave. I spent a few minutes chatting with the cashier, and I walked out with my sandwich feeling great, mouth watering. Made my whole evening.

excerpts: i've always wanted to try the korean steak sandwich but it took me forever to stop in.
steak.author: Regina C.
steak.review:
this place has been on my "bookmarks" for a LONG time. i've always wanted to try the korean steak sandwich but it took me forever to stop in.

 you know how there's the whole korean taco kick going on? every time i eat a korean taco i think to myself "this is great, but i wish i had some rice instead of this corn tortilla." uhhh well that tells me i'd rather be eating at a traditional korean bbq spot rather than having it all mexican fusioned. i thought a korean sandwich might have me feeling the same thing. but when i bit into the sandwich my mind went insane for a little bit! the sweet of the korean beef mixed with the spicy of the aioli and jalapenos, the salty of the sharp cheddar and the fantastic acme bread was amazing! i would take korean beef in a Rhea's sandwich over korean beef with rice any day! SO good. get your hands on one! in fact, get your hands on two and save one for me. we'll go kick it in the park and eat these amazing sandwiches in silence. talking can wait for after the sandwiches. haha!!

excerpts: i had the korean steak sandwich.
spicy, yummy, tender, tasty.
we also ordered the vegetarian sandwich and the person loved it even though she wasn't vegetarian.
turkey sandwich also got the thumbs up.
is there any sandwich here that isnt liked?
steak.author: I Be E.
steak.review:
a liquor store AND great sandwiches?  yes, it is possible.  

i had the korean steak sandwich.  spicy, yummy, tender, tasty.  we also ordered the vegetarian sandwich and the person loved it even though she wasn't vegetarian.  turkey sandwich also got the thumbs up.  is there any sandwich here that isnt liked?
im going to find out.

how come no one told me about the katsu sandwich dammit?  gonna have to go back and get one, and a 40 for my homies.

excerpts: Korean Steak, Valencia Street, Noe Street, Judah Street, and 18th Street sandwiches are some of my top choices.
steak.author: Marieke V.
steak.review: Love this sandwich spot. Probably my favorite sandwich place of my life. The bread is delicious, the ingredients are high quality and fresh. I try to get a Rhea's sandwich at least once a week if not more! So gooooood. I have tried quite a few of their sandwiches and like to try something new here and there. Korean Steak, Valencia Street, Noe Street, Judah Street, and 18th Street sandwiches are some of my top choices.

excerpts: I had some of my girlfriend's Medium Spicy Korean Beef Steak and it was good as well.
The beef was tender, flavorful and there wasn't much fat unlike most Bulgogi at a Korean restaurant.
steak.author: Sam P.
steak.review:
Came here on Sunday during the Pride Parade, drove through traffic and spent over 30mins finding street parking. Took the first bite of my Spicy Pork Katsu on Acme bread sandwich and it was worth the trip! In sandwiches, I usually try to avoid the crust but the acme bread's crust was crispy I couldn't get enough of it. Spicy is actually spicy, so don't get spicy if you cannot handle it. All the elements in this sandwich works good together. 

I had some of my girlfriend's Medium Spicy Korean Beef Steak and it was good as well. The beef was tender, flavorful and there wasn't much fat unlike most Bulgogi at a Korean restaurant. The sandwiches can get messy, so don't forget to grab extra napkins. 

This place is definitely on the same level as Ike's, if not better! They have good selection of beers and a counter to eat while you watch people walk-by. What more can you ask on a nice Sunday afternoon?

excerpts: Get the Korean steak sandwich and pack your bags for heaven.
steak.author: Jeremy R.
steak.review: One of the best sandwiches in SF I have had. Get the Korean steak sandwich and pack your bags for heaven.

excerpts: So underwhelmed by the Korean steak sandwich.
Bread was for sure day old.
Steak was not tender nor well marinated.
Everyone on the jock tip has seriously never had a delicious sandwich with high quality meat and bread.
Over priced for poor quality.
If you like big portions this is your joint.
steak.author: L. I. Z.
steak.review: So underwhelmed by the Korean steak sandwich. Bread was for sure day old. Steak was not tender nor well marinated. Everyone on the jock tip has seriously never had a delicious sandwich with high quality meat and bread.   Over priced for poor quality. If you like big portions this is your joint.

excerpts: I ordered the Korean Steak Sandwich....it was massive.
Definitely could feed two easily.
The bread was alright, not the best I've had...but the melded flavors of salty, spicy, and sweet was heaven.
The meat was marinated well with lots of flavor and not too salty.
The extras that came with it like the pickled onions and grilled onions definitely went well with everything.
You get to choose the cheese, but it's hard to blend cheese with asian flavors...
but who doesn't like cheese...
so just go for it.
These Deli definitely serves unconventional sandwiches and allows the ingredients to shine without any frill.
Simply food done well makes for a happy belly.
steak.author: Melanie S.
steak.review: This deli/liquor store epitomizes the Mission District of San Francisco....kinda hipster, pretty small, kinda random, but serves great flavors.  I loved it!  I ordered the Korean Steak Sandwich....it was massive.  Definitely could feed two easily.  The bread was alright, not the best I've had...but the melded flavors of salty, spicy, and sweet was heaven.  The meat was marinated well with lots of flavor and not too salty.  The extras that came with it like the pickled onions and grilled onions definitely went well with everything.  You get to choose the cheese, but it's hard to blend cheese with asian flavors...but who doesn't like cheese...so just go for it.  These Deli definitely serves unconventional sandwiches and allows the ingredients to shine without any frill.  Simply food done well makes for a happy belly.

excerpts: I like the Korean steak sandwich more than the Chicken katsu sandwich.
The grilled panini is good too!
steak.author: George M.
steak.review:
Great sandwiches!
I like the Korean steak sandwich more than the Chicken katsu sandwich.
The grilled panini is good too!

excerpts: My fav is the Korean Steak sandwich.
The sandwiches are much better than Birite and Ike's Place for me.
steak.author: teatzar s.
steak.review: Consistent great sandwiches!  My fav is the Korean Steak sandwich.  The sandwiches are much better than Birite and Ike's Place for me.

excerpts: We split the Korean steak sandwich.
It's just as amazing as everyone else makes it out to be.
Spicy, meaty, cheesy, and bursting with complementing seasonings.
Make a lunch run of this place and you won't be disappointed.
steak.author: Allen F.
steak.review: This is a very unassuming liquor store looking deli. I actually passed it by when I was walking alone the night before and was surprised when my friend took me here the next day for a sandwich run. We split the Korean steak sandwich. It's just as amazing as everyone else makes it out to be. Spicy, meaty, cheesy, and bursting with complementing seasonings. Make a lunch run of this place and you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Sitting down at Dolores Park to eat my steak sandwich, I found it had some ordinary semi-stringy bulgogi on it and a few other ok ingredients, but it wasn't balanced and the flavors & textures didn't complement each other -- just a bunch of stuff chucked together in a lump, which is amateur sandwich making to be honest.
steak.author: Nick C.
steak.review:
Pretty ordinary food. Sometimes hype just spins out of control. No doubt that Bi-Rite sandwiches are on a seriously higher level than this place, for about the same price. Good volume, though, if you just want to get full.

Sitting down at Dolores Park to eat my steak sandwich, I found it had some ordinary semi-stringy bulgogi on it and a few other ok ingredients, but it wasn't balanced and the flavors & textures didn't complement each other -- just a bunch of stuff chucked together in a lump, which is amateur sandwich making to be honest. 

The bread was good quality, so I picked out the meat, ate one side of the bread with the cheese and threw the rest in the garbage.

excerpts: I tried the Spicy Korean Steak Sandwich and it has changed my life, never again will I go to Dolores without a cider and a sandwich from here.
steak.author: Jasmine D.
steak.review: AMAZING!! Been here a few times and for some reason never realized I needed to get one of their specialty sandwiches... wtf?!?!  Never go here and order a regular sandwich trust me you are missing out too!  I tried the Spicy Korean Steak Sandwich and it has changed my life, never again will I go to Dolores without a cider and a sandwich from here.

excerpts: I got the Korean Steak and it was really good.
Great combination of spicy and sweetness with the marinated cut up steak.
Only came here once and I really enjoyed it.
Lots of variety of sandwiches.
steak.author: Nelson G.
steak.review: I got the Korean Steak and it was really good. Great combination of spicy and sweetness with the marinated cut up steak. Only came here once and I really enjoyed it. Lots of variety of sandwiches. Plan to try a Katsu Sandwich or a Roast Beef Sandwich(19th Street) during my next visit.

excerpts: Everyone loves the Korean steak and the Katsu sandwiches, so I want to put a good word in for the 17th Ave.
(chicken, pepperoni, spinach, red onions, mozzarella, marinara sauce, garlic aoli).
SO GOOD!!!
Also, I find it so odd there are some negative reviews about service.
Sure, there can be a long wait
(the demand is probably higher than they expected, but I heard they were putting in a second counter to help with that).
Everyone who works here is ridiculously nice.
In conclusion, you should eat here.
It's delicious.
steak.author: Katie F.
steak.review: Best sandwiches in the city (and possibly the world).  Everything is fresh and I love the Acme rolls.  Everyone loves the Korean steak and the Katsu sandwiches, so I want to put a good word in for the 17th Ave. (chicken, pepperoni, spinach, red onions, mozzarella, marinara sauce, garlic aoli).  SO GOOD!!!  Also, I find it so odd there are some negative reviews about service.  Sure, there can be a long wait (the demand is probably higher than they expected, but I heard they were putting in a second counter to help with that).  Everyone who works here is ridiculously nice. In conclusion, you should eat here.  It's delicious.

excerpts: The Korean Steak Sandwich is a god sent.
I don't think I have ever had a better steak sandwich.
The lovely thing is, it comes in the form of perfection.
There is no need to ask to "hold this" or "add that", we ordered the "hot" version and it was just that.
There were a couple of fatty parts I had to spit out otherwise
, I would have given this place a 5.
They sell good chocolate, Perrier, and beer,
I don't need much else.
steak.author: Jessica B.
steak.review: The Korean Steak Sandwich is a god sent.  I don't think I have ever had a better steak sandwich.  The lovely thing is, it comes in the form of perfection.  There is no need to ask to "hold this" or "add that", we ordered the "hot" version and it was just that.  There were a couple of fatty parts I had to spit out otherwise, I would have given this place a 5.  They sell good chocolate, Perrier, and beer,  I don't need much else.

excerpts: The Korean Steak Sandwich is quite possibly the best sandwich I've ever had.
The only reason for anything less than 5 stars are the limited hours during which this amazing sandwich is available.
When I work late, I would love nothing more than to grab one of these on my way home.
But alas, the deli closes at 5 on weekdays...
steak.author: David F.
steak.review: The Korean Steak Sandwich is quite possibly the best sandwich I've ever had.  The only reason for anything less than 5 stars are the limited hours during which this amazing sandwich is available.  When I work late, I would love nothing more than to grab one of these on my way home.  But alas, the deli closes at 5 on weekdays...

excerpts: the bbq korean steak sandwich is absolutely phenomenal!
the flavors are seriously out of this world.
not a carnivore?
they have the bbq fake chicken version for you veg heads, and any typical sandwich one would crave.
steak.author: Sheri N.
steak.review:
this place is the underdog of delis.  fresh sandwiches with quality meat.  the bbq korean steak sandwich is absolutely phenomenal!  the flavors are seriously out of this world.  not a carnivore?  they have the bbq fake chicken version for you veg heads, and any typical sandwich one would crave.  they have a pork katsu sandwich that i'd like to try next.

the guys who work there are friendly and funny.  they have all the staples you need from a deli/liquor store.  

you need to try their sandwiches...they're that amazing!

excerpts: Korean steak sandwich is awesome!
Great flavoring of the beef and quite a bit of hear, but not overwhelming.
Also can buy and drink beer there.
This isn't for the faint of hear though.
It can be a little rough on the stomach if you know what I'm saying.
If are walking through the area on the way to/from Zeitgeist
this is a welcomed stop along the way!
steak.author: Nicholas H.
steak.review: Korean steak sandwich is awesome! Great flavoring of the beef and quite a bit of hear, but not overwhelming.  Also can buy and drink beer there. This isn't for the faint of hear though. It can be a little rough on the stomach if you know what I'm saying. If are walking through the area on the way to/from Zeitgeist this is a welcomed stop along the way!

excerpts: My coworkers crave the Korean steak sandwich on a regular basis.
The cheese, sauces, mustard, pickled onions, arugula, etc.
options for topping are endless.
The owner and employees are always friendly, and the store carries quality food and drink for your basic corner store needs as well.
steak.author: Elizabeth T.
steak.review: I work a block away from this store, amidst numerous, eclectic eateries of the Mission district. Their sandwiches are my favorite around! They are amazingly FRESH, UNIQUE, COMPLEX, and DELICIOUS. My favorites are the pork katsu (asian style fried pork chop) with cabbage slaw, and the portobello mushroom panini. My coworkers crave the Korean steak sandwich on a regular basis. The cheese, sauces, mustard, pickled onions, arugula, etc. options for topping are endless. The owner and employees are always friendly, and the store carries quality food and drink for your basic corner store needs as well.

excerpts: the other reviewers before me were absolutely correct: the korean steak sandwich is amazing.
get it.
get it spicy.
ill be hard pressed not to just keep ordering the korean steak sandwich, though.
ill be hard pressed not to just keep ordering the korean steak sandwich, though.
steak.author: Cyrus C.
steak.review:
dont need to say much here.  the other reviewers before me were absolutely correct: the korean steak sandwich is amazing.  get it.  get it spicy.  get it now.  

i will return, maybe to try the pork katsu.  ill be hard pressed not to just keep ordering the korean steak sandwich, though.

excerpts: My coworker had read about their korean steak sandwiches on a local blog and suggested we drop in during our lunch break.
Hefty portions of bul-go-gi and the toppings.
I had enough for both lunch and dinner.
steak.author: Stacey L.
steak.review: My coworker had read about their korean steak sandwiches on a local blog and suggested we drop in during our lunch break.  Hefty portions of bul-go-gi and the toppings.  I had enough for both lunch and dinner.  I think next time I'll try the katsu sandwich.  Sandwich & drink came out $10.50. My Coworkers picked up a few jars of the home made kim chi on the way out.  The wait time was approximately 20 min which seemed a little on the long side, but well worth the wait.  I advise calling in your order ahead of time. Friendly service.

excerpts: The smell was intoxicating and was only topped when I took a bite out of the massive Korean Steak Sandwich.
There was no need for nicotine or another addictive substance; the wonderful blend of sauce, peppers, and meat did all that and more on
steak.author: Matt W.
steak.review:
The only regret I have about letting my co-worker get me addicted to these sandwiches is that I don't have any money at the moment to buy more.

I rarely eat lunch these days, but after seeing my co-worker eat these sandwiches, I gave him $10 and had him pick up his favorite sandwich for me to try.  From the minute he walked back in the door, I was hooked.  The smell was intoxicating and was only topped when I took a bite out of the massive Korean Steak Sandwich.  There was no need for nicotine or another addictive substance; the wonderful blend of sauce, peppers, and meat did all that and more on it's own.

I've read through some of the lesser reviews which dock a star off here for Rhea's not originally being a deli, or for having "too big a sandwich" (which I have never heard of), and all I have to say is this:  Who cares?  When the food is this good, five stars is the bare minimum Rhea's deserves.  Bravo James!  Bravo!

excerpts: the korean steak...
duh.
i also like the 18th street (buffalo chicken)
steak.author: Ashley A.
steak.review:
they make a damn good sandwich. no joke. the korean steak... duh. i also like the 18th street (buffalo chicken) mmmmMMMMmmmm 

im pretty sure i'll get one for lunch today. :)

excerpts: The Korean steak is as good as they say.
I also love the Van Ness, which involves the tasty chicken katsu.
Even the fake chicken is damn good.
I highly recommend the Acme roll and getting your sandwich "spicy" whenever possible.
The people who work here are invariably friendly and cool.
The stools in the back provide a surprisingly nice place to sit, and it's actually a reasonably priced convenience store to boot.
You can save time by calling your order in ahead.
And don't wait til too late in the afternoon because they do sometimes run out of stuff.
steak.author: Marco L.
steak.review: I love this place. The Korean steak is as good as they say. I also love the Van Ness, which involves the tasty chicken katsu. Even the fake chicken is damn good. I highly recommend the Acme roll and getting your sandwich "spicy" whenever possible. The people who work here are invariably friendly and cool. The stools in the back provide a surprisingly nice place to sit, and it's actually a reasonably priced convenience store to boot. You can save time by calling your order in ahead. And don't wait til too late in the afternoon because they do sometimes run out of stuff.

excerpts: Get the Korean Steak sandwich!
There's a great deli at 19th & Guerrero that makes a mean tri-tip, but the Korean Steak sandwich at Rhea's is a better sammich.
There's a great deli at 19th & Guerrero that makes a mean tri-tip, but the Korean Steak sandwich at Rhea's is a better sammich.
steak.author: Sean B.
steak.review:
Get the Korean Steak sandwich! There's a great deli at 19th & Guerrero that makes a mean tri-tip, but the Korean Steak sandwich at Rhea's is a better sammich. Sweet and tangy bulgogi (from mom's recipe) with house-pickled onions, homemade aoili, and a lovely mess of sandwich staples makes for a truly awesome meal.

Other highlights are the great microbrew selection in 12 and 22 oz bottles (and even 21st Amendment brews in cans), a breadth of cheap and tasty wines, and fresh local cheeses without the line or pretense at Bi-Rite.

excerpts: I recommend the steak sandwich.
Grab a sandy, a Kombucha tea and some homemade Kim-chi
and you'll be in heaven.
steak.author: Walter K.

Between the Acme bread, cowgirl creamery cheeses and homemade Kim-chi they really hit it out of the ballpark. I recommend the steak sandwich. Grab a sandy, a Kombucha tea and some homemade Kim-chi and you'll be in heaven.

And the korean steak taco.

steak.author: Alex K.
steak.review:
I think I stumbled into this liquor store once while hammered because I needed some salt+vinegar chips action.  Little did I know the sandwich perfection that lay dormant inside.

Like the much-lamented Mission Burger, Rhea's transcends its humble surroundings with a decadent meat + cheese fugue.  In your mouth.  Yeah.

Got a Mission St (basically a reuben: pastrami, cheese, slaw, pickled jalapenos, mustard + garlic aioli held together by two fantastic slices of Tartine country loaf).  Was perfectly balanced, with each ingredient able to be distinguished without overwhelming the whole.  Salty, fatty, sweet, sour, spicy.  Just when you think the sandwich is lacking texture, you get a crunch of tartine crust, and all is right in the world.

It's also HUGE.  I ate the second half not because I was still hungry, but because I didn't want the mouth happiness to end.

Miles better than that famously precarious dirty sandwich shop that shall remain unnamed.

Will be back for the Korean steak sandwich.  And the pork katsu.  And the chicken katsu.  And the korean steak taco.  And the hot link.  And the Cunningham.  In the future, I'll call ahead and pick it up on my walk from the bus.

excerpts: The Korean Steak Sandwich at Rhea's Deli is on par with the best in the city, but ask for the mild version if you can't handle the heat cause its a spicey sando.

The korean steak, the pork katsu, the lexington st ham sandwich. You can't go wrong. I highly recommend getting a sandwich at Rheas. The staff is very friendly as they have always been and the prices are more then fair. excerpts: I wanted something without meat, so the Church sandwich with veggie-chicken stood out to me.
It also had swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli...
all served on an Acme roll.
church.author: Monica H.
church.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich from Rhea's Deli!

I wanted something without meat, so the Church sandwich with veggie-chicken stood out to me. It also had swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperoncini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli... all served on an Acme roll. DELICIOUS. 

For anyone who is vegan/vegetarian, Rhea's has plenty of options for you to choose from, like the Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, and the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken. I'd definitely like to check these guys out next time. 
 
If you're looking to grab a sweet sammie and enjoy the sunshine at Dolores Park, come to Rhea's. It's less busy than Bi-Rite, although Bi-Rite also sells some killer sandwiches.

excerpts: We shared the Vegetarian BBQ (vegetarian) Chicken and the Church.
The Vegetarian BBQ is one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten anywhere.
Stu-fucking-pendous.
They ask if one wants her sandwich mild, medium, or hot.
We ordered it "hot" and it had a lovely kick.
The Church is vegetarian chicken, Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperocini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli on an Acme roll.
It was great, but of the two, the Vegetarian BBQ dwarfs the Church.
In the ordinary world of sandwiches, the Church is incredible, balanced, and perfect, but compared to the Usain Bolt of vegetarian sandwiches (Veg BBQ), it could never come in first.
church.author: SalsaBoy S.
church.review:
Fuck.  These sandwiches are amazing.

We shared the Vegetarian BBQ (vegetarian) Chicken and the Church.  The Vegetarian BBQ is one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten anywhere.  Stu-fucking-pendous.  They ask if one wants her sandwich mild, medium, or hot.  We ordered it "hot" and it had a lovely kick.  It simply doesn't get better than the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken sandwich.  Blows the fuck out of Ike's, with better bread and better ingredients.

The Church is vegetarian chicken, Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperocini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli on an Acme roll.  It was great, but of the two, the Vegetarian BBQ dwarfs the Church.  In the ordinary world of sandwiches, the Church is incredible, balanced, and perfect, but compared to the Usain Bolt of vegetarian sandwiches (Veg BBQ), it could never come in first.

They also have a Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, but they were out when we went.  They used to have a Miss Piggy -- which is also vegetarian, in spite of the name -- but I didn't see it when I went in.

The hours are tough if one doesn't live close or work in the neighborhood.  Open until 5p during the week, 6p on weekends.  I'd definitely return and even go the fuck out of my way for it.  These sandwiches are in the league all of their own.  Phenomenal.

Highly, highly recommended.

excerpts: Church sandwich or veggie BBQ chicken are absolutely amazing.
One of the best sandwiches ever.
I am glad I wandered in here randomly looking for lunch.
church.author: Jonathan T.
church.review:
Church sandwich or veggie BBQ chicken are absolutely amazing.  One of the best sandwiches ever. I am glad I wandered in here randomly looking for lunch.  Google said it was the closest sandwich to my location, it was like 12 feet away from where I was.

I was not expecting that sandwich to be that good.  I am tempted to try the other fake meat sandwiches they have now.  If they stocked Newcastle 22oz I would be in heaven.  Although they do have Rouge Brown Hazelnut and hella other drinks to go with my sandwich time.

excerpts: Rhea's rocks out two amazing sandwiches: the BBQ veggie chicken with cabbage slaw and spicy sauce and the Church St, an monster concoction of veggie chicken bites, swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomato, pickles, honey mustard, ranch and garlic aioli.
Both sandwiches are messy but so worth the repeated hand washing and mouth wiping.
I've ordered both for delivery in the SOMA/Mission border and they always arrive super quick from friendly  cute bike messengers to boot.
Seriously, these sandwiches rule.
Kick your crappy cheese sandwich to the curb.
church.author: Cori W.
church.review: I am so happy that there are other faux meat veggie sandwiches in SF besides Ikes and Love n Haight. Rhea's rocks out two amazing sandwiches: the BBQ veggie chicken with cabbage slaw and spicy sauce and the Church St, an monster concoction of veggie chicken bites, swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomato, pickles, honey mustard, ranch and garlic aioli. Both sandwiches are messy but so worth the repeated hand washing and mouth wiping. I've ordered both for delivery in the SOMA/Mission border and they always arrive super quick from friendly  cute bike messengers to boot. Seriously, these sandwiches rule. They're not exactly a bargain but they're made with care and one sandwich is usually way more than enough for a lunch.

The best bet is to call in your order and pick it up since it the line can get long sometimes.

excerpts: I got the Barney Rubble.
It's a hot toasted bread with garlic aioli, pastrami, swiss cheese, pepperchinis, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions.
SOOOOO GOOOOD.
I am guilty of eating and driving
and I dripped so much juice and sauce on my clothes.
PEOPLE, PLEASE DON'T EAT & DRIVE.
barney rubble.author: Karen L.
barney rubble.review:
DAMN THIS WAS A GOOD SANDWICH! I saw this place on Check Please! a few weeks ago and I have been wanting to try this place. I happen to pass by and saw the big "Rhea's" sign so I promptly parked. :). I got the Barney Rubble. It's a hot toasted bread with garlic aioli, pastrami, swiss cheese, pepperchinis, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. SOOOOO GOOOOD. I am guilty of eating and driving and I dripped so much juice and sauce on my clothes. PEOPLE, PLEASE DON'T EAT & DRIVE. It's very dangerous when devouring a delicious sando. 

There were definitely many more sandwiches I wanted to try but I needed more man power. I will be prepare accordingly next week when I go again. 

Lastly, they have a lot of old school candy that I miss such as mambas, whatchamacallit, blow pops, and many more. This is a must try for sando lovers.

excerpts: , perhaps you feel mustard has no place on a turkey sandwich, or pepperoncini for that matter, but you like everything else on that "Hemingway.
hemingway.author: Invisible J.
hemingway.review:
I see some consistencies in the negative reviews, and they all seem to revolve around poor customer service.  I think the problem might be that the place is staffed by idiots, stoners, or idiot-stoners.  

It's a deli, I know there are a lot of choices, but come on, it's not that hard.  But, apparently, for Rhea's, it is.   Woe onto the person who dares stray from the established menu to get a variation on the "named" sandwiches.  Perhaps you're like me, perhaps you feel mustard has no place on a turkey sandwich, or pepperoncini for that matter, but you like everything else on that "Hemingway."  Good luck getting that level of "customization" to your order from the brain trust that works there.

Plus, with everyone complaining about the wait time, you would think calling your order in would be to your advantage.  Nope.  Try again.  

Jeez, folks.  I feel you, we're in Northern California, we're all so G-ddamn laid back, but can you put just a little bit of effort into customer service?  Can you take some frickin' pride in serving FOOD to people?  'Cause the level y'all are operating at, you should be like MAYBE stocking shelves at Target, but definitely NOT producing anything that I'm going to consume and digest.  

Either that, or pass the joint to everyone waiting to get served, don't just keep it for yourselves behind the counter.

excerpts: From the Korean Steak Sandwich (which is a MUST have) to the Wonder Woman, every sandwich is delicious and filled with a wonderful combination of flavor, spice, meats and cheese.
After having five different sandwiches, on my sixth visit I decided it was time to try the Korean Steak Sandwich.
After having five different sandwiches, on my sixth visit I decided it was time to try the Korean Steak Sandwich.
I nearly broke my jaw in excitement in taking the first bite (the sandwich height is approximately 6 inches) and was greeted with a steak filled explosion of flavor and spice - YUM!
wonder woman.author: Lauren B.
wonder woman.review:
Hands down, BEST sandwich in the city.  From the Korean Steak Sandwich (which is a MUST have) to the Wonder Woman, every sandwich is delicious and filled with a wonderful combination of flavor, spice, meats and cheese.

After having five different sandwiches, on my sixth visit I decided it was time to try the Korean Steak Sandwich.  I nearly broke my jaw in excitement in taking the first bite (the sandwich height is approximately 6 inches) and was greeted with a steak filled explosion of flavor and spice - YUM!

My roommate is a vegetarian and she absolutely loves the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken Sandwich - best fake meat around, she says!

Whatever you decide, and believe me it's a difficult choice...you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: Went with the Harrison St (Pastrami, cheese, peppers, chipotle aioli) and Korean Steak Sandwich (marinated steak, cheese, chili garlic sauce, pickled onions and grilled onions).
I originally wanted to eat half of both and leave the rest for later...
but no...
harrison st.author: Zoran L.
harrison st.review:
First things first... they serve Boars Head deli meats.  Always the best option if you get your meats from a grocery store and always the worst if you get them from an Italian deli or butcher.  Rhea's Market isn't italian nor a butcher... with that out of the way...

Now THAT'S how you serve Boars Head Deli Meats!!

I walked in and order right away...turns out there's usually a wait.  So I got lucky with my timing, however I struggled with trying to decide what to order... there are some really good sandwiches on the menu.  I decided to get two completely different flavors. Went with the Harrison St (Pastrami, cheese, peppers, chipotle aioli) and Korean Steak Sandwich (marinated steak, cheese, chili garlic sauce, pickled onions and grilled onions).  I originally wanted to eat half of both and leave the rest for later...but no...didn't happen...devoured both in one sitting.

Now have to be back for dinner...and lunch again tomorrow.  I'll be thinking about what to get all night... this menu requires planning.

And to the folks here from Chicago...they have REAL giardiniera...IN OIL.  Not the healthy west coast crap (in water) we have to put up with.  I'm so happy...

Fantastic sandwiches and everyone there is really friendly.  Can't wait to be back.
