excerpts: Can't wait to try the Katsu sandwich next time.
katsu sandwich.author: Charlie R.
katsu sandwich.review: The Korean Steak sandwich a genuine banger. Highly recommended, and get it spicy. The steak tastes like actual steak, instead of the sheets of general meat you get at some places. Go here, get this sandwich, make it spicy, eat it in Dolores Park. Guaranteed great day. Can't wait to try the Katsu sandwich next time.

excerpts: Get the katsu sandwich.
katsu sandwich.author: Misha T.
katsu sandwich.review:
San Francisco has the best sandwiches in the country. It's one of life's few fundamental truths. No disrespect to the always incredible Katz's Deli, NOLA's muffalettas and po' boys, Dinic's roast pork. You're all great. But SF pumps out sandwich after sandwich after sandwich. I can name 15 different incredible sandos in this city and I'm glad to add Rhea's to my list.

Get the katsu sandwich.

excerpts: Only word came to mind as we took our very first bite into the yelp reviewers highly praised Katsu Sandwich...
If you're headed there maybe skip the katsu sandwich...
You can't go wrong if they're just slicing meat n vegetables n slapping it on some bread I guess.
katsu sandwich.author: Colin M.
katsu sandwich.review:
Only word came to mind as we took our very first bite into the yelp reviewers highly praised Katsu Sandwich... RECYCLE.

Recycle? You ask. Yes. Recycle. The katsu (pork cutlet) was so dry it was the doppelganger of cardboard. The bread was the cousin of cardboard. It would've been put to better use recycled into something usable like paper. The slaw was ok but  overwhelmingly spicy even for someone who loves a good kick in their food.

With a 4 plus star rating you'd think they could've done just a tad bit better to live half way up to it's rating. That katsu was not served fresh and probably premade in the morning. My GF took a bite n threw it away while I managed to take 2 bites.

Although this review does not reflect any of their other sandwiches which I've never tried yet... The fact remains that if someone can serve up something like that to their patrons, it shows how much they really care about their craft. I personally would never serve up something I wouldn't approve of. I hope they didn't serve me that sandwich thinking it was Ok. 

How I felt: cheated of 10 bucks so they can get rid of old food.

If you're headed there maybe skip the katsu sandwich... You can't go wrong if they're just slicing meat n vegetables n slapping it on some bread I guess. Shouldn't be too difficult to serve up a 3 star sandwich.

If you happen to get the katsu n find it to fail your taste buds... Don't throw it into the trash. Help make it a greener world and throw that cardboard into the blue bin... Recycle. 

Good luck!

I'm new to yelp kind of but you can see many more of my posts of amazing grub on IG colin_r2d by adding me. So far I've only posted on yelp if I had a really awful experience. I can use some help learning how to post pics along w my reviews so I can put up more reviews. I'm lost.

excerpts: Although the katsu sandwich was my second choice, I was more than happy with it.
I had to take it to go but the bread still held up to the katsu and toppings for the most part.
It was rather large
so I could only finish half.
katsu sandwich.author: Charlene E.
katsu sandwich.review:
My first job involved working in the food industry, so I know how annoying it can be to take that last order right when you're about to close up shop. I admit that I was THAT customer the first time I went to Rhea's Deli. I rushed over and made it just in time. I have to give them props because they were still gracious and accommodating to the last customers that trickled in before closing time. 

I ordered the chicken katsu on a French roll only because they sold out of their Korean steak sandwich and acme rolls for the day. Understandable considering I came at the last minute. Although the katsu sandwich was my second choice, I was more than happy with it. I had to take it to go but the bread still held up to the katsu and toppings for the most part. It was rather large so I could only finish half. Take note that if you order your sandwich mild, it doesn't come with jalapeños. 

Rhea's Deli has so many sandwiches to choose from. Grab a order sheet and customize your sandwich to your liking. If I lived closer and parking wasn't such a hassle, I'd be a regular. I'd definitely return nonetheless!

excerpts: In particular, their Korean Steak Sandwich and Pork Katsu Sandwich.
If I had to pick my favorite between the two, I probably would pick the Korean Steak simply because it had a nice blend of sweet and spicy flavor.
If I had to pick my favorite between the two, I probably would pick the Korean Steak simply because it had a nice blend of sweet and spicy flavor.
That's not to say that the Pork Katsu Sandwich was bad, that sandwich itself was delicious simply because I have a thing for fried stuff.
Though it may be hard for me to ignore the Korean Steak.
Though it may be hard for me to ignore the Korean Steak.
katsu sandwich.author: Rodney H.
katsu sandwich.review:
A little to the party, but I was finally able to stop by Rhea's Deli & Market to try their tasty sandwiches that everyone's been raving about.  In particular, their Korean Steak Sandwich and Pork Katsu Sandwich.  Really good stuff!!!

Just take a look at these (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=F_5_UNX-wrAFCXuAkBZRDw&select=IweGUk8obqiACeWXoMJT3w)  It's edible art!!  If I had to pick my favorite between the two, I probably would pick the Korean Steak simply because it had a nice blend of sweet and spicy flavor.  That's not to say that the Pork Katsu Sandwich was bad, that sandwich itself was delicious simply because I have a thing for fried stuff.

They have a huge menu of sandwiches as well and I would say that they're giving Ike's Place a run for their money.  So far from what I've had, I'm willing to go back and try the rest of them.  Though it may be hard for me to ignore the Korean Steak.

Definitely give these guys a try if you're in the Mission!

excerpts: PORK KATSU SANDWICH ($8.19):
My favorite one!!
Paul got this one and I managed to take a bite out of it.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=5B9LBUEngWTYtuPAoHR9fg

CHICKEN KATSU SANDWICH ($8.19)
so she got the chicken version of the katsu sandwich.
Aside from the chicken, everything else is the same as the above mentioned breaded pork sandwich.

The juicy chicken patty is a little thicker than the pork.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=jPsUtO_b0j9Rq6CrCxTZTg
katsu sandwich.author: Cin T.
katsu sandwich.review:
I've had this deli bookmarked for a while, so it was definitely on my list to check out while in SF. And it's located only a few blocks from where I'm staying in the Mission District, how perfect is that?!

It took a while for the sandwiches to arrive, surprising it was still crunchy and delicious, right down to the last bite. Loved the crunchy organic roll. 

KOREAN STEAK SANDWICH ($8.99): 
  This is the "famous" sandwich that everyone talks about. It was tasty but nothing crazy and out of this world.
 I ordered this without the cheddar cheese. I prefer my bulgogi (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulgogi) without the funky taste of cheddar or any cheeses for that matter. The tender soy-marinated rib-eye had just the right amount of meat to lettuce ratio. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=PRtK3t-9xVLzIEhCf8DHyw

The chopped lettuce, grilled AND pickled red onions, jalapenos gave the sammie a nice texture when paired with the soft beef. 

The tangy garlic aioli had flecks of red chilies in it. It wasn't spicy enough for me, but it had a nice kick. Bulgogi in a bun, can't go wrong!

PORK KATSU SANDWICH ($8.19): My favorite one!!
 Paul got this one and I managed to take a bite out of it. I like this one better than my steak sandwich since I have a hankering for fried meats. I only got the Korean Steak bc everyone raved about it. 

The thinly pounded pork loin is covered in panko bread crumbs and fried to a golden crisp. Despite the thinness, the pork still retained it's moisture.

The katsu was topped with Rhea's homemade coleslaw (lacking mayo, which I liked), pickled red onions, jalapenos and a spicy aioli. There was also a light drizzle of their tangy katsu sauce. The katsu sauce reminds me of a sweeter version of Arby's bbq sauce.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=5B9LBUEngWTYtuPAoHR9fg

CHICKEN KATSU SANDWICH ($8.19)
 My friend Niki doesn't eat pork so she got the chicken version of the katsu sandwich. Aside from the chicken, everything else is the same as the above mentioned breaded pork sandwich. The juicy chicken patty is a little thicker than the pork.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humRe1SGupNdDJUxEdDmMg?select=jPsUtO_b0j9Rq6CrCxTZTg

excerpts: I was excited when I read they had a Chicken Katsu Sandwich here since I LOVE CHICKEN KATSU.
It was busy
so I was told there's a 15 minute wait for my order.
Finally picked it up and was disappointed.
The chicken katsu didn't have that juicy, crispy taste that I'm used to.
Sure there's dressing, veggies, and stuff
but I could barely taste the soggy chicken katsu whether it was spicy or mild.
I'll be sure to try out there other sandwiches though when I'm back in the city and update my review.
katsu sandwich.author: Gerard Y.
katsu sandwich.review: I was excited when I read they had a Chicken Katsu Sandwich here since I LOVE CHICKEN KATSU. It was busy so I was told there's a 15 minute wait for my order. Finally picked it up and was disappointed. The chicken katsu didn't have that juicy, crispy taste that I'm used to. Sure there's dressing, veggies, and stuff but I could barely taste the soggy chicken katsu whether it was spicy or mild. I'll be sure to try out there other sandwiches though when I'm back in the city and update my review.

excerpts: 2) Choose from their signature sandwiches like the Korean Steak and Chicken Katsu Sandwich or make your own by choosing your own bread, meat, cheese, and condiments.
I will be throwing my carb inhibitions out the door and get the Chicken Katsu Sandwich too.
katsu sandwich.author: Cherylynn N.
katsu sandwich.review:
What's the BEST word to describe the KOREAN STEAK STANDWICH at Rhea's?

* * * * * * *P H U C K I N'  B O M B D I G G I T Y* * * * * * *

Ok, so maybe that's more than one word, but there's no doubt that the Korean Steak Sandwich at Rhea's is hands-down the BEST sandwich I've ever had in my 29 years!

Let me preface by saying that I haven't had many good experiences with Asian Fusion food especially street food because the authentic bold flavors are always lacking. So I had my doubts about going to Rhea's for their Korean Steak Sandwich, especially in such an unassuming place as in the Mission. But, boy was I WRONG. Don't be fooled because the Korean Steak Sandwich will be the best ORGASMIC sandwiches experiences you will ever have! Way better than Ike's...

On Thursday, December 30th, I came to Rhea's at 12ish after having just finished with a Dr.'s appointment nearby. 

Upon walking in, I was a bit confused on the ordering process especially when the directions on how to order was blocked by another person. So, I stood there for a good several minutes until the person left and I finally noticed the directions.

1) Get a sandwich order form at the sandwich counter.

2) Choose from their signature sandwiches like the Korean Steak and Chicken Katsu Sandwich or make your own by choosing your own bread, meat, cheese, and condiments. 

3) Give your order form to the cashier and pay for your sandwich (CC's accepted) before your order is processed.

Free delivery is offered in the Mission area ($10 minimum) with a $3 surcharge past 9th street and Market towards Duboce streets.

There's a small counter for four in the market and a small bench outside to munch your sandwich. 

Being the recipient of the 2010 SF Bay Guardian Best of the Bay Award, there was no question that I was ordering the much hyped Korean Steak Sandwich - Medium Spicy ($8.45). It's NO wonder that it won an award because the sandwich was K I L L E R!

Grilled and marinated bulgogi piled over 2 inches high, layered with crisp spicy kimchi, sweet red onions, spicy jalapenos, chili garlic sauce, garlic aioli, and cheddar cheese sandwiched between a toasted Acme roll. The first bite was like an orchestrated symphony of flavors and textures in my mouth. The crisp and chewy bread led to the savory, tender and sweet bulgogi with a hint of gingery and garlicy goodness. The kimchi and chili garlic sauce added a fiery kick that was cooled down by both the creamy and rich aioli and thick slices of sharp cheddar. 

There was no shortage of bold spices and flavors and THIS is how Asian Fusion food should taste like. No words can really explain how mouth-watering the Korean Steak Sandwich was and it's just something that you will have to "experience" for yourself.

Do note that the sandwich tends to get soggy from the juiciness of the bulgogi, so make sure to eat it ASAP! 

Since I used the holiday season as an excuse to derail off my diet, I don't know when I'll be able to return to Rhea's. But I know when I do,  I will be throwing my carb inhibitions out the door and get the Chicken Katsu Sandwich too. :X

P.S. - Rhea's sells the hard to find and highly addictive Cadbury Flake and Aero. 

Killer sandwiches and delectable Cadbury chocolates? Talk about all sorts of Carb Diet FAIL! *sigh*

excerpts: I had tried the chicken katsu sandwich which is slathered with their slaw and a garlic aioli sauce on an Acme roll.
The sandwich was quite good but small for being nearly $9.50.
I want to try the other sandwiches and see if quality surpasses quantity.
But I was still hungry after the sandwich.
katsu sandwich.author: Danster L.
katsu sandwich.review:
Finally I got to try Rhea's Deli after several attempts. The last 2 times I tried to go to Rhea's is because I could not find parking and did not know the deli was closed after 7pm. (I went once at 9pm and the market was open but not the deli.) Finally, I got to try it last week and it was quite good.

I had tried the chicken katsu sandwich which is slathered with their slaw and a garlic aioli sauce on an Acme roll. The sandwich was quite good but small for being nearly $9.50. I want to try the other sandwiches and see if quality surpasses quantity. But I was still hungry after the sandwich. Next time, the Korean steak sandwich will be my next go getter. I highly advise not going during lunch hour and good luck finding parking, it's tough! The market also sells my favorite Simply Lemonade with raspberry drink. Perfect combination!

excerpts: The Katsu sandwich was much less impressive, and I won't order it again.
It could have been shoe leather in there, and I wouldn't really have noticed.
katsu sandwich.author: Chris C.
katsu sandwich.review:
Saw this place on "Check Please."   It almost lived up to the hype.  The Korean steak sandwich was very tasty.  I got it "medium," which was PLENTY spicy. ( I have no idea why anyone would bother with the "spicy" option because I doubt you could taste the food with your mouth on fire.)

  The Katsu sandwich was much less impressive, and I won't order it again.  It could have been shoe leather in there, and I wouldn't really have noticed.  Not that it would have been bad though.

    The gimmick or the "hook" with these sandwiches is the excellent bread (Acme), (which is half the battle when it comes to sandwiches), and then the variety of ingredients/condiments added.  So every bite is a bit different and never boring.  When they add chili sauce, garlic aioli, jalapenos, pickled red onions, and a variety of veggies, it would be hard NOT to make something interesting.  So even though the "spicy goo" covers up some of the flavors, I'd be a regular if I lived in the area.

      I also got the regular kimchi, and it was one of the better ones I've tasted.  Nothing to rave about, just solid.

    As far as the place, it's a divey, liquor store.  Oh, and parking is friggin' ridiculous, as I circled for about 10 minutes to find a place about 4 blocks away.  Now I know why people park illegally...to save their sanity.

excerpts: I wanted the katsu sandwich, but they were out of it
katsu sandwich.author: Alice W.
katsu sandwich.review:
Hm...I was rather disappointed by the place. It's been sitting in my queue forever and I finally got a chance to try it out. The place is an ordinary looking convenience store, but with a deli counter. I wanted the katsu sandwich, but they were out of it so I went with their most popular item, the korean steak sandwich. I wanted it spicy and with kimchi. 

Lo the behold, $11.84 later (and that's just for the sandwich, no chips or drinks), I got my sandwich. The kimchi came in a small condiment sized container instead of on the actual sandwich. The verdict? Well, there was plenty of meat, a bit of shredded iceberg, some cheddar and indistinguishable sauce (suppose to be chili garlic sauce and garlic aioli). There were also some pickled stuff in there, but it was hard to make it out.

My overall impression was that it was good, but not $11.84 good. I mean, if someone threw it in my direction, I wouldn't run the other way, but what they charge, especially considering it's the Mission, is pretty ridiculous. I don't mind paying $20 for a fois gras sandwich from Naked Lunch, but I just don't see the value of this place. Maybe they used great meat for the sandwich, but it certainly doesn't show. The meat was heavily marinated so I just tasted the sweetness of the meat and nothing else.

excerpts: We came for the Katsu Sandwich, but it has REGRETTABLY been discontinued.
ARGH.
katsu sandwich.author: Bryan H.
katsu sandwich.review:
Ambiance:  More than anything else, this is your typical California liquor store/deli market -- except for a few features.  One, there is an actual bar along the perimeter for sitting and eating.  I found this to be a very nice feature for those who were hoping to eat their sandwich right away while it was still hot.  Second, the place was pretty dang clean...  which, you know, is always nice.  No bathroom on site though; they have some sort of agreement with an establishment across the street, because they told us to go use their bathroom.  Ask them!

Service:  VERY nice people here.  Note:  If you're hoping for a quick in and out order and pickup, think again.  We came here on a Saturday and the wait for sandwiches was 45 minutes.  Being that the sandwich was the sole and singular purpose of our visit, we waited.  It was worth it.

Food:  We came for the Katsu Sandwich, but it has REGRETTABLY been discontinued. ARGH.  Oh well, we got the Korean Steak Sandwich. OMGAH.  It was to die for!  With kimchi and a good deal of flavor, the sandwich hit the spot.  We paired it with some cheap champagne (the lady working at the cash register told us which one was the best flavor for the cheapest price) and we waltzed on over to Dolores Park, eating and basking in the sun.  Twas bliss.

I marked down one star for the wait, because they changed their menu to get rid of the Katsu, and because of the lack of bathroom on site (none of which can be helped, but yea).  All in all, the service was good and the location was clean and pleasant. I'll be coming here for my badass-sandwich-fix again VERY soon.

4 out of 5!

excerpts: I also got the pork katsu sandwich and it was also very good.
But the KBBQ is definitely way better.
Sooooo good!
I want more!
katsu sandwich.author: Cynthia C.
katsu sandwich.review:
I'm in LOVE!!! This has got to be my favorite sandwich of all time. I love the Korean BBQ sandwich!! the pickled coleslaw and onions. The beef is super tender and juicy. Just thinking about it is making me want to order it for dinner. The bread is super yummy too.

I also got the pork katsu sandwich and it was also very good. But the KBBQ is definitely way better. Sooooo good! I want more!

excerpts: They jacked up the prices and no longer offer the katsu sandwich?!
In this case the double negatives do NOT cancel each other out.
katsu sandwich.author: Justin C.
katsu sandwich.review: They jacked up the prices and no longer offer the katsu sandwich?! In this case the double negatives do NOT cancel each other out.

excerpts: This review is based solely on the Chicken Katsu sandwich!
#BestOfTheBay .
Everything about this sandwich is perfect to me...great quality bread and toppings make this perfect piece of chicken katsu spectacular!!!
katsu sandwich.author: Mista N.
katsu sandwich.review: This review is based solely on the Chicken Katsu sandwich!  #BestOfTheBay . Everything about this sandwich is perfect to me...great quality bread and toppings make this perfect piece of chicken katsu spectacular!!!

excerpts: I made a special trip to rhea's to try the pork katsu sandwich.
It was a half hour out of my way, but my brother said it was incredible - additionally, after seeing all the pics on yelp, I was sold.
Turns out they stopped making the katsu sandwich - the reason?
It was too popular!
WHAT?!?
katsu sandwich.author: Tony B.
katsu sandwich.review:
I'm being a bit generous with a 4 star rating here.  I made a special trip to rhea's to try the pork katsu sandwich. It was a half hour out of my way, but my brother said it was incredible - additionally, after seeing all the pics on yelp, I was sold.  Turns out they stopped making the katsu sandwich - the reason? It was too popular! WHAT?!?  Who stops producing their signature product for excess popularity? 

Anyways, I ended up having their other popular offering, which is the Korean steak sandwich.  Phenomenal - deserving of 5 stars.  I will go back for it many times I am quite sure.

They really need to get back on that Katsu - I still want to try it.

excerpts: However, my dining partner's katsu sandwich was disappointing.
The katsu was so dry.
It also looked like it was deep fried and set to sit under the heat lamp for days!
katsu sandwich.author: LeTran B.
katsu sandwich.review: My Korean steak sandwich was good but the sauce was a bit too sweet for my taste.  However, my dining partner's katsu sandwich was disappointing. The katsu was so dry. It also looked like it was deep fried and set to sit under the heat lamp for days!

excerpts: I work directly across the street from Rhea's, which has turned out to be a nightmare as all I ever want to eat is the tasty chicken katsu sandwich.
katsu sandwich.author: Tim J.
katsu sandwich.review:
Oh, the sammiches. I work directly across the street from Rhea's, which has turned out to be a nightmare as all I ever want to eat is the tasty chicken katsu sandwich.

I would definitely recommend coming here for lunch. Take your sandwiches and a drink over a couple blocks to Dolores park and enjoy the pretty sights of San Francisco (if it's not raining, of course).

excerpts: I tried both the korean steak sandwich and the katsu sandwich, and to my surprise preferred the katsu.
Both had a nice spicy kick to them without having other flavors overwhelmed.
I thought the katsu came together better with a great crunch from the pork and the slaw.
It was also better constructed and held together well.
I don't like red onions
so we got them on the side of the steak sandwich, and I have to admit it was better with onions (which were pickled, so I do prefer those to raw red onions).
katsu sandwich.author: Lisa K.
katsu sandwich.review:
Excellent sandwiches! I tried both the korean steak sandwich and the katsu sandwich, and to my surprise preferred the katsu. Both had a nice spicy kick to them without having other flavors overwhelmed. I thought the katsu came together better with a great crunch from the pork and the slaw. It was also better constructed and held together well. I don't like red onions so we got them on the side of the steak sandwich, and I have to admit it was better with onions (which were pickled, so I do prefer those to raw red onions). I'd also requested it without the cheese, because that just seemed like too much, but I have to say that I do now have a lot of faith in their sandwich ideals, so in the future I'd probably go with every topping they recommend.

Next time I would ask for them to go a bit lighter on the aioli - it's good, but a little goes a long way. I'd look forward to having the katsu again or trying their other sandwiches!

excerpts: Next on my list is the Katsu sandwich.
katsu sandwich.author: Jenny G.
katsu sandwich.review:
Went today and ordered two korean steak sandwiches. Luckily we called in the order since 30 mins was the quoted wait. We got there in 20 mins and our sandwiches were ready. FYI when you order sandwiches by phone, you go to the cashier to check for your order.

The korean sandwich is so yummy and on par to Ike's. Personally I prefer Rhea since it's not as saucy as Ike's (aka messy to eat). The korean steak has a spicy sauce and jalapeños for an extra kick. Ask for mild if you can't handle spicy food like me. The beef is perfectly marinated, not dry, and the sauce pulls it all together. Def recommend you try. Next on my list is the Katsu sandwich.

excerpts: Went here because we saw a show with the Pork Katsu sandwich show.
Found out it was a very old rerun, so went with the Korean Beef sandwich.
Ordered one mild and it still slapped my taste buds in the mouth with spice
katsu sandwich.author: Troy R.
katsu sandwich.review:
Wow...I never thought I'd Yelp again after the busiest month of my entire career. But I made it back and I'm happy to put in a sparkling review for Rhea's Deli, as the first of many catch up reviews for Yelp!

Went here because we saw a show with the Pork Katsu sandwich show. Found out it was a very old rerun, so went with the Korean Beef sandwich. Ordered one mild and it still slapped my taste buds in the mouth with spice but there was so much flavor than the little hot kick.

The small staff was crazy cool and laid back but it is in the Mission, so kinda expected. 


Can't say that after tasting it, I'm in "gotta have it" mode. More like if I'm in the area and want a good sandwich, Rhea's is the place to go.

excerpts: The only issue is they no longer do the Katsu sandwich :(
katsu sandwich.author: Rohan D.
katsu sandwich.review:
The korean steak sandwich is a great combination of delicious korean steak and cabbage, and the spicy is just spicy enough to give you a kick without being too painful to the palate. 

The only issue is they no longer do the Katsu sandwich :(

excerpts: Both were equally amazing, but if I HAD to choose, I would prefer the Katsu Sandwich (only because I'm a sucker for spicy mayo).
katsu sandwich.author: Faye G.
katsu sandwich.review:
I've said it before and I'll say it again...I LOVE SANDWICHES! And wow, Rhea's Deli makes some damn good ones!

My boyfriend & I ended up ordering the Korean BBQ Beef & Katsu Sandwiches (Medium Spicy for both) to go so we could eat it at SFO before our flight back home. I was a bit skeptical if the sandwiches would still be good a couple hours later but yup, Rhea's proved me wrong and was still mighty delish! I absolutely loved the sauces on both sandwiches (hello garlic aioli & tonkatsu sauce!) and the ACME Bread was chewy, crunchy & held everything together nicely. Both were equally amazing, but if I HAD to choose, I would prefer the Katsu Sandwich (only because I'm a sucker for spicy mayo). 

The guys working the deli were awesome! Super friendly and easy to talk to. Oh yeah, it also didn't hurt that we didn't encounter a line during our visit ;) While Rhea's may be a bit more $$ than Ike's, I would still highly recommend it. Seriously...Japanese & Korean inspired sandwiches? They nailed it!

FYI, Rhea's Deli is located in a legit liquor store/market. I kind of liked how you could just order some sandwiches & pick up a couple of drinks/chips and pay for it all together. Just make sure to fill out the little paper next to the cashier to place your order ;)

excerpts: My personal favorite is the Pork Katsu Sandwich.
The lightly fried and breaded pork is nicely complemented with crunchy coleslaw and a spicy, tangy dressing.
katsu sandwich.author: Madhu P.
katsu sandwich.review:
Rhea's Deli (pronounced like Ray's Deli) is a pretty unassuming corner market but don't be fooled, those hipsters behind the deli counter know how to make a serious sando that would give Ike Shehadeh a run for this money.

My personal favorite is the Pork Katsu Sandwich. The lightly fried and breaded pork is nicely complemented with crunchy coleslaw and a spicy, tangy dressing. As noted by a ton of other Yelpers, the Korean Steak Sandwich is also worth the trip, but can be a little bit of a mess at the end. My girlfriend really likes their vegetarian sandwiches, but they've also got a fake bbq sandwich that looks pretty legit.

On weekdays the wait tends to be around 10-15min, but if you're headed there on the weekend I would recommend calling in your order.

excerpts: The Chicken Katsu Sandwich is the way to go.
Everyone thinks the Bulgogi Sandwich is the best
katsu sandwich.author: Jason T.
katsu sandwich.review:
The Chicken Katsu Sandwich is the way to go. Everyone thinks the Bulgogi Sandwich is the best but I don't think so. 

Tip: Call it in. The wait is really long at peak lunch time hours on the weekend.

excerpts: Its a toss-up for me ... between the Korean Steak Sandwich or Katsu Sandwich (pork, chicken).
katsu sandwich.author: J B.
katsu sandwich.review:
With so many great sandwich places, why would you go here?  That's what I thought the first five times my wife asked me to check it out.

But after the first time, I'm liking it a lot.  The sandwiches are tasty and creative.  Kinda like Ike's but with a Kung Fu Panda flair.

Its a toss-up for me ... between the Korean Steak Sandwich or Katsu Sandwich (pork, chicken).  Both thoroughly satisfying.

The guys at counter are relaxed and friendly.  Great value for food.  No ambiance, but half way through a sandwich ... you are already in a mild food coma. :)

excerpts: If you answered yes to all of the above, then you will love Rhea Deli's CHICKEN KATSU SANDWICH!
YES, YOUR EYES ARE NOT PLAYING TRICKS ON YOU; I said chicken katsu sandwich!
katsu sandwich.author: Leslie T.
katsu sandwich.review:
Are you a fan of chicken katsu? 

Are you a fan of sandwiches? 

Are you a fan of awesomeness? 

If you answered yes to all of the above, then you will love Rhea Deli's CHICKEN KATSU SANDWICH! YES, YOUR EYES ARE NOT PLAYING TRICKS ON YOU; I said chicken katsu sandwich! 

If that isn't enough to convince you, just check out the pictures because they pretty much scream delicious. And this sandwich did not disappoint. The chicken katsu was crispy, the slaw and sauce were killer, and the Acme roll was fresh and crunchy! 

My friend had the bulgogi with cheese sandwich, and she adores Vietnamese sandwiches; this particular interpretation ended up being a bit too wet (the meat was too juicy?). 

Take your sandwiches to Dolores Park, take in the sun, and play with the millions of doggies trying to eat your food!

excerpts: I can't wait to come back and try the katsu sandwich.
I see a hawaiian sandwich explosion in my near future.
katsu sandwich.author: Alvin P.
katsu sandwich.review:
Another dynamite sandwich spot located inside a market/store. I was gonna just do the regular routine and hit up Roxie's as I do every week. My homie suggested it to me to try, so thought we'd give it a go. 

I got the Korean steak sandwich cuz that's what's hot in the streets. Not only hot in the streets, but it got me hot in the pants. HOT damn my loins yearn for this sandwich. It brought me on a trip. Had the asian-esqe flavor I've only experienced at King Foot Subs, combined with awesome Dutch Crunch bread. Those two addends equate to a flavor smash I have yet to experience from any other sandwich. I pretty much destroyed that sandwich. 

The gf got the Judah. Anytime you throw pesto and chicken together, you're gonna get some heat. The combination of the two was in the words of my homie Tony the Tiger, "GRRRREEEEEATTT." 

I can't wait to come back and try the katsu sandwich. I see a hawaiian sandwich explosion in my near future. =)

excerpts:
Chicken Katsu Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
Polk Katsu Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
katsu sandwich.author: Nobu K.
katsu sandwich.review:
The reason why I came here because this line:
"Rhea's Deli is truly a hidden gem. Hidden inside of a liquor store," by Rita C. She got ROTD 2 days ago.

"Hidden gem inside of a liquor store in Mission? Shit, Man, i gotto go there!"
Something like that.
I thought that Valencia Street and Mission street are same thing like Clement and Irving. It was, before. But, it's not the same anymore.
QUE PASO?

So, about the Rhea's.
The place is FXXXin'GOOD!!!
1. Korean Steak Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
2. Chicken Katsu Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
3. Polk Katsu Sandwich is FXXXin'GOOD.
4. Kim Chee is FXXXin'GOOD.

The Kim Chee is something special. 
But when I heard the price, I thought " What a rip-off 6 bucks for a 16oz? " But I had to try it because who's gonna buy Kim Chee in the Mission district? It didn't make a sense to me that selling Kim Chee in Mission. 
So i had to get it.
A guy in the store said, " You'll get 2 dollars back when you get the bottle back."
I was like, "Uh-Huh."
The Kim Chee is vacuumed pack.

This is a warning for a person who is thinking getting the Kim Chee from Rhea's.
Watch out when you are opening the top of the bottle.
Make sure you are at right front of a kitchen sink because the Kim Chee will explode!!!
It is compressed, pressed, squeesed into a 16oz bottle, so, you will see the Kim Chee explode like the Kim Chee rising twice high of the bottle.
At the moment of the Kim Chee rising, it reminded me of the movie "Alien" when the baby Alien came threw out of the guy's lower belly.
FXXXin'GOD, that scared me to hell.
Not Alien.
The Kim Chee!
I thought the Kim Chee is alive.

But the "live" Kim Chee was excellent.
I loved the deep sensible hot chili flavor with such a fresh crunchy Nappa-cabbage. It's not the same like that King's label you see at Safeway.
Btw, I have met an old Korean man before telling me that good Kim Chee don't smell bad as you think. He was right. The Rhea's Kim Chee doesn't smell that badly.

Talkin' about Kim Chee is endless.

I didn't see any Korean guys but so what?
Guys here are really nice.
The Best Deli in the city!!!

I'll be back here very soon to return the bottle to get another one.

excerpts:
His suggestions:
The Chicken Katsu Sandwich (I got it mild-
he thought I was a wuss but was too polite to say so...
I'm glad I got it mild.
I am a wuss.
katsu sandwich.author: Heather J.
katsu sandwich.review:
I have a screaming three month old and my partner came home from work exhausted. We've both been craving sandwiches for some time now so I turned to my trusted Yelp to see what awesome place had enough forethought and wherewithal to offer delicious sandwich delivery.

Can I just say I freaking LOVE you guys?
Thanks for the recommendation. This place rocked my world.

I called the place and some sweet, awesome guy picked up on the first ring (good start). I'm sure I sounded like a jackass- I knew I wanted the chicken katsu somethingorother and something vegetarian but wasn't decisive (having been in the service industry before I know how annoying that can be). He offered up great suggestions and was incredibly patient, kind, and even kept up the witty banter (which I definitely appreciate) with me while I made my decisions.

His suggestions:
The Chicken Katsu Sandwich (I got it mild- he thought I was a wuss but was too polite to say so... I'm glad I got it mild. I am a wuss. And it was still a tad spicy but incredibly delicious.)

The Vegetarian Sandwich w/ avocado, lettuce, tomato, pickle, havarti & swiss cheese, and garlic mayo.

Both sandwiches were on point. My partner couldn't stop bragging about the vegetarian sandwich and the chicken katsu hit the spot.

They also deliver beer & cigarettes. Not that I'm interested in that option with a three month old but I do believe that's a major score... and I got a six pack of Heineken for my partner and the beers arrived COLD (especially amazing for how far away we live).

IF YOU DO ORDER DELIVERY- keep in mind that these guys deliver everything on their bicycles. I didn't know that and felt like a complete tool when the guy was sweating and out of breath at my doorstep. Despite having to travel to hell and back for me the delivery guy was as sweet as a freaking peach, super cordial and happy to ride to the middle of nowhere to satisfy my sandwich fix. So if you are a lazy bitty like me, and just HAVE to have delivery, please take that into account and tip well. 

All in all, awesomely successful.
I'm super glad I called the guy who took my order my "Sandwich Fairy Godmother."

That's not a phrase I throw around wildly- and he definitely deserved the accolade.

excerpts: Just had the katsu sandwich here for lunch and it was absolutely rock solid.
Crispy-on-the-outside pork cutlet on a fantastic Acme roll.
There was BBQ sauce, hot sauce, tangy coleslaw
and it all came together like Voltron to form one badass sandwich.
katsu sandwich.author: Aaron V.
katsu sandwich.review:
Just had the katsu sandwich here for lunch and it was absolutely rock solid. Crispy-on-the-outside pork cutlet on a fantastic Acme roll. There was BBQ sauce, hot sauce, tangy coleslaw and it all came together like Voltron to form one badass sandwich. Rhea's Deli is a must try.

Pro tip: they deliver for free by bicycle throughout the Mission

excerpts: I also had a taste of the katsu sandwich - no bueno.
The katsu was very thin and kinda hard.
katsu sandwich.author: Cynthia H.
katsu sandwich.review:
The Korean steak sandwich is oh so delicious!  I orginally came here with the intention of ordering some tacos, but I just couldn't pass on the sandwich.  Saving the tacos for a future visit.

I had to painfully wait 15 mins before devouring my food - my coworkers and I had to take the food back to the office.  Everything about the sandwich was good - perfect bread, lots of meat, and cheese!  I also had a taste of the katsu sandwich - no bueno.  The katsu was very thin and kinda hard.  I wouldn't order this.

You can also buy kim chee here.  I paid about $6 for a small can.  It had too much ginger for my taste, so I wouldn't buy it again.

I'll return for the steak sandwich and to try the tacos.

excerpts: We ordered a Chicken Katsu sandwich too -- husband says equally delish!
katsu sandwich.author: Sabrina G.
katsu sandwich.review:
Heard about this place from my friend's food blog, www.urbanstomach.com.  Ordered the Korean steak sandwich thinking, how hot could this be . . . I eat kimchee all the time.  Ah hem, it was a fire cracker in my mouth when you include the jalapenos and sriracha!  

It's true -- this place looks like a typical liquor store from the outside.  So its strange to see their collection of Cowgirl Creamery cheese collection and imported chocolate bars.  I was the only one in line and it took a good 15 minutes for my sandwiches to get made -- worth every bite!

I want to thank the deli guys for being accommodating.  I stopped them mid-way because my son is allergic to eggs and dairy so he can't have the cheese and aioli -- no problem, they threw out the bread and started again.

I've made a funny video about Rhea's at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gNB4UDGTGRo.  You'll get to see my son's reaction face!

We ordered a Chicken Katsu sandwich too -- husband says equally delish!

excerpts: Pork Katsu Sandwich:
katsu sandwich.author: Derek N.
katsu sandwich.review:
Korean Steak Sandwich: Awwwweeesome.

Pork Katsu Sandwich: Great.


This is a great place to try out different sandwiches. I really like the Korean steak sandwich after all the reviews telling me to try it. I got the pork katsu to go and it was cold, so I have to try it again when its warmer and more crunchy. 


Will definitely come back to trry the menu!

excerpts: She gets their pork katsu sandwich 2-3x/week!
katsu sandwich.author: Yan E.
katsu sandwich.review:
I came here to try their Korean steak sandwich and realized that I've been here once before to get a drink with A. My thoughts then: "Hmm. Typical corner store. Huh, people seem to be lining up for their sandwiches. :::peers at menu::: Who pays $10 for a sandwich?! No thank you."

Ah yelp, how you change my tune. I came here Saturday around 7:30pm and they were out of Korean steak sandwiches. Sad face. A's nice and ordered a sandwich anyway. On the recommendation of the guy behind the counter (hi, nice guy!), A got the roast beef sandwich. To be honest, I thought it was just another sandwich. A says you can't appreciate a really good sandwich unless you've had really bad ones; I've been spoiled by SF. A loved it. Every bite was punctuated by a moan of appreciation. The mustard, the beef, the bread, oh! It's one of the best sandwiches he's ever had. 

We came back the next afternoon so I could try the Korean steak sandwich. I'm single-minded when it comes to food: I want, I get. Apparently I got the last one of the day, score!  The steak is slightly sweet (like Korean BBQ I'm used to) and yummy; medium spiciness was perfect. Worth the $8? Yes. Would I get it every week? Not really. I talked briefly with another customer. She gets their pork katsu sandwich 2-3x/week!  

There's counter seating: 3 tall stools and 2 short stools.  Maybe it's because of A and he's got the gift of gab, but the counter people are really nice. I haven't figured out who to order from, the person by the cash register or the sandwich makers, and I did both. You may need to wait to place your order and wait for your sandwiches, but it's worth it. Cash only.

In SHORT, $10 sandwiches that may trigger an O-moment, hidden in a liquor store. 3.5 stars rounded up.

excerpts: I really wanted the pork katsu sandwich, but they said they don't make it anymore... not sure, but they said they're either expanding their kitchen or building another location somewhere?
If i'm making that up, sorry.
Anyway, I got the BBQ veggie "chicken" sandwich...
it was very good... very nicely assembled..
bread was crisp and flaky on the outside, but soft on the inside... perfect.. good proportions of everything..
good flavor...
I'll be back here to try some other sandwiches...
just didn't feel like a big meaty one this time..

If i'm making that up, sorry. im going to find out.

how come no one told me about the katsu sandwich dammit?  gonna have to go back and get one, and a 40 for my homies.

katsu sandwich.review:
Great sandwiches!

excerpts: I almost always get the Korean BBQ sandwich ($8) and sometimes the pork katsu sandwich, and you can eat it at the counter by the front window
(seats about 5?).
The service is friendly, and it takes about 10-15 minutes to make a sandwich.
katsu sandwich.author: John D.
katsu sandwich.review:
I cannot believe I haven't reviewed this place yet.  As far as sandwiches go, this is easily a 5 star place.  The Acme toasted bread: awesome.  The marinated beef: awesome.  Being able to choose how spicy: super awesome.  I'm just glad this place brings some heat where spicy is actually.. SPICY, and you can pick how spicy you want it to be.  Bunch of other stuff in there like cheese, onions, lettuce.

I almost always get the Korean BBQ sandwich ($8) and sometimes the pork katsu sandwich, and you can eat it at the counter by the front window (seats about 5?).  The service is friendly, and it takes about 10-15 minutes to make a sandwich.  They deliver in the Mission area via bicycle.

food prep area appears to be clean
service is great
parking is there

I ordered mine spicy and considered it mild.
Next time I'll ask them to kick it up a notch.

katsu sandwich.author: Russell D.
katsu sandwich.review: Hubby and I popped in here on a whim for sandwiches the other day.  I had been reading the Yelpness about this place and it was on our list.  They did not disappoint.  The katsu sandwich was outstanding.  I ordered mine spicy and considered it mild.  Next time I'll ask them to kick it up a notch.   The added bonus of delivery from here makes Rhea's a total win.  Damned good sandwiches.  Nuff said.

excerpts: they have a pork katsu sandwich that i'd like to try next.
katsu sandwich.author: Sheri N.
katsu sandwich.review:
this place is the underdog of delis.  fresh sandwiches with quality meat.  the bbq korean steak sandwich is absolutely phenomenal!  the flavors are seriously out of this world.  not a carnivore?  they have the bbq fake chicken version for you veg heads, and any typical sandwich one would crave.  they have a pork katsu sandwich that i'd like to try next.

the guys who work there are friendly and funny.  they have all the staples you need from a deli/liquor store.  

you need to try their sandwiches...they're that amazing!

The wait time was approximately 20 min which seemed a little on the long side, but well worth the wait.  I advise calling in your order ahead of time. Friendly service.

excerpts: Currently, the chicken katsu sandwich tops my Bay Area sandwich list
(I'm sure the pork is great as well).
It is perfect.
Start off with a fresh acme, role, add a crispy and rich fried chicken katsu, throw on some sweet and tangy pickled red onions and fresh coleslaw, and top it with that hot sauce
- I don't think it gets any better.
Perfectly balanced and damn good.
katsu sandwich.author: Christopher C.
katsu sandwich.review:
Limited seating, but they make some of my favorite sandwiches in SF.  I could go on and on and on about how great their sandwiches are.  

Currently, the chicken katsu sandwich tops my Bay Area sandwich list (I'm sure the pork is great as well).  It is perfect.  Start off with a fresh acme, role, add a crispy and rich fried chicken katsu, throw on some sweet and tangy pickled red onions and fresh coleslaw, and top it with that hot sauce - I don't think it gets any better.  Perfectly balanced and damn good.

katsu sandwich.review: Rhea's is keeping me in the Mission and San Francisco. So glad to have finally found a sandwich shop I love. Without a doubt my favorite meal in the city - is that wrong? Don't know what I'd do without the Katsu sandwich.

katsu sandwich.author: Zoran M.
katsu sandwich.review: Get the katsu sandwich.  A little spicy, great coleslaw, awesome breaded pork, good roll.  I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: So far, I've tried the korean steak, the panda and the miss piggy.
My favorite is the miss piggy because it comes with pesto sauce, mozerella, and it has really good flavoring.
I ordered it based on yelp reviews and they didn't have it on the menu, but they knew what it was when I asked.
I didn't know this was a vegetarian sandwich
and I really should've double checked.
Next time I'll be ordering this, but with dutch crunch & salami or some type of meat!
BUT the sandwich itself was really good even without the meat, so
I'd say try the miss piggy with meat & dutch crunch, if you love pesto like I do!
I'm definitely coming back to re-do my order next time.
miss piggy.author: Melanie T.
miss piggy.review:
Their prices have raised a bit and it's pretty similar to Ike's sandwiches now. When you enter, they have little forms on the table for you to fill out for your sandwich. 

So far, I've tried the korean steak, the panda and the miss piggy. We wanted to order the chicken katsu today, but the worker said they don't serve it at this location anymore.

My favorite is the miss piggy because it comes with pesto sauce, mozerella, and it has really good flavoring. I ordered it based on yelp reviews and they didn't have it on the menu, but they knew what it was when I asked. I didn't know this was a vegetarian sandwich and I really should've double checked. Next time I'll be ordering this, but with dutch crunch & salami or some type of meat! BUT the sandwich itself was really good even without the meat, so I'm going to say it's still a win, lol.

The Panda was my boyfriends favorite, and it was pretty packed as well. The flavoring was really intense because there was a lot going on. It comes with pastrami, salami, pepperjack, pepperocini, roasted pepper aioli, & etc! You can see why it was so intense, lol!

We ordered two korean steaks the last time we were here and it was pretty bomb. It was filled with bulgogi meat, but the sauce had an interesting spice to it that I didn't really enjoy too much. But that's just my personal preference -- my boyfriend on the other hand, liked it.

I'd say try the miss piggy with meat & dutch crunch, if you love pesto like I do! I'm definitely coming back to re-do my order next time.

excerpts: They used to have a Miss Piggy -- which is also vegetarian, in spite of the name -- but I didn't see it when I went in.
miss piggy.author: SalsaBoy S.
miss piggy.review:
Fuck.  These sandwiches are amazing.

We shared the Vegetarian BBQ (vegetarian) Chicken and the Church.  The Vegetarian BBQ is one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten anywhere.  Stu-fucking-pendous.  They ask if one wants her sandwich mild, medium, or hot.  We ordered it "hot" and it had a lovely kick.  It simply doesn't get better than the Vegetarian BBQ Chicken sandwich.  Blows the fuck out of Ike's, with better bread and better ingredients.

The Church is vegetarian chicken, Swiss cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, pepperocini, ranch, honey dijon, and garlic aioli on an Acme roll.  It was great, but of the two, the Vegetarian BBQ dwarfs the Church.  In the ordinary world of sandwiches, the Church is incredible, balanced, and perfect, but compared to the Usain Bolt of vegetarian sandwiches (Veg BBQ), it could never come in first.

They also have a Vegetarian Steak Sandwich, but they were out when we went.  They used to have a Miss Piggy -- which is also vegetarian, in spite of the name -- but I didn't see it when I went in.

The hours are tough if one doesn't live close or work in the neighborhood.  Open until 5p during the week, 6p on weekends.  I'd definitely return and even go the fuck out of my way for it.  These sandwiches are in the league all of their own.  Phenomenal.

Highly, highly recommended.

excerpts: Miss Piggy FTW.
omfgggggg.
so.
good.
miss piggy.author: AA B.
miss piggy.review:
great sandwiches, great bread, cool staff. The sandwich is wrapped tight so that all your ingredients stay together, not falling out all over the place, and the bread is never soggy. so much better than ike's. 

When I'm carnivorous I like the Dolores St. 
When I'm vegetarian: Miss Piggy FTW. omfgggggg. so. good.

excerpts: Got a Mission St (basically a reuben: pastrami, cheese, slaw, pickled jalapenos, mustard + garlic aioli held together by two fantastic slices of Tartine country loaf).
Was perfectly balanced, with each ingredient able to be distinguished without overwhelming the whole.
Salty, fatty, sweet, sour, spicy.
mission st.author: Alex K.
mission st.review:
I think I stumbled into this liquor store once while hammered because I needed some salt+vinegar chips action.  Little did I know the sandwich perfection that lay dormant inside.

Like the much-lamented Mission Burger, Rhea's transcends its humble surroundings with a decadent meat + cheese fugue.  In your mouth.  Yeah.

Got a Mission St (basically a reuben: pastrami, cheese, slaw, pickled jalapenos, mustard + garlic aioli held together by two fantastic slices of Tartine country loaf).  Was perfectly balanced, with each ingredient able to be distinguished without overwhelming the whole.  Salty, fatty, sweet, sour, spicy.  Just when you think the sandwich is lacking texture, you get a crunch of tartine crust, and all is right in the world.

It's also HUGE.  I ate the second half not because I was still hungry, but because I didn't want the mouth happiness to end.

Miles better than that famously precarious dirty sandwich shop that shall remain unnamed.

Will be back for the Korean steak sandwich.  And the pork katsu.  And the chicken katsu.  And the korean steak taco.  And the hot link.  And the Cunningham.  In the future, I'll call ahead and pick it up on my walk from the bus.
